Reviews.Title: “A full luxury condo in the city”
Reviews.Author: PaulSEA1
Reviews.Content: My first thought was don't review this, it is too good for word to get out. I booked a one bedroom suite for my wife and I to have a no-kids getaway. The room was a real full on luxury condo ready to move in. I mean full luxury kitchen with luxury appliances and quality cookware. Quality cookware as in much better than stuff you usually find in timeshares or normal long stay places. Laundry washer and dryer, check. Pool and hot tub, check. The included breakfast was quite good with fresh, not frozen pastries. I am blown away because there was so much more value here than other choices in Vancouver and there was no downside. I can only worry that prices will go up and up because for now it's a tremendous deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: skytre
Reviews.Content: We stay in Vancouver at least three times a year and have tried to get into this hotel several times. The location is very central to downtown, which is great. The staff are wonderful and the lobby looks great. The 2 bedroom suite was just ok, and seemed very basic compared to the image portrayed in th rest of the hotel. The suite was acceptable, but just a bit of a surprise that it wasnt as blinged out as the rest of the hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but not great”
Reviews.Author: travelhoundIndia
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week in a one bedroom suite. It is a pleasant hotel but one that also curiously strikes me as both sterile and idiosyncratic. For instance, the owner double parks his super expensive car by the front doors. The tiny lobby is shared with long term apartment tenants. The hotel has a dog, who stays in the lobby and has his own business card. Yet the rooms are cookie cutter drab. The service is competent but not outstanding. The location is somewhat central but the neighbour hood late at night turns shady. I don't understand why this hotel gets such high ratings, except for the fact that it is suitably priced to compensate for its shortcomings, perhaps even as much as a super expensive car would compensate for other inadequacies.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in Vancouver ever”
Reviews.Author: shovel_shot
Reviews.Content: My stay at L'Hermitage exceeded that of any other I have ever had in Vancouver. I have stayed at many of the better hotels downtown while visiting this great city over the past 15 years. The staff were extraordinarily friendly and helpful without being overbearing. A great experience I will be recommending to friends, family and business colleagues. Thank you L'Hermitage.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but the best”
Reviews.Author: Starlegs
Reviews.Content: 2 bedroom suite was amazing. All the facilities were first class and the hotel service and staff exceptional. Close proximity to all Vancouver has to offer. Certainly the place to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: sidip
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at l'Hermitage. The staff were very solicitous. On one occasion, on my way into the hotel, I asked the staff to recommend a sandwich shop in the Gastown area. When I came back downstairs 10 mins later, they had scanned web reviews and had a recommendation and map. I did not swim, but the outdoor area looked very nice. The breakfast was only ok. Our room was very quiet, but it overlooked the pool and might have been louder during warmer months. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “boutique indeed, just right”
Reviews.Author: dale_uark
Reviews.Content: Having spent 5 nights at L'Hermitage, I can't really think of any reason not to agree with most of the previous positive reviews. The staff is indeed friendly, and since we don't expect or ask for much in the way of "service," the opening of doors and a chorus of "good mornings" was about the extent of it. We did use the quite good bikes one day, and the simple reservations for them was handled quickly and easily. A personal perspective is that I can't imagine spending $17 per person for breakfast, but I noted more than a few guests did, and the breakfast room and business center are very nice, as are the terraces with the pool and several outdoor sitting areas. There are a multitude of cafes and hole-in-the-wall coffee shops within 3 minutes walk, and the grocery store on the corner (same building really) is plenty nice, too. As other reviewers do mention and as we experienced over the 5 nights, the street-front rooms can be noisy, especially if you want a little fresh air, so if that matters to you and you have the option, definitely take the rooms on the terrace side. The traffic on that street does taper off pretty well overnite, then starts picking up again around 5-6 am, so unless you want to sleep in, it's not too bad. The neighborhood is on the fringes of the serious downtown (5-10 minute walk) and the trendy warehouse district (Yaletown) is 5 minutes as well. The hotel is an easy 2 blocks or so walk from the Vancouver City Center SkyTrain station coming in from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: Nabby1973
Reviews.Content: Like others before me, I chose this hotel for our party of 5 (4 adults and 1 infant) as a result of excellent ratings on tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed. The staff were all top notch, even those with trainee name badges. The rooms were excellent, with separate showers and baths in the bathrooms. A fridge was provided too, which was great for storing milk for our daughter. We took breakfast in the hotel as the buffet was good value at $17.50 for all you wanted. The choice of foods was good and of high quality in my opinion. We didn't use the leisure facilities but I had a quick look at them and they seemed to be of high quality. The Italian restaurant attached to the hotel was very good on the night we ate there and we got a 15% discount as we were hotel guests. The location of the hotel was very good, with most down-town sights within walking or short taxi ride distance. We were able to walk to Chinatown in 15 minutes or so, to the boats for Granville island in under 20 minutes and to the main down-town shopping malls in less than 10 minutes. A cab to Queen Elizabeth Park cost us $15 between 4 of us (plus infant). Vancouver was the last stop on our 3 week tour of the Pacific Northwest and the hotel made our stay all the more memorable and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome oasis after a long day”
Reviews.Author: srnwood
Reviews.Content: We arrived at L’Hermitage after a long, late flight, and the front desk clerk greeted us by name as we walked in the door. It’s true it was nearly 2:00 a.m. and we were the last guests of the night, but still. Awesome staff at this hotel. Awesome! In town for a full week to attend a large conference, we elected to stay in this sweet boutique hotel rather than one of the big impersonal chains surrounding the convention center, and we made a brilliant choice. The walk to meetings was easy, and L’Hemitage was divine. We chose the solarium room because of the full kitchen and washer and dryer. Updated and fitted with Bosch appliances, the kitchen was a welcome oasis after a long day. Wine glasses, espresso machine, creamer in the fridge, linen napkins in the drawer, and a gas-stove top. The IGA on the corner of Richards and Robson was well stocked with all the gourmet items we could want to snack on, and the liquor store just around the block had a fabulous selection. We had everything we might possibly need in our room, including the proverbial chocolates on the pillow each night. The bed was an absolute cloud. Even though our sixth-floor room was on the street, and during this particular stay major construction of a large tower was occurring across the way, little noise entered the room. Plenty of closets, a deep bathtub, terry robes, slippers, the solarium, an extra meditation room, and a gas fireplace are some of the appreciated amenities in the room (#603). Each day, I visited the outdoor lap pool and relished the warm salt-water and arching spray. The hot tub was well maintained and so was the steam room in the woman’s restroom. The fitness center is small but again had everything I wanted. Breakfast in L’Orangerie was worth the $17 charge, especially the salmon, croissants, terrific coffee, and fresh fruit. Every day, I intended to borrow one of the hotel’s free bicycles and ride along the seawall walk and down around Stanley Park, but I never got to it! So much to see and do in this beautiful city, and the hotel’s location is close to it all. All in all, L’Hermitage is a Vancouver treasure. I’d stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We were Happy”
Reviews.Author: Teach1977
Reviews.Content: What a great place. Location was perfect for us. We stayed here. 2x during the week. First when we arrived in Vancouver, we were in Condo 705. It faced the pool. We liked the quiet of the unit. This hotel seems to have it all , Customer Service is the best. The entire staff said. Hello, or good morning, thank you for staying with us. Then we came back, after our trip to Victoria, and had room 602, facing Richards Street. There was some confusion with our reservation and we did change room, but it quickly was resolved, as a first rate hotel would handle this situation. We liked the kitchen, the washing machine, and felt comfortable in the condo like unit. every one at the front desk could answer a travel question, with a smile. This is customer service. If you are visiting Vancouver, is is the place to stay! Thank youL'hermitage for a wonder stay. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the "boutique hotel" ambiance, and the location.”
Reviews.Author: MandB56
Reviews.Content: A few small things were missing that prevent me from rating this hotel excellent. After doing some online research on Vancouver hotels, I was going to book through CAA, but then discovered the "Trip Advisor Travellers Choice Award Pkg" on the hotel website which seemed to be a better deal as it included breakfast, valet parking and 15% off in the the hotel restaurant. In hindsite I would have paid the same, as Valet parking is already complimentary to rooms with 2 guests (this according to the front desk staff when I asked them to explain the discount), and the restaurant was closed so couldn't take advantage of the 15%discount. So, the deal, isn't really a deal, but the price is still good for a downtown Vancouver hotel. The valet parking is the way to go, as the car is put in a secured parkade and you can walk pretty much anywhere you want to go. We booked the Boutique Room with the Fireplace. It faced the street so we didn't have much to look at (parkade), but didn't have a problem with noise as reported by some previous reviewers. I would imagine once construction gets underway across the street on the new Telus facility, this will become more of an issue. I would have preferred a room on the pool/garden side but was told there are no Boutique rooms on that side. I think that is the only way we would have used a balcony had we had one. The room itself was nicely appointed. Nice linens and comfortable bed. We did actually use the fireplace even though it was April! The staff in general were very pleasant and requests for extra wine glasses and pods for the Nespresso machine were handled very promptly. The large ensuite was nice, especially with 2 people getting ready at the same time. We didn't realize there would be a little fridge in the room, which was a nice bonus. The wood furniture was a little dusty, which didn't give me the warm fuzzies. The breakfast room was very nice, and the buffet had a nice variety, but the kitchen seemed to have a few issues keeping up with the supply the hot items, even though the room wasn't that busy. It was appreciated that the breakfast was available until 11:30am. Serving staff in the breakfast room were pleasant and attentive. Overall, although it met my expectations, it didn't exceed them. We would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hermitage Rooms & Service are great”
Reviews.Author: josmainmoore
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travel frequently so when we discover a great place, we want to pass it on. This hotel's service was fantastic. From the moment we walked in the door, to when we checked out, we felt pampered and taken care of. The room was amazing and the furnishings were high quality. All in we loved this hotel and will be staying here again. This hotel is a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Hermitage Monaco can learn about service from L'Hermitage Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: TorontoJP
Reviews.Content: Have been to Vancouver many, many times in a variety of hotels, including Hotel Le Soleil, Westin Bayshore, Sandman, Sheraton, Times Square and more. This was my first stay at L'Hermitage. Stayed for a week in 1 bedroom suite. Location is optimal. Service was truly exceptional. Felt more like I had several luxury condo doormen every time I walked into the hotel. Room was top-notch. Quiet, bed was perfect. It's really difficult to nitpick. Yeah, I'm going to return. Nicest surprise? Flying home I see the hotel mentioned in the Air Canada Magazine. Not sure if it was bought but take it from me: if your budget is up to $225/nt don't pick anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, quality accommodation, great location”
Reviews.Author: SurfinBilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights en-route from London to Whistler for a family ski holiday. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the serve at L'Hermitage was exceptional. All the staff were friendly and welcoming and I couldn't single out any of them above the rest - what a great team. We stayed in a Signature one bed suite with den which was of a good size and VERY well equipped. The kitchen and bathrooms (x2) were top quality. Our rate included the boutique breakfast which is one of the best you will find anywhere. Smoked salmon, scrambled eggs, home made granola etc. The hotel is located on the corner of Richards and Robson so is great for walking out into the heart of Vancouver. Attached to the hotel is a great Italian restaurant and hotel guests get 15% discount. I will definitely use the hotel again and would recommend it to anyone looking for a good base in central Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “an oasis within bustling vancouver.”
Reviews.Content: i needed some r & r for a couple days and i found quiet, deep sleeps at L'Hermitage. the staff was 'over and above' helpful. every person that i saw (concierge, maids, etc.) smiled and engaged me in conversation. they looked happy...and you can't really fake 'happy'. the room decor was modern and simple. comfortable bed. although i used the workout room, i did not use the pool or hot tub this time around. the location was a perfect jumping point to all the exploring i wanted to do. the transit system in Vancouver is so easy to understand...and affordable. however, i mostly walked...because it was sunny...and i had the time ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great city and even greater hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kay D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night after travelling into town using ViaRail's "The Canadian" from Toronto and when we checked out next day, we were sad that the stay had been so short. The first pleasant surprise was being able to check in and use the room immediately on arrival (about 10am). We had only been expecting to drop our luggage, so it was a real bonus to be able to unpack have a shower and change our clothes straight off. The stated check in time is in the afternoon, so maybe we were lucky that the room was already serviced. From the reviews we had read, we had high expectations and we were not disappointed. The room was large and well appointed, with all the amenities we could wish for, especially the very comfortable bed. In the evening we dined in the Italian restaurant which shares the same building as the Hotel and were pleased to be able to obtain a discount (15%, if I remember correctly) on presentation of our room card. The food, drink and service there were excellent too. We were not flying home until the evening of the day we checked out, so we took advantage of a late breakfast and had our baggage stored in the Hotel while we explored Vancouver centre on foot. All the good shops were within a few minutes walk and there are lots of them! The breakfast was excellent and a special mention goes to the waitresses in L'Orangerie. Great service, very polite and attentive withour being intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Rooms & Top Service”
Reviews.Author: Alex B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the L'Hermitage for 8 nights and found the rooms to be spacious, new, well appointed and homely (especially with the fireplace). The staff were extremely helpful and courteous. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staffs and great locations”
Reviews.Author: AlyxisPaige
Reviews.Content: QUICK SUMMARY PRO: 9/10 for staff. location. Breakfast. Spacious room. Quiet. CON: Internet didn't work. Found some hair on the bed when we arrived. This is not a traditional hotel. It is a shared building with residential units. Still, it was real quiet. I felt safe and overall enjoyed my stay there. When we arrived, there was no one at the Valet. After 5 minutes, we went inside - bad first impression - but they sent someone right out. The check in was fast and staffs were friendly and super helpful. We stayed in a spacious 1 bdrm w/ no kitchen. Didn't use the tub, but the shower head can use better water pressure. We found multiple hair strains on the bed though ... gross! We stayed Sunday night so the restaurant was closed. We went shopping and asked the front desk on our way out for an extra rope in our room. When we returned, the rope was hung inside the closet along with the rest, but no extra sandal. So one of us walked bare-foot to the hot tub. The turn down service was lovely: they folded out the sofa bed , turned on the fireplace, and left out chocolates. It was relaxing to come back to that after shopping on Robson St (which is located around the corner). Hot tub was great. The pool was not deep and is narrow, but we were alone, so it wasn't an issue. There were some kids from couple of floors up that was whistling and screaming at us, so that was kind of annoying. I wish we could order some drink at the hot tub, though. On our way back from dinner at almost midnight, one of us stopped at the concierge desk and chatted for a while (his name starts with a C ...?) and he gave some cool local advice about how to order alcohol the Canadian way :D Breakfast was SUPER SUPER yummy and fresh. Totally worth $17.50/person even if I had to pay -- so go eat there!!! Our main compliant was that the free wireless internet didn't really work. We all have different cells, plus an iPad, and none of us could connect. We mentioned this at check out and were told the service was down last night. The gentlemen didn't say sorry or anything .. just kind of moved on to checking us out. If I had bought work to do with me, which I usually do, it would have been a disaster -- so this is my one concern that may prevent my return. I need my internet. The bed was too firm to my liking, but that is a personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service at L'Hermitage”
Reviews.Author: Lovinthesunn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hermitage with family in a 2bdrm Signature Suite. The Suite itself is gorgeous and we were very impressed. The decor is modern without being too extreme and we all couldn't believe the size of the patio we had, it was HUGE! Our only wish was that we stayed in the summer so we could be out enjoying it. The beds were comfortable and it was great having the full kitchen along with 2 seperate bathrooms and bedrooms. Our room was quiet and the view at night was beautiful with all the lights. The location was great for walking downtown, along the fabulous Robson St for shopping and was also an easy walk back from GM Place after we attended the hockey game. We were also there for the fire alarm going off early in the morning, and while inconvenient, was not by any means the hotels fault (restaurant next door and not affiliated) but the staff went above and beyond apologizing making sure that their guests were taken care of and informed and everyone was looked after. The manager (Jean?), he was amazing had a great attitude, depsite the stress of the situation, as did the rest of his staff. I was super impressed! They offered everyone a $50 discount as a goodwill gesture and very much appreciated. The bellboys were prompt and the concierge was very helpful and it was nice they had umbrellas we could borrow for the rainy Vancouver days. Overall definitely a great stay in a beautiful hotel that was made excellent by the fabulous staff!! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A few too many problems to give anything above average”
Reviews.Author: LPH_10
Reviews.Content: We arrived from London, England to l'hermitage at a late hour. We checked in reasonably quickly and, despite a rather enthusiastic bell boy who insisted on showing me such gems of knowledge as how to work the TV, we managed to get settled in quickly and had a drink and a late night snack in a nearby bar. The hotel room itself was very good with a nice seating area in addition to large well presented bathroom and comfortable bed. Our problems all started early the next morning when we were awakened by extremely loud building work in the building opposite the hotel. After a 10 hour flight that's the last thing we needed and reported this to the Front Desk. The hotel manager, Jean(?) seemed friendly and professional, and gave us the option of either staying where we were (in the knowledge that over the weekend the building work would start later in the morning at 10.00am) or moving to another room at the back which we were informed was slightly smaller and did not have a fireplace. We opted for the latter on the basis that we would most likely need a siesta later that day to catch up on the sleep we had lost. He also deducted $30 a night off our rate and arranged for a bottle of wine to be sent to the room. This all seemed fine, but we were a bit disappointed when we got to the room. It was actually much smaller than our first room and it was missing both a fireplace and a similar seating area (just had a table and chair). It was also next to the pool and ironically we managed to get awakened by kids playing there! We also had to endure groups in nearby rooms banging on each others door and chatting outside our room (I suspect these cheaper rooms lent themselves to cheap group or family bookings). At this point the $30 deduction didn't seem much of a concession and felt simply the going rate for a much inferior room. OVerall, I would imagine that when things go smoothly, you can enjoy a good stay at this hotel; but unfortunately we didn't on this occasion

Reviews.Title: “The Best Service in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Family0fTravelers_5
Reviews.Content: If you want service, along with a luxury hotel, this is the hotel for you. The service here is absolutely amazing. From valet parking, to the concierge, to the room service, to the management. Every person that works here is service oriented. We stay at a lot of hotels, and have experienced many levels of service, and the L'Hermitage ranks up at the top. We were so impressed with the involvement of the General Manager, Glenn Eleiter. You would find him helping at the front desk or making sure guests were taken care of at breakfast. He goes above and beyond. We are more than impressed with this hotel, and will definitely stay here in the future. It is clear why L'Hermitage ranks on TripAdvisor as the best luxury hotel in Vancouver. They've earned it.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: danberney
Reviews.Content: I booked l'hermitage for a confernce with my partner joining me later, as a nice houtique hotel and was not disappointed. My initial impression was somewhat tempered by a fire alarm, which was unfortunate! As I wanted to go straight to bed! The superb reaction of the hotel was to give an immediate 50 dollar refund to all guests. That sort of behaviour inspires confidence! room was excellent, and the lounge area with fire lovely for me to work and use the free wifi. Especially nice was the help with a few problems. Thanks especially to Jean-Michelle on the front desk for giving me a charger from his collection, and being welcoming when we arrived back from a week in Whistler and letting us store our bags and offering us use of th facilities. The concierge was also extremely helpful. The hotel is not cheap, but for ease of service, location and comfort, avoiding the major chains, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Button_WestCanada
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel all around, location is perfect, nice small pool and adult hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: Flycasterwa
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the hotel, where is why we returned and will continue to. We live in Seattle and are good for at least four trips a year to Vancouver, we love the city! They get customer service, everyone, I mean everyone you encounter on the staff is friendly, welcoming and genuine. Other hotels could benefit from how the staff is trained. Clean, comfortable, quiet, well proportioned fairly priced rooms. A home away from home. Fantastic location, we frequent gas town, stanley park, DT shopping areas, the waterfront. All very close and most reasonable walking distance Excellent on premise restaurant and room service. In our last two stays we ate four times at Q4. Great vibe, great chef, great food and drink Thank you to the entire staff and team at the hotel. Special thanks to the front desk, maid staff and concierge. We accidentally left some valuables in the room upon our departure, they immediately called to alert us and the concierge just so happened to be heading to Seattle and offered to personally deliver the items. That is service! Thank you guys I hope management reviews these posts you should all be recognized! See you soon, C & M

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DDTravelNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with impeccable service. My clean, gorgeous suite had everything I could need/want for my week-long business trip. I was about 15 minutes away from the conference center (on foot). There is some noisy construction across the street, and there were two false fire alarms (which the hotel automatically refunded $50). Otherwise I had a wonderful experience here!

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Glenna E
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at L'Hermitage. Great amenities and genuine, friendly staff as well as a very convenient location. Our favourite hotel in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CatandDogBrussels
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night before returning to the east coast so probably didn't make the most of the hotels amenities as I normally would. It is however an excellent hotel conveniently located in downtown Vancouver. The rooms are comfortable and spacious and the food delightful. The fitness room is excellent although it does need to be serviced more regularly to ensure that the water is topped up etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with excellent service and close to everything in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: olivia_richardson
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel where all the staff were very friendly and helpful. The personal service at the hotel was exceptional, so much so that when we moved onto our next hotel in Whistler we were missing L'Hermitage so much. We booked a petit boutique room but were upgraded to a bigger room which was a great bonus, the room looked out onto the street but it was quiet and the room was really clean. The facilities were great, we hired out two bikes for the morning and used the outdoor pool and spa. We got to use the lounge facilities on our final day whilst waiting for our transfer to Whistler which was also good as we could use the free wifi. Management were really good too, very friendly and I felt that the hotel really had a personal touch as the management would speak to you whenevr they encountered you. Only one minor complaint (not the hotel's fault) was that on our final night there a boy on our floor pushed the fire alarm which meant everyone had to evacuate which was really annoying, especially as when we tried to get back into our room the key card didn't work and I had to go down 6 flights of stairs and outside to get back to reception to get a new card! I then had to wait for over 30 mins as the lifts were not working! We were compensated for this and got a complimentary breakfast voucher (hand delivered by the manager himself) for the next day which was really kind of the hotel. We will be back for sure - very sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Without doubt our hotel of choice!”
Reviews.Author: Travelingaustralian
Reviews.Content: We were treated amazingly well from the moment we stepped in the door - our room was upgraded to a beautiful suite, every member of staff was exceptional and this was easily the best accommodation that we spent on our 16 day trip in Canada. If we are ever back in Vancouver this is where we will be staying and we will have no hesitation in recommending the L'Hermitage Hotel to anyone and everyone we know. The ItalIan restaurant linked to the hotel was also sensational and worth every penny! Thank you for a very enjoyable stay during our Honeymoon in Canada!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Frank M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 days. It was great. Not a single complaint - wonderful room. They reception and other staff, especially for breakfast, were really nice. The pool is lovely with a nice fitness space with some free weights, weight machines, and several very nice tread mills. The concierge was also GREAT. The location is great. While this is very nice hotel, I think it is actually a value when you compare it to some of the big names nearby. We had a great time at L'Hermitage as well as Vancouver - great hotel in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “A night at the opera”
Reviews.Author: James M
Reviews.Content: We came to Vancouver from Edmonton for "The Barber of Seville" and took in a day's walking in the city. No rain! The hotel is a delight in every way, beginning with the friendly courteous staff and delicious breakfast. Coupled with its convenient location close to everything downtown, it is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Dan B
Reviews.Content: Our stay at L'Hermitage was a great experience in all aspects. The Signature Suite was was beautifully appointed, the staff was very friendly and helpful, and the buffet breakfast was excellent. All at a reasonable price. Note that there is a building under construction across the street, and this could be bothersome at times, but wasn't a problem during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great location, beautiful room--AMAZING Service!”
Reviews.Author: mom2three70
Reviews.Content: Wow! I loved my stay here. We had a 2 room suite. I was traveling with my kids and my parents for spring break. We had 2 nights in Vancouver before moving on to Whistler & skiing. I wish we could have stayed here longer than 2 nights. I have stayed in Vancouver before with my husband. We stayed at the Pan Pacific Vancouver and it was a very nice experience too. The views at the PPV were awesome, but I think I might prefer to stay at L'Hermitage again the next time we are in BC, and CERTAINLY if we are traveling with our kids, I would, no doubt, choose LH over PPV. The suite was modern, CLEAN, and well appointed--they had EVERYTHING, including full kitchen with all equipment, washer/dryer, separate study, HUGE balcony. My kids LOVED the heated pool, and I enjoyed the hot tub. My only slight complaint is that there was construction going on nearby and they started fairly early in the morning. I knew to expect the construction because there was a sign when I checked in. The construction was supposed to begin at 7:30, but I was woken up by noise before that. I mentioned that to the front desk in the morning as I was borrowing some umbrellas for the day. I wasn't super upset about it, and I didn't make a fuss or anything, but the manager bent over backward to make up for the inconvenience. He gave us a discount and breakfast vouchers. He went above and beyond, especially since the construction was not under his control in any way. Breakfast was wonderful, and a table was waiting for us when we went down that morning. The concierge was also wonderful. He gave us several tips on where to go to eat and when we told him we were going to the aquarium, he gave us coupons. He was also very helpful the next day before we left for Whistler. He gave us coupons to use at the Capilano suspension bridge and in Whistler. He even called the place we were staying in Whistler for us to make sure that we knew exactly where to go to check in when we got there. The service was just amazing, and I am used to staying at places with great service--when we travel we usually stay at Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton’s, Pan Pacific’s, Waldorf Astoria properties, etc. I would definitely go back, and I would definitely recommend L'Hermitage!

Reviews.Title: “En route to Whistler”
Reviews.Author: YogaGurlHawaii
Reviews.Content: We explored Vancouver from this centrally located boutique hotel for three days. Excellent front desk service, friendly staff, knowledgeable concierge and self-described "foodie" who knows his stuff. Returned to LUPO a few blocks away for expensive but delicious Italian food. Rooms are clean, great beds, pillows, linens, sunken tub, awesome patios (though it never stopped raining and the construction project across the street starts EARLY!!! Constant construction noise was our only complaint about L'Hermitage.) Great little gym, awesome rooftop hot tub and beautifully lit pool on a cold winter's night. Dog lovers will enjoy all the pets being walked from the residential tower. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Vancouver Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SusanK58
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at L'Hermitage and we love it there...the rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated, the whole hotel is lovely and very clean. The staff are all friendly and helpful, and the hotel has all the ammenities you could ask for, including PVR tv and free WiFi. Definitely recommend this hotel when staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel! AMAZING Stafff!”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerJP
Reviews.Content: I booked with this hotel based on online reviews and was NOT dissapointed!! My partner and I were celebrating our 7 year anniversary, and from the moment we arrived, we were treated in a warm,inviting professional manner. The gentleman that helped with our bags took the extra time to show us all the features of the room, which was a nice touch. Even as we were leaving staff made sure to tell us that some streets were blocked off due to a parade, and what the best route would be to take out of the city. Attention to detail is everywhere in this hotel, from the modern classy decor, to the extra embellishments such as comforting electric fireplaces in the rooms. Even their shampoo and conditoner was excellent, which I never generally use in hotels but forgot to pack some this time. Even a wonderful sent is projected into the public areas, which gives it a little extra touch of class. The Nespresso machines in the rooms are also great. It made me want to buy one! The breakfast was amazing, and the atmosphere in the L'ORANGERIE lounge was very realxed. Once again the staff there were amazing. They always made sure you were taken care of in a polite friendly manner. We tried out Q4 for dinner the night we arrived and were blown away by the flavor of their dishes. All around my husband and I were very happy with L'Hermitage, and have already planned on returning!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: MarkSydAust
Reviews.Content: We arrived for 2 nights on a direct flight from Sydney to Vancouver. We arrived at the hotel about 9:30am so were not expecting a room until later that afternoon. The check in was wonderful! We were taken to a lounge while a room was arranged and we were in our room by 10am after a complimentary coffee. The staff were always friendly & helpful. The room was exceptional. We loved our stay and look forward to when we will stay again next time we are in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel in a central position”
Reviews.Author: VWSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night but the hotel was great and the recommendations from the concierge were spot on. A great boutique choice in central Vancouver. Say hello to Hippo the hotel dog.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Wendy K
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! The suite was terrific and the service outstanding. The hotel was within easy walking distance of numerous excellent restaurants and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneTriathlon
Reviews.Content: A simply amazing hotel. From the minute we arrived the staff and service were wonderful. Helpful, attentive, gracious, discrete. Without doubt the best hotel service I have experienced anywhere. Our room was beautiful, spacious and spotlessly clean. Super comfortable beds and a large bathroom. Great room facilities, free WiFi, proper coffee making facilities, everything we needed. Breakfast was served in the dining room and was an absolute treat. The concierge is an absolute master at his profession. He helped arrange sightseeing, dining, and tickets to the hockey. Every recommendation was first class. The location is perfect, close to shopping, dining and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hermitage is all about service - a very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingPenguin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hermitage for two nights over a weekend in early March. Overall, our stay was excellent. The hotel is extremely clean and comfortable, with thoughtful touches like slippers for your stay and a wine key in the fridge. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was very serviceable and comfortable. I liked that the toilet is separated from the bathroom by a door, and the bathroom was generally thoughtfully laid out. I did not have a chance to take a soak in the tub, but it looked mighty nice. As other reviewers have said, service is exactly what sets L'Hermitage apart. The staff is helpful and friendly, and it felt very genuine. Overall, if you like attentive and friendly service in a clean hotel with a great location (and I thought that the price was very reasonable!), this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Surprizingly Nice with great Local”
Reviews.Author: joemuscle
Reviews.Content: We would definetely highly recommend this hotel for service,great rooms and great amenties..we went to see a hockey game with a very convienence to the arena and the downtown core this hotel brings alot to the table. The Italien restaurant El Centro next door offers awesome food and dinning. Highly recommend L'Hermitage to everyone..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JRoss23
Reviews.Content: This is the second year that I have stayed at this Hotel for my husband’s birthday. The staff makes his experience so special and keeps us coming back. If I could recommend this hotel to everyone I would! You will not be disappointed with any part of this Hotel. L'Hermitage provides an experience of a 6 star hotel and made us feel like royalty. The room as stunning, the service is amazing and the atmosphere is modern and chic. You are in the best location located in the heart of downtown with Yaletown being right next door, as well as a short walk to the aqua bus to Grandville Island. This Boutique Hotel is a must to stay at if you want an extraordinary Vancouver experience. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience at L'Hermitage.”
Reviews.Author: JudyLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel on TripAdvisor and had high expectations. However, the experience at the hotel was well beyond anything I was expecting. The level of service and friendliness along with the elegant suite that we enjoyed made an experience that couldn't have been better. All of the staff was totally professional and always went beyond what normally would be attentive service. They even knew our names and would greet us as we left and returned; they provided extra services with cheerfulness and charm. All of the staff was excellent but I'll single out the manager, Jean-michel Tanguy, who couldn't have been more responsive and proactive when we had some special needs during the course of our stay at the hotel. If you want pampering in a well-located hotel in the downtown area you couldn't do better.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Warren H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Vancouver for our 10th anniversary, and based on the reviews in Trip Advisor, I decided to get a suite at L'Hermitage. The reviews did not disappoint, and neither did the hotel. From check-in until check-out, the service was impeccable. We were upgraded to a suite with a fully equipped kitchen, with lots of room. Raymond and the rest of the concierges were excellent, providing us with great restaurant recommendations and providing advice on various excursions we were looking into. L'Hermitage is a gem of a hotel, and we would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: kenarsen
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel and thought it was a great value. We found it on Trip Advisor and as always we were not let down. The staff was great, the location was great and the rooms were perfect. I would stay there again and recommend this hotel to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Comfortable stay at the L’Hermitage”
Reviews.Author: PeteandSiobhan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the One Bedroom Boutique Suite for 3 nights at the L’Hermitage. The room was so spacious, clean and comfortable, and tastefully decorated. The beautiful fireplace certainly added to the ambience in the room, and definitely kept it nice and warm. The bed was huge and very comfortable, and although we were on the corner, we couldn’t hear any outside noise. The bathroom was also very large with fantastic amenities. The bottle of wine and snacks were a thoughtful gift for our honeymoon. Wi-fi signal was a little touch and go – we found that if you moved closer to the door it was stronger. We highly recommend breakfast in L’Orangerie restaurant – the fresh salmon and free range scrambled eggs were very tasty. Concierge and all the staff at the hotel were all so friendly – the complimentary use of umbrellas on a winter day was a nice touch. We highly recommend staying at L’Hermitage and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “High Trip Advisor rating well deserved !”
Reviews.Author: 8Yves
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed ; very comfortable Boutique room with fireplace , very roomy , high ceilings, fireplace, comfortable bed, nice roomy bath and shower with seperate bathroom. Very professional front desk staff. Complimentary Nespresso coffee in the room which we replenished multiple times at no cost. What more do you need being right on the corner of Robson street in downtown Vancouver ? So would definitely stay again - this is a very well managed hotel that deserves its excellent TripAdvisor rating !

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly staff but prefer a balcony and view.”
Reviews.Author: MomVL
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean, the bed is very comfortable and if you keep your windows shut it's fairly quiet until the construction starts across the street, just before 7 am. My husband booked their parking and breakfast package for $215. Breakfast is served until 10.30 and checkout is at noon. The lobby is not really suitable for sitting or visiting other guests, but there is a small library with two computers and two small seating areas that can be used for this. The breakfast was fairly simple with yogurts, fruit, scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages. There are pre-made waffles for you to toast, along with some other pastries, bagels and toast. You also are allowed one espresso or latte, besides regular coffee or OJ. Vancouver is such a beautiful city, and I thought it was a shame to stay somewhere where you don't have a balcony or view of mountains and water. They do offer you free bikes and if you walk or bike down Richards six blocks you end up in George Wainborn Park. From there you can walk or bike for miles along False Creek - a much better location for a hotel IMO. The pool and hot tub are a long walk outside from the little gym - very cold in the winter if you are wearing your bathing suit. The next time we wore the slippers and robes from our room. So poorly designed!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: binky_2012
Reviews.Content: We booked in here after a sleepless night elsewhere in downtown Vancouver and had a wonderful experience. The location couldn't really get much more central, just between W Georgia and Robson. The room was fantastic with a really luxurious bathroom and despite the fact that we knew there was demolition work going on at the end of the block because we'd walked past it, there was absolutely nothing audible from our room. We had a wonderful nights sleep in a really comfortable bed and will definitely be back next time we're in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Carlystar
Reviews.Content: From arriving at the hotel with the concierge being right on the footpath to help with my bags to leaving 3 days later this hotel exceeded my expectations. We arrived early however our room was ready and check in was speedy and efficient. The room was large and spacious. It was nice after travelling for 6 weeks to have a lounge room and separate bedroom to spread out and enjoy our stay. It was immaculately clean. The bathroom was huge with the shower separate to the bath and a huge mirror. I really enjoyed the Nespresso machine and free wifi that they provided. They had a business centre and I thought the library was a nice touch for guests. Location was great within 15 min walk from everything we wanted to see or to the pier to catch the ferry to grouse mountain.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn J
Reviews.Content: Many companies could learn a lot about customer service from the staff at L'Hermitage. Best hotel I have ever stayed at. Centrally located and easy to get anywhere in downtown Vancouver. I hesitated to write here as I think more people will want to book rooms here and one day I'll try and they will be full when I need one! Also, to make me feel more at home in Vancouver they try to always give me the same room! How cool is that? And be sure to take your swim suit. I stayed at L'Hermitage, on business, in February and I went for a swim in the salt water pool and for a dunk in the hot tub! (Both heated, of course).

Reviews.Title: “Second to none”
Reviews.Author: HillJas
Reviews.Content: I have been fortunate to travel extensively and can't praise this place highly enough. From check-in to check-out the service was exceptional. The room was modern, clean and had all mod-cons including complimentary WiFi (really do hotels need to charge for this in 2012?). Walking distance to Waterfront, Yaletown and Gastown. Even the buffet breakfast was reasonably priced for a boutique hotel. I'd definitely stay again if I was in Vancouver - might get to try out the heated lap pool if the weather was better.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel i've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: geoffcollins
Reviews.Content: I was doing a week's business trip and eould normally chase the points, but decided to give this a try. You won't be disappointed. I got an upgrade on check in to an amazing room on the 7th floor. It had a kitchen area all in stainless steel. A nice touch was the nespresso machine. The room also had a little study room with desk. The main room had a fire, dining tabke and massive bed. Seriously lovely. Breakfast was in a sort of drawing room /lounge / breakfast room. It was a great brekkie. Great eggs, local smoked salmon, waffles... great service. My only regret is I was there for just one night.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Suite in Ideal Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellinMumBerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in February and had 2 of the 1 bedroom signature suites for our family of 5. This chic, boutique hotel is ideally situated 5 minutes walk from the shopping streets and malls of downtown Vancouver (Granville St etc) and about 15 minutes walk from the fantastic eateries of Yaletown and 1 minute from the magnificent library. The decor and ambience are classically elegant. The rooms are extremely comfortable and luxurious with a stunning and well equipped kitchen area and in suite laundry. Valet parking was very handy and it was an easy hotel to find when driving. I almost would give a 5 rating but there were a few things I look for that were not quite perfect. The floor of one of the kitchens wasn't entirely clean (old raisin or something trodden on),the bathrooms felt a little cramped with limited shelf space, some of the linen was a little worn, and there is no view. We looked onto Richards St, which made the rooms a little dark. Admittedly it was cloudy and raining throughout our stay which would have exaggerated the dark, so that may not usually be an issue. Please bear in mind these are very minor considerations, just enough that I have gone for a 4 over 5 rating. The lounge, kitchen area are a great asset and make the suites a wonderfully comfortable base from which to go out and explore Vancouver. We found the rooms lovely and quiet with no street noise at all. The concierges were exceptionally helpful with recommendations of what to do and where to go and the staff really do go the extra mile. I would certainly stay again if back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Shell M
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I had a wonderful stay at L'Hermitage in February 2012! We were greeted, in the very modern and chic lobby, by Glen the Hotel Manager who was more than accomodating. Our room was lovely and spacious with an extremely comfortable king size bed, a cozy fireplace and a balcony. We had complimentary robes enabling us to enjoy the heated pool and jacuzzi in comfort. Every aspect of this hotel delivers a very new and fresh feel and I must add is EXTREMELY clean (which is essential for me). The location of this hotel is central to eveything and is within walking distance to wonderful restaurants, shopping and many of Vancouver's sites! The staff were friendly and more than helpful throughout our entire stay. L'Hermitage is definetly rated #1 for a reason and will remain on our "only place to stay in Vancouver" list! If I could give this hotel a higher rating than excellent, I certainly would - if you are coming to Vancouver, look no further for a hotel, L'Hermitage will NOT disappoint! We will be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Our new fav Van hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mlaw423
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at empire landmark on robsons for about $120/night but decided to upgrade to l'hermitage per all the TA reviews. It was $220 but included free parking and breakfast, $60 value, so true cost was about $160 and was well worth the difference over landmark. Incredible service, great rooms, sweet outdoor pool/hot tub (even in the rain) and great location. Def lived up to the #1 hotel rating. We'll be staying here from now on...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: abs57
Reviews.Content: I am long overdue to write this review. My husband and I were at L’Hermitage last June and enjoyed our stay very much. The location is very central – easy walk to a ton of great restaurants, in particular in the Yaletown neighborhood, and an easy drive to many attractions. The room was modern, clean and spacious. The bathroom was huge and very swanky. Bed was heavenly. There was even a good size balcony. Only room disappointment was that the fireplace seemed like it was more for show and didn’t really have the ambience/warmth we were expecting. So don’t feel like you have to splurge for the fireplace, I didn’t think it was worth it. The pool and hot tub on the roof are FABULOUS (and romantic!), definitely a huge bonus and one of the reasons we initially chose to stay at L’Hermitage. During the early part of our stay, the valet damaged our car (apparently we were only the 2nd guests this had ever happened to, lucky us I guess!). What could have potentially ruined our entire stay and been handled in a thousand wrong ways, was in fact handled the one right way, beyond what we could have imagined. We were so impressed by the customer service and I only wish other hotels could take note. I need to mention Glenn and Jean-Michele, who were so prompt and sincere in following up with us and making sure everything was taken care of – your kindness and generosity did not go unnoticed!! And thanks also to Raymond, a fabulous concierge – the hotel is very lucky to have you! Despite the hiccup, we would not hesitate for a second to return to L’Hermitage. If you are looking for a chic hotel in a central location in an amazing city with plenty of comforts and niceties, and a hotel staff that genuinely cares about their guests and knows the true meaning of customer service, look no further. We hope to be back someday!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection at every turn, service, rooms, food etc etc!”
Reviews.Author: bwilliams300
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our 2 weeks at whistler, and everything was perfect. Everyone was so helpful and lovely. We will be back soon. Hopefully hippo will be back also !

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: mrbenjie
Reviews.Content: Believe all the reviews this is a fantastic hotel, great situation for shops and food, the staff are brilliant and the service is wonderful, I have run out of words to express our delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's best kept secret !”
Reviews.Author: rj_watters
Reviews.Content: WOW is all I have to say about this hotel .... A must if in Vancouver,great location, great staff, great place to relax only regret was checking out !

Reviews.Title: “Sweet two bedroom suite”
Reviews.Author: artslover
Reviews.Content: This hotel has what appears to be a rare thing in central Vancouver: a two bedroom suite. The two bedroom suite, like the other suites in the hotel, has a full and well equipped kitchen as well. Added to that, the two bathrooms makes this as roomy as an apartment but with all the amenities of a hotel. The biggest bonus is the extremely large furnished balcony which overlooks the pool and there is another small balcony just off the dining area. It was perfect for entertaining friends and relatives during our stay. The other amenities include clean, comfortable beds, marble jacuzzi bath, flat screen tv in each bedroom as well as one in the sitting area with HD satellite programming, complimentary wifi & high-speed internet, iPod docking station, electronic safe, iron and full-length ironing board, bathrobes, coffee machine, and fireplace. There’s even a washer and dryer. Large windows make the living area bright even on a cloudy day, although there is not much of a view. We were looking at a wall of the performing arts centre, the fifth floor pool area and other hotel room balconies. My one complaint about the rooms was the lack of shelf space in the bathrooms. The hotel offers the usual fitness centre, a number of machines crowded into a small room. As already mentioned, there’s a pool and hot tub. The restaurant, Q4 al Centro, offers very good Italian dishes. The location on the border between downtown and Yaletown and away from the water can be good or less convenient depending on what you want to do. Despite the lack of a scenic view, the location, for us, worked well. We were without a vehicle but could go on longer walks to Stanley Park and Granville Island (via the Aquabus), and easily walk to many shops and restaurants. Our daughter walked two short blocks to get the bus to the university. The price was very good compared to waterfront hotels. We plan to return when the weather is warmer so we can make use of the balcony and the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Superb - the best”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at L'Hermitage, staying in a Signature Suite. The hotel and staff are top notch. The room was excellent and the housekeeping service was out of this world. Returning each day from a busy day we were greeted with a newly serviced room and each night came back to re-made beds, soft playing music, the fire lit and chocolates on the pillows (much to our kid's delight). We didn't make a lot of use of hotel staff generally as we research and plan our trips extensively, but L'Hermitage staff were really helpful and throughtful, even offering us umbrellas on one morning it was raining. Hotel is in a superb location and easy walking distance from everything. A must for restaurants: Guu Garlic (Robson Street), Go Fish (Granville Island) and Meat and Bread (for the best sandwiches in the world). Granville Market is excellent with the most amazing veg. Capilano and Grouse Mountain were excellent - use the free shuttle to Capilano, from waterfront. Transport connections are EASY we caught the Sky Train from Waterfront to YVR and it only cost $13.75 for four of us, and only took about 1/2 hour.

Reviews.Title: “They understand customer service”
Reviews.Author: yastreb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a business trip to beautiful Vancouver. I would have given this hotel 5 stars except for one thing: it's only 7 stories- floors 5-7 of an apartment building- and if street noise bothers you, look elsewhere at one of Vancouver's many high rise hotels. However, the L'Hermitage staff were outstanding and quickly moved me to a slightly quieter room on a less busy street than Robson when I explained I was a light sleeper. Other than this the hotel is just great: staff go out of their way to please guests, rooms are absolutely lovely with big bathrooms and soaking tubs. The hotel in general is hip, clean, and gorgeous. Everything you need is nearby including an IGA grocery, all sorts of restaurants, transport, shopping. Its a few blocks from the Skytrain to the airport. Has a beautiful outdoor heated pool and hot tub and very nice gym. I did not eat at the restaurant so can't comment on that. I wouldn't stay here again only because of the street noise, but would defintely recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Rosa S
Reviews.Content: I usually do not take the time write a review about a hotel as they usually do not stand out to me. I was so happy with my experience at this hotel I just have to say something. I planned a really nice birthday surpise for my boyfriend. It was amazing, service was fantastic, hotel room was beautiful. I don't have really anything to complain about. Thank you for making my boyfriends birthday the best birthday he has ever had.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again and again.”
Reviews.Author: Scott_Simmons
Reviews.Content: At first I thought the price of the stay was a bit much, however I wanted to have a special 4 days with my wife and daughter and having a kitchen available to us in the center of the city was an important feature so I decided to go with the L'Hermitage Hotel. From the time of my arrival, I was impressed. The room was fantastic, the service even better. The staff makes you feel wonderful and ensures that you have what you need. We were very comfortable the entire time we stayed. The location in the city feels safe, and is close to everything that we wanted to see and do. The only thing I would suggest for the hotel is to put a small dining table in the room. With a small child, having a table would have made meal time great. We struggled with our meal time as we needed to use the coffee table as our dining table.

Reviews.Title: “One of Life's Sweet Indulgences”
Reviews.Author: CryptoCow
Reviews.Content: For special occasions, or for when my wife and I want to indulge in a weekend with a show, dinner, and relaxation, we will pick a nice hotel and plan a weekend. For Valentine's this year my wife wanted to stay at L'Hermitage. We found L'Hermitage to be an exquisite boutique luxury hotel. There are equally excellent luxury hotels in Vancouver, such as the Shanghai. But what is nice about L'Hermitage is that the service is a little more personable because of its size. We thoroughly enjoyed our short stay. It might not seem that significant, but I was impressed that the hotel designed its suites with everyone in mind, and I mean those with disabilities. All doors, including the bathroom, were wide enough for wheel chairs, and the bathroom with ample space for wheel chairs to move around. That means to me that all guests are well consider and accommodated for. The other thing I found was there was the service was a bit more personable. When I had booked our stay I ordered a few things for our room. After registering, when we arrived at our room a staff member was there waiting to bring our requests in, and politely asked for permission to place them in our room. Nice touch. L'Hermitage is in a great location as well, close to restaurants, theatres, Roger's Arena, and BC Place. One very, very, minor point I would advise the hotel about for the smaller boutique rooms is about the kettle you provide for boiling water, such as for tea. In the boutique rooms, at least, you need to find a plug in. There was none obvious on the furniture piece with the fridge and T.V. We had to use another outlet with the kettle on the floor. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Elsa3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days, starting at Christmas. We had a full bedroom, office, living room with fireplace, full kitchen and two bathrooms. This hotel is perfect for singles, couples or families! It has all of the luxury furnishings, rainfall shower heads and high-end kitchen appliances. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. When we needed a baking sheet while preparing Christmas dinner, the hotel staff dropped it off at our door. We also arrived before our room was ready so the staff placed all of our groceries in the room fridge. The room also includes a washer/dryer and balcony. All of this is approximately the same price as staying at a 5 star hotel in Van. We travel to Van multiple times per year, and we will never stay at another hotel again. We don't have enough good things to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Jan206
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at l'Hermitage and enjoyed our stay. Friendly staff, nice room and large bathroom. We also had a small balcony with table/chair. They provide loaner umbrellas and also bicycles. (Didn't use the bikes as we walked to Stanley Park, BCPlace Stadium and restaurants.) We also used the outdoor spa and lap pool and checked out the nice workout room. The Vancouver Art Gallery and trendy shopping are both within easy walking distance. Hotel restaurant is a bit pricey considering it's not a linen tablecloth space, but the food was good. Variety of restaurants nearby as well as an IGA grocery store and Starbucks. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved l'Hermitage!”
Reviews.Author: Aims_25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel per and post our Whistler ski trip. After comparing many hotels and reviews I picked this one and was not disappointed! The location is fantastic. We walked to Gastown, Yale town, and even rented bikes and rode around Stanley park and Granville Island. The Quattro restaraunt downstairs is fantastic and it is an easy walk to loads of local spots- I recommend Cafe Medina on Beatty st for breakfast but get there early on the weekend and also Flying Pig in Yaletown. The Lennox Pub on Robson St is great for a beer and cheap eats. The best thing about L'Hermitage is by far the service. The staff were friendly, helpful and full of information. On our first stay they gave us a free upgrade, allowed us to check in early as our flight arrived early am - and they have an excellent lounge which we used while waiting for our Whistler transfer. On our second stay which was three nights we recommended friends to stay at the same hotel and their feedback was excellent too. The petite rooms are actually quite large. Service was again fantastic and on finding out that our flight didn't leave until nearly midnight we asked for late checkout. Even though the hotel was booked out after just a short while they had worked a miracle and arranged for us have our room as long as we needed. In short I would whole heartedly recommend L'Hermitage. My only disappointment was that I didn't get to meet Hippo. I guess that means that I'll have to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Doheya
Reviews.Content: Great spot, friendliest staff I have ever encountered. rooms are beautiful and clean. will defenetly be back. this hotel lives up to expectations . only disappointed was that hippo wasnt there for the duration of our stay/

Reviews.Title: “Excellent cutlery!”
Reviews.Author: bilbo8
Reviews.Content: Every aspect of L'Hermitage is exemplary. The 15m outdoor lappool is warm enough to swim in on Feb 5 at 0630. The rooms are a remarkable value--I came with my son and his girl on the way to ski at Whistler. We could have stayed in Vancouver! Hooded gas stove (Braun), cappuccino machine, Sub-Zero fridge, even the cutlery was to die for. Raymond the concierge is enthusiastic about his job and made us a last minute reservation at a hard-to-get restaurant. Breakfast in L'Orangerie was great, and every person was both friendly and efficient. It is in the shadow of the Westin, but I've been in Westins. It's also just 4 blocks and an easy walk from BC Place stadium. One more thing, I slept like a baby on the sofa bed, it didn't have that bar jabbing into your back that usually makes them a pain.

Reviews.Title: “its earned the no. 1 spot”
Reviews.Author: abhishekmehra
Reviews.Content: this hotel has the charm, hospitality and location. the staff are very pleasant and helpful and have great personalized concierge service. the rooms were clean and greatly priced for the money. the only dissapointment was hippo was on vacation.... its the french bulldog on staff, a must see for next time!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay anywhere else in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer0001
Reviews.Content: I've made it a habit of always staying at the #1 rated hotels and eating at the #1 rated restaurants wherever I go and, once again, Trip Advisor made my trip again! L'Hermitage Hotel was absolutely perfect for my group of 4 (we stayed in the 1,100 sq ft Signature Suite). The staff was courteous and efficient, going above and beyond. The Food Concerige was very helpful, even staying after his shift was over to help my friends and I pick out the perfect restaurants for our stay (he didn't tell us it was after his shift....he was carrying his bag and had his coat on and overheard us discussing where we should eat and he just offered to help...amazing). If you don't feel like venturing out in the morning for breakfast, their lounge has a really good buffet. The lounge also has cheese/fruit plates and a nice wine selection for a low-key afternoon/evening by the fire. The location is perfect. We didn't get in our cars once. I didn't personally use the Spa but someone in my party did and was raving about it. It's stylishly-decorated (fabuous, even). I really can't say enough about this place. There's a reason it's rated #1!

Reviews.Title: “Worth its top rating!”
Reviews.Author: Skib99
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and picked it based solely on the TripAdvisor reviews. Wow, I loved it! The doormen were always ready with a smile and the foyer is very elegant. I was alone but had a huge room (loved the fireplace) and gigantic bathroom. The concierges were just great. They helped me with transport options to both Victoria and to Whistler (plus for my son as well) and while I took my time going back and forth over all the ferry/float plane/bus/taxi choices, they were very, very patient - and then booked it all for me. The lounge area on the 5th (?) floor is very elegant and I was extremely appreciative of the free use of the computers/internet in the business center (especially so as the Westin at Whistler charged outrageous internet rates when I was there a few days later).The only problem I had was that the heating in my room wasn't working properly, and a second visit from a handyman was required, but then it did kick in (very noisily, unfortunately). The pool area is beautiful, but with the snow in January it was just too cold to try out! I highly recommend this hotel and wish I had been there with my hubby as it has a very romantic feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome place”
Reviews.Author: Mervlehr
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in January loved it great location service was top notch arrived at midnight stag was outside to open cab door and help with luggage. Will defently be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but stupidly expensive breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: wildthing271
Reviews.Content: After a weekend of leisure, I was reluctant to move from the Hampton Inn where I had a massive room and was very comfortable. But as all my colleagues were staying at L'Hermitage, I had to move. So I was pleasantly surprised when the reception agent informed me I had been upgraded to a suite. And for the 2nd time in 3 days my jaw dropped. Another hotel, and another suite larger than my flat at home! There was a lounge area, with 2 large armchairs and a sofa, plus a faux fire place. There was a sizeable dining table, and an adjacent kitchen, with a 4 hob cooker, a microwave, dishwasher and possibly the largest refridgerator I have ever seen. The bed room was also large, with an exit on a balcony, and with a massive walk in wardrobe. Both the bedroom and living room had flat screen TVs - I could only get the one in the living room to work, but there was a massive choice of channels. The bathroom was surprising small - but the tub was very deep so a good soak could be enjoyed, There was no seperate shower - you had to stand in the tub to shower - but the quality of towels and amenties was excellent. My gripe with the bathroom was the size - the room was small, and there was no storage space for toiletries, razors etc. WiFi was available across the property and was free of charge. Location is good - 2 blocks from the Skytrain, Gastown 4 blocks, and half a block from Robson Street. The only gripe I had was breakfast, which cost C$17.50 plus tax. This is ALOT of money and I would have expected a top notch buffet for that money. What there was available was good - excellent scrambled egg, but for me, it simply not value for money. I had breakfast each day, largely to catch up with my colleagues ahead of the days activities, but if I had been on my own, I'd have been in White Spot around the corner! 4 blobs as a rating seems harsh for such an excellent - but for the price paid I needed more space in the bathroom, a working TV in the bedroom, and a more sensible price for breakfast. Otherwise - excellent.

Reviews.Title: “The service, the service, the service!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole F
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a 3 week family trip to the US and Canada. Our final stop was Vancouver and we wanted it to be special. From the moment we arrived at L'Hermitage we knew we had made the right choice! We were made to feel so welcome and the kids especially cherished their special gift to always remember the hotel by. Your bags are not just delivered to your room, you are given a thorough rundown of all your amenities which include a great coffee machine! The Concierge was invaluable with suggestions on restaurants that would be suitable for families. The breakfast was fabulous value for the quality, with possibly the nicest serving staff we have ever come across. I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel and would recommend anyone stopping in Vancouver for any length of time to stay at L'Hermitage.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Pets”
Reviews.Author: SoundgirlM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few months ago, but just getting around to revewing now. L'Hermitage was amazing. Reasonably priced and great for someone who has a dog. Most places frown on leaving your dog alone in room if you want to step out for a quick dinner. There was a welcoming gift for my pup and she loved it! Service was quick with everything we requested. Can't imagine for price/service/location I will find a better place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: jaizee
Reviews.Content: I will just add on to all the previous reviewers and say that L'Hermitage is a fantastic hotel. The rooms are very nice, especially the bathrooms (which are large and have a separate soaking tub and shower). The location seems well-situated; walking distance to Gastown, Yaletown, Robson Street, and with access to public transportation if needed. The lounge area on the 5th floor is great, and the breakfast served at L' Orangerie is well-done for a small buffet. I could go on and on...I just didn't find any flaws with the hotel. But above all, it's the service that really makes L'Hermitage shine. Everyone is incredibly attentive...for lack of a better way of saying it, everyone is just really well-trained. They anticipated every need before I even had to ask. If I was near the elevator and any staff member was nearby, they would immediately swipe in their card for me so I didn't have to look for mine; at L'Orangerie, they brought extra napkins when they saw that I had a baby with me; the concierge reminded us to make reservations for dinner since we were there on a Friday night during Dine Out Vancouver, and he thought it would be hard for us to find a table with a group of our size (7). Speaking of the concierge, we asked so much of the concierges that we thought they would ask us to leave and never come back! But they were always gracious with every request. Everyone in my group just kept saying, if we were to return to Vancouver, we would definitely stay at L'Hermitage again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: GGDylan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went with a group of friends last week and had a great stay at L'Hermitage Hotel. Not only did the hotel have really nice and clean rooms, but the service was perfect. The concierge Raymound and David really provided excellent suggestions and helped with all of our bookings for restaurants, car rentals, spa appointments, and etc. The location was central and many of the neighborhoods we visited were within walking distance. It wasn't necessary to have a car at all because of the location. We would definitely stay at this hotel again when we return to Vancouver for another trip!

Reviews.Title: “Holy pool”
Reviews.Author: Tracyggggg
Reviews.Content: The jacuzzi and pool were such a nice highlight to trip. Each hotel room has robes you can us; so you're comfy cozy moving from the pool to the jacuzzi. When floating around the pool, I could see travellers from other hotels longing to be able use L' hermitage resources

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Hector L
Reviews.Content: Superb room, large bathroom, excellent service, great location, incredible price, very friendly staff specially the concierge dog!

Reviews.Title: “Professional experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeff N
Reviews.Content: I have chosen this hotel to be my favorite in downtown Vancouver because of the large hotel rooms, classy lobby and hallway appearance and it's central location. The business centre and breakfast dining area are perfect to reserve business discussions. Well done and I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: lotstoseeanddo
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights after a 10 hour flight. the check in was fast and problem free, the room was very nice, bathroom quite small but well appointed but the best was the heated outdoor pool right amongst all the sky scrapers. we had breakfast which was excellent and great value at $17 a head. the staff we met were very good. the only problem for me was that we stayed at the Georgia after travelling to whistler for a few days. dont get me wrong, the L'hermitage is very good but the Georgia was in a totally different league and i would stay at the latter every time. it is much more expensive however but, for me, it was so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “well deserved first place in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: dcm79
Reviews.Content: EXCEPTIONAL service ~ nothing less. A fantastic position, and beautifully appointed, functional rooms. I normally stay at the Opus when I'm in Vancouver, but after reading the reviews here, I decided to try out this one instead for a 4 night stint with my family. I will never stay anywhere else in Vancouver ~ WoW!! Exceptional service, and well dissevered top place on this site for beautiful Vancouver! Don't bother staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “"Lived up to the reviews online"”
Reviews.Author: RickDivine
Reviews.Content: Booked a one night stay with this lovely boutique hotel. Checked in @ 8:00pm with no fuss, Dave at the front desk was most helpful with recommendations for a "great" restaurant for dinner (japanese) within a few blocks. His recommendation was spot on, food was great, prices very good and service excellent. Have already booked for March of this year; "keep up the great work!" Sincerly, Rick & Divine

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Heydoc96
Reviews.Content: My family and I had never stayed in a boutique hotel before. We travel a lot, but try to stay in recognized big hotel chains. We tried this time something different, and we were 200% satisfied with our decision. The hotel has a fairly good location, but the staff courtesy and friendliness were beyond our expectations. The concierge made excellent restaurant recommendations. The room was impeccable, and it had a Nespresso coffee machine!!! What a pleasant surprise. I would definitively come back again!

Reviews.Title: “business trip”
Reviews.Author: marjo_flipper
Reviews.Content: Perfect downtown location. Great service, very attentive. Good breakfast. Heated swimming pool is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Sam K
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed the outstanding personal service. My wife and I have stayed at some very good hotels throughout North America and beyond. I would dare say that we have had some of the most pleasant interactions with hotel staff here L'Hermitage. The room itself was also outstanding with a wonderful terrace.
