I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for travelers on a romantic and sightseeing trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Walshyefc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, hot tub and pool where stunning. Room was great, gutted to miss hippo the canine concierge though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emma N
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a 1 bedroom signature suite. Hotel & staff were wonderful. Location is great & the breakfast scrambled eggs were amazing. IGA right next door was very handy. Loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best concierge I have ever come across!! Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Irm11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 nights in December and chose this hotel purely based on the feedback from this site. We were not disappointed. The rooms are fantastic, we stayed in a 1 bedroom signature suite. Location is great as it's right on the corner of Robson street and there is an IGA next door which we used to get basic items for the fridge. It is the concierge, Raymond however that made this stay so enjoyable. Nothing was a problem and in the end we would simply just visit Raymond every morning for ideas on what to do that day and night and he would take car of the rest. We even entrusted Raymond to organize a baby sitter for our 6 month old ( a huge decision for us) for a few hours so we could enjoy dinner downstairs one night. The babysitter had known Raymond for 21 years and she was the owner of the business, not any babysitter. I stay in hotels between 35 and 50 nights a year, every year and Raymond is the best I have come across. I could not recommend this hotel highly enough. If and when we get back to Van there will only be one choice of hotel. L'Hermitage. By the way the sushi restaurant Shakuru I think was superb as well.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive!”
Reviews.Author: TicoBC
Reviews.Content: My family and I were taking a few days holiday in Vancouver recently and I decided I would try L'Hermitage based on so many positive reviews. I have to say without a doubt, this was the best combination of value, quality, and service I have ever received in all my various hotel stays. I have to thank all the staff for their careful attention to great customer service, without them, there is no L'Hermitage Hotel Vancouver, and in particular Christopher in the front desk. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark R
Reviews.Content: What a find. Great value. Large room. Large bathroom. Great service. We had our sixteen year old 6 foot tall son with us. He slept on the fold-out bed very happily, unlike some fold-outs he's slept on. The buffet breakfast we thought sounded a bit expensive, but we had it anyway. We were so wrong. A great value breakfast with high quality ingredients. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel, great location, facilities and service”
Reviews.Author: MrsSee
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a short break in vancouver, from the moment we arrived until the moment that we left we had a great experience. L'Hermitage is staffed with a great team, really welcoming and committed to customer service. The location is perfect for exploring the city. The facilities are top class and kept in an immaculate condition. No review would be complete without mentioning Hippo, the canine concierge, he's adorable!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AndersonStarr
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage was the first of three hotels in which we stayed during our 10-night Vancouver trip. It was also the best. Pros: - Large bathroom, with separate shower, bathtub, and toilet areas. - Thick clean towels. - Excellent maid service that didn't even take our tips. - Very close to a large supermarket. - Very comfortable bed. - Huge selection of channels on a large TV. - Very strong wifi connection that required no separate login and very fast internet connection. - Friendly staff that gave us advice on things to do around Vancouver. They also all appear genuine, as in not overly friendly in a fake kind of way that sometimes make me uncomfortable. - Outdoor heated salt water pool. Long and narrow, 3-feet to 4.5-feet in depth. - Outdoor Jacuzzi. - Fitness center looked nice. It had two treadmills, two elliptical trainers, and some weights. We didn't use it but everything looked clean and new. - Pet-friendly. - Hippo, the friendly and cute French Bulldog that works during the day in the lobby. Cons (very minor): - "Going green", meaning missing some basic toiletries like toothbrush, which none of the three hotels in which we stayed had them by default. - Had to request a toothbrush three times. - The bathroom facet, though beautifully designed, created a thin wide stream of water that kept splashing towards my body when washing my hands. - Shower water pressure could have been stronger. Overall, this place just feels very comfortable and that's what's most important to us. Would absolutely recommend it to anyone staying in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hermitage - Excellent Service at an Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: nwlaurieb
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other positive reviews - we stayed here for 3 nights over NYE 2011. The hotel is impeccably clean and the decor pleasing to the eye. The staff - every single person we encountered - is friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, and engaging. Any issues we had were either immediately resolved or at least immediately addressed (we attempted to play DVDs on their equipment, but we were never able to {DVD player wasn't able to read our DVDs]). Everything was within walking distance or public transportation. We valet-parked our car upon arrival and didn't see it again until we left. They have loaner bicycles, to be sure to reserve them! We used the workout room a couple of times and the outdoor hot tub as well. Again, all positive! And the pricing for accommodations at this hotel is very reasonable. We would not be able to find such a great hotel in downtown Seattle (our hometown). Thank you for a wonderful stay - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jennad37
Reviews.Content: Hotel is small but rooms are beautiful. Location is great and the staff are excellent. Very friendly and extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 2 nights - wish it had been more”
Reviews.Author: Snorlaxxl
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at 6 hotels on our recent trip to North America. Some of these were very very good. What we agreed, though, was that the best that we had was L'Hermitage. We just couldn't fault it. Our room was a 1 bedroom fireplace suite on level 6. Our sons had the sofa bed whilst we had a very comfortable room with plenty of privacy. The bathroom was spacious, clean and well equipped. Our breakfasts in the Hotel were excellent with a good choice of buffet foods that were well presented and of high quality. We used the gym and the pool and both were good. The guest area where breakfast is served and the business area are great to retreat to with computer and printer access. The staff were first class. The concierge was particularly helpful as were the desk staff when we checked in (Kimberly) and when we checked out (Christopher?), even though this was very early in the morning. We will treasure the souvenir bear that was so kindly given to us. Added to this was the presence of the canine concierge, Hippo, who added even more character. Thank you L'Hermitage - you helped make our time in Vancouver truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KMathmatical
Reviews.Content: Very classy hotel, modern decor, roomy, and cozy rooms. We had a full kitchen, newly updated and a cozy gas fireplace. Perfect location, within walking distance to downtown shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and accommodation for the price”
Reviews.Author: iBleuet
Reviews.Content: The hotel room is nice. Services are excellent from reception, housekeeping, valet, etc. great attention to details and family friendly. Staff are professional. Excellent value for what we have received. Definitel worth a return.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Could of Stayed Longer...”
Reviews.Author: Chicago-60653
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night, upon return from a Whistler ski trip. The one night was not long enough. The hotel upgraded me to a one bedroom suite with kitchen (or should I say luxurious apartment). The room was a very nice size, contained a fireplace, full kitchen and also a washer and dryer. You could definitely stay at this hotel for weeks and be very comfortable. I loved the location in the city. The hotel is on a quiet street, but just around the corner from a grocery store, restaurants and shops. I also enjoyed the convenience of the gym. I found the hotel through reading the comments from other trip advisor guest and I was not disappointed. I definitely will return and stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a great pool”
Reviews.Author: NikkiandAndy
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, with a friendly atmosphere. Very quiet room overlooking nice little pool area. Pool also has a little jacuzzi style hot-tubby thing. The room was lovely and the bathroom was superb with a seperate shower.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: Jmdidday
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel and the rooms and service are excellent. The lobby is tiny and nothing to write home about and it lacks a bar - so generally there a no common areas. The beds are nice and they are very dog friendly. The gym is big but 2 of the 3 treadmills were dead. Hard for us to understand how this place was #1 on trip advisor though... I think next time we'll stay in the four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nasbr
Reviews.Content: This Hotel holds the number one spot in Vancouver for a reason: excellent customer service and lovely cozy rooms. We stayed at one of the boutique rooms. Comfortable bed. Bathroom was very nice with shower and a bathtub separate. Nice gym and pool area. Breakfast is served until 11:30AM. No room service. No mini bar (but there is a market just around corner).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne_Woods
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hermitage for 5 nights and were blown away by the exceptional service and well designed rooms. The rooms were clean, spacious and extremely comfortable and the staff were always happy to go above and beyond to help us in anyway. The breakfast buffet was lovely and we looked forward to it each morning. The housekeeping was flawless and the hotel was always clean and well maintained.The hotel had a very relaxing ambiance. The free wifi was great and the location was fantastic with many attractions within walking distance. We absolutely loved this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One week at L' Hermitage- Outstanding in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: Kerrie N
Reviews.Content: We read about LH on Expedia where they were listed as a top performer and they didnt disappoint. I can not say enough good things about this hotel. High quality accomodations, faultless house cleaning, quiet and relaxing, outstanding customer service. Friendly, warm and the little dog hippo (the canine concierge) just added to the wonderful atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury w/a smile”
Reviews.Author: christa d
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel this past weekend. I can honestly say that this was my best experience ever at a hotel. The staff went above and beyond to be friendly and helpful. The room was very nice and the pool was excellent - even in December! The location is also very nice as well having free wifi in the room. I truly couldn't think of anything more they could have done to make our trip enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Tangfive
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and had an extremely comfortable 4 night stay in their 2 bedroom suite. Kudos to Jean-michel & Hippo, Raymond, Elaisha, Mitch and a super housekeeping team for being so helpful and friendly. We felt most at home and strongly recommend to all who plan to visit Vancouver. Great location with Japadog and Viet-Sub eateries and Sears, Hudson Bay, Holt Renfrew nearby. Easy access to the main attractions. The team deserves a great pat on their backs for their great work attitude. Special thanks to Jean-michel for going out of your way for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Birtsters
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the suites at the hotel for three nights and loved it. Beautiful, spacious rooms with everything you could need, close to all the main sights. Staff are friendly and welcoming especially in the breakfast room. Hippo is gorgeous too, so don't forget to say hello. Staying here was a treat to ourselves for a tough year last year and we were not disappointed. Thank you to all the staff there. Happy holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Four and a half stars, exceptional value”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneFoodFan
Reviews.Content: Located pretty much in the heart of Downtown Vancouver, L'Hermitage was a great choice for a five night stay. The room was surprisingly large - particularly the bathroom with separate shower and deep tub - great quality furnishings, and nice touches like Nespresso coffee and a kettle for making tea. I'd describe the king-sized bed as one of the most comfortable I've slept in, better than big name five star hotels like Westin, Hyatt, Intercontinental and Sofitel. Nearby you'll find great food for dine-in or take-out and the Marketplace IGA. I recommend eating at Japadog and Guu nearby, Cafe Medina a bit further afield for brunch, lunch or coffee, or Pourhouse for smarter dining and drinks. My only criticism of L'Hermitage is that the air-conditioning was almost the noisiest I've encountered. As the room (653) had a opening window, I mostly kept the A/C off. The Wifi was slow and patchy, with repeated requests to login each day. The gym is small and suitable for those who like the idea of working out in a hotel gym, rather than fitness training. I used the Steve Nash club on nearby Granville Street (I have reciprocal access rights through my gym in Montreal where I've been for 4 1/2 months). This was one of the best fitness clubs I've trained in.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, welcoming plus location”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove to the curb to be met by the doorman and valet parking, we were impressed by the friendly approach of all staff. This friendly and welcoming approach was echoed by all staff whether telling us where we could eat, bringing a DVD player to our room or simply ensuring we knew the way to the nearby sky train station. Located near Robson cross street, there are plenty of eating choices within easy walking distance as well as a supermarket and sky train station. The room was very comfortable. We enjoyed a boutique one bedroom deluxe suite so with one on a fold away bed, 3 of us were not on top of one another. I would love the chance to stay at this downtown location again.

Reviews.Title: “Understated, casual elegance: a lovely surprise”
Reviews.Author: shs56
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently enjoyed our first, two-night stay at this boutique hotel. The room, the staff's helpfulness and hotel amenties were considerably above our expectations. In the future it will be our "Vancouver hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: SVTWruby
Reviews.Content: Stayed downtown after a company Christmas party. This place was an unexpected delight! The staff was super friendly. We were upgraded to a boutique room and it was very spacious. The bathrooms are well appointed. Satellite HDTV was good but a bit hard to use (slow). Fast Internet though. There is a beautiful library/business center. The only downside is a fairly loud hvac unit. This isn't in a terribly touristy area of town but if you are in Vancouver for business or staying downtown for an event, Dont hesitate to give it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “It was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Lstrench
Reviews.Content: The personal attention and service is wonderful! They remember your name and what your previous preferences are. We loved the room we had last time; they booked us in to that same room!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: CarlaV
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago my husband and I booked into L'Hermitage for one night. We were attending a charity event downtown and our friends were meeting us in our room for drinks and appys. I thought I had booked a kitchen suite but was mistaken, and unfortunately they were all booked. Not to worry, the staff was quick to offer delivery of cutlery, plates, glassware, linens etc. The service at this hotel is topnotch in all areas, and I would highly recommend it. I will stay at this hotel over and over again whenever we have an event downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way.”
Reviews.Author: justonetaste203
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here a week. Impeccable service. Pool and hot tub + steam rooms are lovely. We spent 3 nights in standard and then upgraded to a suite w/ kitchen....which was worth every penny. Granted, the bathrooms are not as nice in the suite rooms as the standard rooms -- but the other amenities outweigh this minor inconvenience. We utilized the free bikes (there are 2) and enjoyed the city by bike for 2 of the 6 days. Staff didn't blink when I asked for my daily extra few containers (pods) of espresso for the in-room machine. Gorilla Food is just a few blocks away if your a vegan foodie....or there is a really great supermarket with absolutely everything you could ask for just 1/2 block away. Top quality hotel in all aspects. Merci!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at it's best!”
Reviews.Author: McKenzie175
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel online, we stayed 2 nights 11/23 & 11/24 and came back for a third (11/28) as our plans had changed. Even though we didn't book the third night online they gave us the same rate. Top notch hotel and top notch customer service, they couldn't do enough for us. The location is excellent, walking distance to so many places. The rooms are spacious and beautifully appointed. W would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Eric P
Reviews.Content: The wife and I weren't sure what we were getting with L'Hermitage. We weren't sure about the location or the hotel. Our worries vanished about .5 seconds after our arrival. The valets at the door greeted us warmly, discreetly eyeing our bag tags so they could address us by name. At this point, I should mention we had been on the Victoria ferry and we were dressed for "comfort", had "wind-styled" hair, and were carrying food and soda cans and a 1/2 finished bottle of wine. The Clampetts had come to the big city. Hugo, the canine concierge and holder of the greatest job in the world greeted us as a staff member led us to our room. Between the location and the staff, this is now a must-stay when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: surf_grrl
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is within a few minutes' walk of the Queen Elizabeth theatre, BC Place, Granville and Robson street shopping, the Vancouver Art Gallery, and so much more. The staff are very personable and helpful. Our room - a one bedroom suite - was nicely furnished. The marble bathroom was extremely spacious, and I loved having a separate shower and tub, not to mention having the commode being behind another door. The bedroom was cramped; the king-sized bed was comfy. The room was hot at night - stayed at 75F despite our having turned the heat down to 65F. (If we'd opened the windows, that probably would have solved our problem). The fan/vent in the living room was surprisingly noisy, and what little noise there was in the hallway was a bit too easy to hear. The coffee from the in-room espresso machine was yummy. We brought our small dog with us, and he was made to feel very at home by the staff. The hotel has a no-dogs-left-unattended-in-room policy, so we made use of the services of nearby WOOFection dog-sitting, who did a great job of looking after him while we were out for 5 hours in the evening. I would not leave this particular dog alone in a room even if it were an option (he's a barking risk - too much danger of him disturbing other guests), but our previous dog was a fantastic traveler and I prefer to have the option of leaving a good dog in a room. (I do get how this can become problematic, though!). Hippo, the dog concierge, is adorable. All in all, we had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favourite place to stay in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: BonzBC
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd time staying in this hotel. Each time we have had a different level of room. We love the boutique style hotel, its cozy atmosphere with a modern style. Location is ideal for shopping and events at The Ford Centre, Queen Elizabeth Theatre, Rogers Arena and Stadium. The beds are super comfortable , Bathrooms and kitchen amenities superb. The 5th floor lounge and breakfast room has a very relaxing atmosphere while looking outdoors at the salt water lap pool and hot tub. The breakfast buffet at a rate of 17.50 is fine. Probably could do better price wise elsewhere, but its convenient and well done. Was all that we needed. To top it off the staff is very professional, friendly, accommodating and attentive. The valet parking is a plus especially on Vancouver's rainy days. Will definately continue to use L'Hermitage as our first choice in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mlwFortLee_Nj
Reviews.Content: Everything you could wish for in a hotel is here at L'Hermitage. Location-less than half block from Robson St, The main shopping/restaurant street. Rooms- modest size but with every luxury you could want, espresso machine, great thick terry bathrobes, lighted magnifying shaving/makeup mirrors, and a staff like I've never encountered. They, and especially Matthew, were so gracious and helpful. For us, there could never be any other hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: Outside, floating on your back, in salt water. Looking up at the tall buildings around you, and at the sky. Being the only one in the pool. Oh, it's November, and you're in Canada. One word: Sublime. Boutique hotels are new to me, and I'm hooked. Everything seems to be on a more human scale. The rooms are excellent. The service here is brilliant; the staff remember who you are, and do their job well. Nothing is rushed. Truly relaxing. Love it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Friendly Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wpr
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at l'Hermitages for a night while on business in Vancouver. It was a great choice! The hotel staff are very friendly, the place has a nice, comfortable feel, and my room was clean and well appointed. The hotel has a spacious lounge/breakfast area that I could easily spend more time in. Read, have glass of wine, watch TV - do any or all of these in the lounge. Breakfast was very good (the granola is a must have) with ample cold and hot choices. I had fruit, yogurt and granola with orange juice and coffee - morning papers and a smile from the waitress: good way to start the day! My wife and I will be visiting Vancouver later this year and i made arrangements for our 3 night stay. I actually believe it is the perfect spot for a holiday visit. The combination of it being close to many downtown attractions and the room having a separate sitting room is really appealing and when combined with an attractive price it is perfect. The management were great in making sure I was happy with my stay and went out of their way to help plan our return. Overall I can just say with no hesitation that I have found my new favourite hotel in Vancouver: value and comfort - a winning combination.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Beautiful, Fantastic....”
Reviews.Author: TorontoCanadaGuy
Reviews.Content: Just a completely perfect hotel. Our stay was flawless. We booked a "Petite Boutique Room" but I think we were upgraded to a regular "Boutique Room" - the room was very large, and very nicely appointed. The bathroom is also gorgeous and stylish. Our room had a faux fireplace (I think it was electric). It just produced fire-like-light and no heat, but was nice nevertheless. It got turned on each night when the room was turned down, and turned off in the morning cleaning (or maybe it turned off automatically? Don't recall). The hotel room was completely quiet - no noise from the other rooms, street, or hallway (but, to be fair, we were at the end of the hallway so I doubt there were a lot of people who ever came past our room). The staff were very nice. The hotel also has a concierge dog, who is adorable and rumbles when you pet him. All it all, if you're staying in the Vancouver downtown this is a great hotel. It was close to the skytrain (2 blocks), and walking to all the downtown sites was easy. Did I mention there's a Japadog store right around the corner?

Reviews.Title: “One of the best decisions we made”
Reviews.Author: Kathie C
Reviews.Content: We had a short overnight visit to Vancouver. L'Hermitage was a high point of the visit. The staff was cheerful and helpful and extremely polite. Hippo is just adorable. Our room was clean and comfortable and nicely decorated. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable chic”
Reviews.Author: Lemster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the L'Hermitage for three nights in May 2011. Our room was a standard king overlooking the pool. Although the room was a bit small the furnishings and appointments were top notch. The bathroom was very spacious with a separate tub and glassed in shower. The location was within walking distance to Gastown, the BC Place Stadium, Canada Place and Convention Center. We rented a car and the valet service was quick and efficient. There are many restaurants within walking distance. Try Guu in Gastown and the Twisted Fork on Granville Street.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, beautiful & very friendly”
Reviews.Author: flowerbabe_anne
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after hours of searching for the right fit for a girl's weekend away. The hotel staff were extremely professional and friendly and helped with any request me might have. We really enjoyed our view of the beautiful pools. Right downtown. Very quiet hotel. would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, great location and weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Bezina
Reviews.Content: We came up to Vancouver for a weekend getaway and enjoyed our stay at the L'Hermitage Hotel. They upgraded our reserved room to a suite that was like a high end apartment. Designer kitchen, sitting room, bedroom, soaking tub/bathroom on the top floor. Very quiet, comfortable rooms. Now I want to buy the same bed since I slept so well! The staff was very nice, and of course our favorite staff member was Hippo, the bulldog concierge. The location of the hotel is central to downtown, so we easily could walk most anywhere. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would love to stay again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff, rooms are nice”
Reviews.Author: Nola404
Reviews.Content: People were great, location is perfect. Room was a bit small, but overall a stellar choice.

Reviews.Title: “A true boutique hotel perfectly located!”
Reviews.Author: Lamhb
Reviews.Content: Spent a week there and was kindly upgraded to a suite (it was offered as a promotion on the web). I have seen many boutique hotels but this one is the best. Very nice staff always ready to help you. The location couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “My new home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Ken G
Reviews.Content: Very upscale but not stuffy. Our suite was perfect. Wonderfull bathroom,very comfortable bed,great TV and free Wi-Fi. Fabulous location close to everything. Very personalized service.Terrific food and wine. Excellent room service. Terrific concierge. Great value for all that is offered. I wont stay anywhere else in Vancouver Cavaet.DOG Friendly

Reviews.Title: “Super option”
Reviews.Author: john s
Reviews.Content: We recently (Oct. 2011) spent 6 nights at the L'Hermitage and had a great experience. The staff was great, the room was far more than we could have gotten elsewhere (two baths and a full kitchen), and the location is superb. Make sure to visit the 5th floor for a great gym, pool, and fireside gathering spot for breakfasts, etc. We can't recommend it highly enough. It will be our hotel in Vancouver going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Tied with my favourite Montreal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brenda Z
Reviews.Content: Overall this was a great experience and one that was unexpected. The staff was amazing - I received an upgrade upon checking in. The "room" could only be described as a small, but roomy, apartment (rm 709). Fully equiped kitchen with stainless steel appliances - small and large plus a Sub-Zero fridge. There was even an apartment size washer/dryer. The details include satalitte TV, a 15 ft balcony, wood floors in the living room, small office room, TWO bathrooms - one for guests so that they don't have to go through your room, rain shower, funky bathroom facets, walk in closet, fireplace, ice in the fridge and more. I ordered in room service - pricey but good. Only drawback was that I was only there for one night! I was ready to move in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: pattyChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 days at L'Hermitage in late August. Couldn't have asked for a better spot. Location was ideal. Walking distance to numerous restaurants, shops and public transport. It's easy to get around with public transportation. We skipped renting a car and didn't miss it at all. Reserve the bikes at the hotel to explore more distant neighborhoods, and definitely ride along the shore to and around Stanley Park The 1-bedroom signature suite is truly an apartment, complete with full kitchen and stackable washer & dryer! Room was clean, modern and comfortable Raymond, the concierge, was incredibly helpful, taking note of our interests, and making suggestions that fit exactly what we were looking for. Restaurants we enjoyed included: Lupo-an Italian restaurant about a block away. Raincity Grill. Great place to watch the sunset. Excellent food Nu. A modern take on Greek Les Faux Bourgeois. Cab to this one if you don't want a several block walk from the bus. We'll definitely stay at L'Hermitage on our next trip to Vancouver. Wouldn't consider anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “small, smart, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: orangeSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: No problem with an early check in, late check out. Room as desired (a middle level room). The ambiance is what this place excels at, there is a nice lounge on the 5th floor that is quiet. I go to many hotels, this is one that someone could live in for an extended time.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: SiskaC
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as our homebase for a recent Hallowe'en party solely based on reviews on TripAdvisor, and we are so glad that we did! From the pleasant help on the phone, the spotless and elegant lobby to the friendly service staff (Hippo the French Bulldog Concierge was there to greet us as well) our welcome was flawless. We checked into our room after walking through a beautifully decorated hallway, and felt simultaneously at home, and on vacation. The decor was modern and funky while maintaining warmth and coziness; our gas fireplace was lit, we found a good music station on the TV and had a good look around. Our bathroom was delicious - marble, great baththub with uber modern fixtures and a stand alone shower stall WITHOUT the annoying rain head that so many hotels have been opting for these days. Our minibar was perfect - we stashed away our bottle of bubbly, cheese, crackers and grapes and headed out to check out the lounge and pool. What an oasis! The lounge was my favourite of all of their guest amenities, and the fact that we had the whole place to ourselves was an unexpected bonus. We chilled in front of the fireplace with a glass of wine, the opulence and attention to interior details making us feel like we were in Vegas. We grabbed a couple of books from the library and headed back to our room where we had plenty of space to spread out, relax and enjoy ourselves. A dinner out, then valet brought our car up for us so we could head to our Hallowe'en party. We arrived "home" after 1pm, and received another lovely welcome - our car was whisked away, and we returned for a comfortable night's sleep after a nightcap. Breakfast arrived promptly at 9am (we had hung out requests on the door before going out) with delicious coffee, a lovely fruit plate and other nibblies to tide us over until we met friends for brunch. Presentation and quality of everything was excellent. I have NOTHING negative to say about our experience at L'Hermitage. It was seamless, elegant and very romantic for our night away in the city. I would recommend this to anyone, and I found our final bill so reasonable I was a little taken aback! I have paid more for rooms of lesser quality NOT including valet parking, breakfast, ice service, or the inclusion of a lovely heated outdoor pool/jacuzzi. This hotel has got it going on!!

Reviews.Title: “Great kitchen, fun place!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea F
Reviews.Content: We booked at L'Hermitage to try somewhere new in Vancouver. We were pleased to be upgraded to a suite (with a full kitchen, including a SubZero fridge) and really enjoyed the place. Too bad the weather was cold/rainy, as there was a gorgeous furnished deck off our room! A great location, super friendly staff, and it was great to see the staff dog (and other dogs) out and about. Bed comfy, valet quick to fetch car, a great fitness area/swim/hot tub. I'd definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Stabroast
Reviews.Content: Not much to say that hasn't been said already except maybe that this hotel really wants you to have the best stay ever. They are truly proud of their hotel and their reputation is building. It has a homey feeling to it that no chain hotel could muster

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: SDTripster
Reviews.Content: There are so many wonderful things we can say about this property, but many of them have already been said by other TA’s; there’s no point in repeating them all here except to say we wholeheartedly agree, although this is the only place we’ve stayed in Vancouver, this must be the best boutique hotel in downtown. We booked a one bedroom Signature Suite for four nights with a corner view over Robson St, the lap pool and a private terrace one story below. The rooms are spotlessly clean and crisp; the design décor is elegant and simple. High fives: love the little den/office off the sitting room, the full kitchen with high end appliances, the lighted magnifying wall-mounted mirror in the bathroom, the combo washer/drier in the closet, the bed turn-down service with chocolates on the pillow, the steam rooms on the fifth floor, and the salt-water Jacuzzi and lap pool. Tiny, tiny inconsequential (really don't matter) nits – would love a little more counter or shelf space in the bathroom; the protective strip on the corner wall next to the kitchen kept falling off. The breakfast in L’Orangerie is fabulous as is the service. Every member of staff we encountered was absolutely wonderful. Everyone – from the bell staff to the front desk staff, to the chap who cleans the halls, workout room and common spaces – says hello and smiles genuinely; everyone is so very willing to help. A special shout-out to Sean at the door and Raymond the concierge for being extra pleasant and helpful. When we asked if there were other kinds of bed pillows (we like them flat and firm, they brought us four different types to choose from - a total of eight pillows!) The hotel set us up with loaner bicycles, water, a bike map and helmets which we rode all the way around Stanley Park. (If the weather is nice, there’s no better way to see Vancouver than on a bicycle.) Bottom line: we can’t gush enough over this wonderful property. If you’re coming to Vancouver and you want a wonderful boutique hotel experience, L’Hermitage is THE place to stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Downtown Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Winnipeg1991
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and I have stayed at this hotel. In the past I have been at the Four Seasons, The Fairmount Water Front, Sutton Place and Weston Bayshore. There is no doubt in my mind the L'Hermitage is head and shoulders above all the rest. The staff knows you by name, the breakfast is excellent, the internet is free (including a business centre) the location is great, the smallest rooms are spacious, there is a great fitness centre and the lobby even has a resident dog to pet and lift your spirits on a rainy day. All this at a rate a bit lower than the hotels I mentioned above. This has my vote for best hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city....”
Reviews.Author: chickensoup26
Reviews.Content: Thank you L'Hermitage hotel for everything. The hotel is maintained beautifully and the hotel employees are fantastic, friendly, accommodating and always had a sincere smile on their face. The room was spectacular and I was so pleasantly surprised at how beautiful it was. Absolutely loved my room. We were in room 568, the boutique room, with a king bed and what had a little nice touch was the faux fireplace. I absolutely loved the decor in the room. We were mainly in Vancouver to see a Canucks game and the hotel was conveniently located near everything. No need for a car if you are heading to the Canucks game. A short 10 minute walk to Rogers Arena. There is a market just around the corner, Tim Hortons, Starbucks, etc... Location, location, location. I cannot say enough about this hotel. I will definitely stay there again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a princess”
Reviews.Author: Misha A
Reviews.Content: When I got to L'Hermitage Hotel, I had been travelling for 2 weeks and was on my last week of business travel. From the very moment that I stepped into the door, I was treated like a princess. From the doorman's kind and authentic greeting to my stay in the lounge as they prepared my room to the little chocolates and soft radio playing as I came back to my room after a long day at the tradeshow, to the personal cards hand delivered to let me know something was waiting for me at the front desk. The steam rooms were extremely relaxing. The adjacent italian restaurant was delicious and the coffee shops, market and specialty food shops in the area were also just as delicious for a comforting, peaceful and princess-like stay. Thank you. I quite enjoyed and appreciated my stay at L'Hermitage Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Staff, Location, and Dog”
Reviews.Author: sfjonathan
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The location was right off of Robson and walking distance to pretty much anything else we wanted. The front desk, bellmen, everyone, was always courteous, helpful, and professional. The bed was comfy and room was large enough to have a sitting area. The outdoor pool was heated so it wasn't too bad to get in even if it was only 50F outside. The hot tub was also a welcome way to relax. We loved Hippo, the dog concierge. He did help show us to a lounge as our room was getting ready. That was a nice touch. I could keep gushing but I think it's pretty clear by mine and the other reviews: stay here if you're going to be in Vancouver/

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find in the middle of the city!”
Reviews.Author: SunTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after it was recommended by a friend. It's not a location we would normally choose. We found it to be a calm, peaceful hideaway in the middle of a busy city. The rooms are decorated in soft colors. Our room had a small patio with a table and also two windows that opened. It was such a treat to be able to get some fresh air. The pool was just beyond our patio and the trickly of the fountains around the pool were delightful. The bed was very comfortable and we had a good sleep in this quiet location. Rooms have mini-espresso machines, a tea kettle and small fridges. The service here is 2nd to none. We have stayed at many of the major chains (Westin, Fairmont, etc) in Vancouver) and none have had service like we were treated to at L'hermitage. The entire staff is friendly and helpful. There is a resident dog, Hippo, and guest dogs are welcome - a real plus for us if our dog sitter is not available. The only downside to having dogs at this hotel is that it's a hike to find any grass but that would be the case with most of the downtown hotels. The hotel is centrally located with lots of good restaurants and attractions within walking distance or with easy bus access if you don't have a vehicle or don't want to walk. If you bring a car, the valet service is excellent and the location is great for easy driving access to other areas of the city. This will be our first choice when visiting Vancouver in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Taco V
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews on the web made me choose to stay at this hotel during our honeymoon. One word to describe the whole experience: Superb! Staff friendliness & hospitality. We had contact with about 4 staff members and they were all equally friendly and helpful. The bell boy helped us out settling in the room with an extensive explanation of all the facilities in the hotel. The concierge gave us some great suggestions for dinner. The roomservice girl brought us breakfast and laid the table for us. They were all genuinely interested and took time for us. I would like to thank the management for upgrading us to a suite + the kind card & chocolates for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “When can I come back?”
Reviews.Author: Cristy R
Reviews.Content: The customer service at L'Hermitage Hotel is amazing. The rooms are also amazing. I wish I could take this hotel with me on every business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could live here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cubbiefan5
Reviews.Content: This was possibly the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed at. Exceptional service, perfect location...simply amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A quiet prelude”
Reviews.Author: Tutuwahinelv
Reviews.Content: We chose this location as our pre-trip jumping off point. I was escorting my parents to Vancouver so they could join the Norwegian Star for her trip South to Florida. I was headed to Seattle after I saw them safely off. This hotel was the perfect start to our vacation(s). We arrived on Friday afternoon, and had no problems getting checked in. The front desk staff was efficient and quick, and everyone was very welcoming. When we got into the room there was a welcome gift on the counter that was for another guest, but that was straightened out very quickly. The room was perfect, and so lovely. We were on the 7th floor overlooking the pool area. There was a small balcony that was just off of the living area. The step up to access it was quite high though, it almost felt like climbing out the window. It would be a little difficult for someone with any mobility issues. But that could be easily fixed, with a small wooden step perhaps, (just in case mgmt is reading this) However, once out there it was wonderful. It was a quiet oasis from the city bustle. Loved the large soaking tub. Such a nice change from the usual, barely adequate hotel tubs. The location is very central. Only about 5 blocks from the harbor. From the hotel its downhill, so it took us a little longer on the walk back, as it was uphill. I would definitely recommend this location for your Vancouver Visit, be it business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cctex823
Reviews.Content: Nestled deep within Downtown Vancouver lies this superb hotel fit for a king. A $30 taxi fare from the airport takes you directly to the front door where doormen and bell hops await your arrival. The cozy yet lavish lobby invites you in and forces you to take a step back and enjoy your choice. The front desk, at all hours, was the most helpful I've ever witnessed. Requests for ice, room service, and other amenities were acknowledged and acted upon within seconds, and always with a smile. Only 59 rooms are shared with yours so there is much less hustle and bustle even during peak hours. The rooms themselves are clean, modern, and picturesque with artwork and luxury fixtures. Available to you is free wired/wireless internet which was a slightly cumbersome with my tablet (had to make a phone call once a day), but all Apple devices worked flawlessly. The satellite television was a nice diversion for the occasional downtime as well. Breakfast on the 5th floor was excellent! It was buffet style which included smoked salmon among other more standard morning fare. It was very quiet and relaxing, opposite of the usual screaming kids at most chain hotel breakfasts. The adjoining restaurant, Q4 was exquisite as well. My wife and I made two trips, once for dinner and the other for drinks and dessert. Dinner was very gourmet and mirrored the bravado of the hotel. Drinks and dessert at the bar was of the same caliber. Our experience of the restaurant was very solid. Finally, the surrounding area gave us little time to spend in our room. There were coffee shops, delis, steakhouses, gift shops, malls, libraries, grocery stores, high end shopping, sports goods, parks, arenas, museums ALL within walking distance. There is no other prime location to choose. Everything considered, this hotel experience has been our absolute best.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat visit already planned”
Reviews.Author: USA696
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We arrived early from a cruise and were welcomed to wait for our room in the breakfast dining area and served refreshments. The location is close to all shopping and sightseeing. Transportation is easy access around the city. Room was stylish and comfortable. Location near quality eating (or grocery store if you prefer) We will return on our next visit to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Ist Class”
Reviews.Author: Fire37
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the L’Hermitage Hotel for a twelve night stay whilst visiting beautiful Vancouver. The hotel is excellent, the staff were lovely and very very welcoming even though we were arriving late at night. The room was super with all the facilities we needed and was very comfortable. The hotel is also in a great location very much at the centre of things so good for access to most of the sights you would wish to see. Very nice bar just over the road which we enjoyed visiting. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver I truly don’t think you would be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Niki S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at L'Hermitage for 10 days on our first holiday to Canada. The location of the hotel was fantastic, conveniently located to all key sights or public transport options. The hotel itself was very stylish and kept immaculate, and all staff were very friendly and helpful. We were particularly impressed with the housekeeping service and the nightly 'turn downs' complete with chocolate treats! Our boutique room was large, with a spacious bathroom and exceptionally comfortable bed. We'd certainly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located with phenonmenal staff”
Reviews.Author: LarsVomMars
Reviews.Content: In September 2011 my wife and I stayed at the L’Hermitage Hotel in Vancouver for a couple of nights. In a nutshell we experienced a High Level Westin look and feel for a very reasonable price. The breakfast was excellent and relatively cheap, the hotel is located perfectly near Yaletown, Chinatown, Coal Harbour, etc. and most impressive was the working attitude of the whole staff, from the bellman over the Concierge (Raymond is a star!) up to the hotel manager.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Folero
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the l'Hermitage. We couldn't be happier with our choice. A great experience on all levels! The staff and amenities were superb and we enjoyed our stay thoroughly. Tim Foley...Portland,Oregon

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better stay”
Reviews.Author: Rnothlich
Reviews.Content: Went to Vancouver for our anniversary L'Hermitage was the perfect stay. We usually stay at a Fairmont but picked this through Tripadvisor and the reviews where spot on. Rooms where grand but a ver small miss for us was the view. The staff-the hotel and location wad great.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommned”
Reviews.Author: Darlene R
Reviews.Content: We are entertainers The"Other" Don Cherry Guy. Staying in allot of hotels across this great country for the past 23 years. www.clarkrobertson.com Walk in the front door be greeted by Hippo "Canine Concierge" to the wonderful staff at the front desk... these people will make your stay a pleasurable one. The rooms are clean, beautiful and great location for a lovely stroll down town Vancouver in the evening lights with my love. Please make a point to stay here. We will definitely be back. Thank you, Darlene

Reviews.Title: “Eileen”
Reviews.Author: Eileen P
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel and in a perfect location in downtown Vancouver. All the staff were very helpful & welcoming as we returned three times for short stays whilst visiting other parts of BC.Would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes a home from home experience and will definately be returning next time I visit Canada.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hermitage Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jess7386
Reviews.Content: We stayed at th L'Hermitage Hotel from Sept 30 2011 to Oct 7 2011. I have chosen my hotels for trips to Europe from top picks of Tripadvisor. So when we decided to explore Vancouver, I once again picked the #1 rated hotel from Tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. The room was beautiful, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. The price of $198 per nite for a "Boutique Room" (slightly larger than a regular room) was a great value for what we got. Perks included nghtly turn down service, pool, jaccuzzi and a beautiful library with free use of their computers and internet access. Because this was not a business trip we had not lugged our laptop and yet we were able to stay in touch and send photos to family. However, the shining star of the hotel is their staff. The Director of Operations, Jean-michel Tanguy and his entire staff were amazing. Everyone made a point of remembering our names and using them at every occassion. They even sent up a bottle of wine and card for our wedding anniversary. The "Canine Concierge", a bulldog named Hippo even added a special touch by greeting us when we entered the lobby. Let me not forget the perfect downtown location. I highly reccommend this hotel while visiting beautiful Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara S
Reviews.Content: We loved every detail of this hotel ! Great design, fantastic staff, amazing room and perfect location. The most helpful concierge "Raymond " went out of his way to give us the best restaurant tips and the best way to spend our time. Usually by the end of your vacation you are " Hoteled Out", but the L' Hermitage made us wish we had just started our trip, we hated to leave! I picked this hotel after reading Trip Advisor reviews and was sooooo happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nancy g
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at L'Hermitage and the stay couldn't have been better. The rooms are spacious, well appointed, extrememly comfortable and very clean. The service is top notch. I will always stay here whenever in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “"Great long term stay option"”
Reviews.Author: dstsang
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience during the 12 months that I stayed that L'Hermitage Hotel. The sales manager, John Chao, helped find a cost effective solution that enabled me to focus on business projects while the hotel provided me a "home away from home". This is an excellent option for the business traveller. It is centrally located and the staff are prepared to help with any arrangements: deliveries, car service, additional guest accommodations. Jean-Michel's hotel mascot, "Hippo" the french bulldog, gives the property a personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Family reunion”
Reviews.Author: Connie C
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it allowed us to book a 2 bedroom suite with full kitchen. We were meeting up with family members staying at the same unit and it was wonderful to have a full kitchen. Great space and amenities. The balcony was huge and offered a fantastic space for entertaining overlooking the pool and hot tub. The staff was very helpful and accommodating to any requests. Overall a wonderful stay and get together. Will definitely consider staying at L'Hermitage again when we come to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying at L'Hermitage”
Reviews.Author: Beke25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome! The staff was so professional and helpful. We got hooked up with Raymond, the concierge, right away and he had so much insight on the city. We got maps, coupons, restaurant recommendations and he helped us figure out how to plan our days. He made dinner reservations and made sure we were taken care of. We even got a complimentary appetizer at The Sandbar on Granville Island. The hotel itself was clean, pretty and enjoyable. The lounge on the 5th floor is a nice place to hang out. I stopped in there a few times to get cream for my coffee. (Though I would skip the $17.50 breakfast! We didn't have it, but that seemed too pricey for us.) They have awesome expresso machines in the rooms. Everything at this hotel was fantastic. We got personalized welcome cards upon arrival (even a note when we returned for one last night--and they knew it). When dinner reservations were booked we got a card with all the info and confirmation for our time, etc. We highly recommend this hotel if you're staying in Vancouver. We stumbled upon the hotel through an internet search and we're so glad we did!

Reviews.Title: “Two nights at L'Hermitage”
Reviews.Author: drgirdler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are very experienced travelers who have stayed in fine hotels around the world, the L'Hermitage is truly a five star hotel. Though small, it lacks nothing in service and quality. We stayed in a small suit with a fireplace and balcony. The room was excellent, spotless and highest quality. The hotel staff were equally impressive and went the extra distance to accommodate. The only reason not to stay at this hotel is possibly the location. The good thing is that it is on a relatively quiet street but it is not quite downtown nor next to Stanley Park of the Harbor but it is very centrally located to give you a balance of all the POI's of the area. It is about equal distance to Yale, Gas Town, the Harbor, Stanley Park or Granville Island. It is very close to the new stadium and has plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance. The train to/from the airport is an easy five minute walk (don't get a car). They even have a pair of complimentary bikes (if available). Great hotel, would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lyka G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days in L'Hermitage last September. We where travelling with our family, 6 persons 4 adults and 2 children and stayed in a 2 bedroom suite for a very reasonable price. CAD450++ which is much cheaper then 2 regular rooms even in another so called cheaper hotel downtown Vancouver. Really great hotel, perfect location, good breakfast buffet and very friendly staff!! Thanks Lyka & Family

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Courtney D
Reviews.Content: There is a reason they are number one on Trip Advisor for Vancouver.... a lovely stay. Staff, facilities and room were all fantastic. Service is a priority, which is personalised and very professional. A must stay in Vancouver...in walking distance for the entire downtown area, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing & expensive”
Reviews.Author: travelertessie
Reviews.Content: We chose L'Hermitage for one night in September 2011 to be close to the Queen Elizabeth Theatre to see the Royal Canadian Ballet. Street in front was under construction and we could not drive to the door of the hotel and the bell staff had to unload our suitcases in the middle of the street, we had to walk through construction and rain to the front door, (we did not have unbrellas and the bell staff did not provide them) and when we walked out the door to go to the ballet, it was a noisy filthy wet construction site. Construction was not their fault, but there was no acknowledgement on anyone's part that this was awful for guests. Hotel dreadfully short staffed with almost no help anywhere. The concierce recommended a restaurant for lunch which turned out to be a 45-minute walk, was a tourist trap with huge busloads of tourists, and mediocre and expensive food.. The waiter asked us who recommended the restaurant, we told him, and he grinned. I suspect the concierge gets some kind of a kick-back. The hotel bar was closed the whole time we were there. The front desk sent us to their breakfast/lounge area on the 5th floor to wait because our room was not ready when we arrived and said they would send coffee up. The area was dark, no lights but the gas fireplace, no staff, no food, no coffee. Very grim. Our room was large, but had old and stained upholstery on the furniture and worn towels. There are better hotels in downtown Vancouver. Skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on our month long trip”
Reviews.Author: Thomas K
Reviews.Content: We were satisfied with L'Hermitage in all respects. The staff was friendly and our room was exceptionally quiet. I cannot recall a hotel where we did not hear any noise from other guests, no toilets flushing or running water or voices and steps. In other words it was an extremly restful place. Except for the carpet showing some wear, the room, beds and bathroom were in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: “This is a really good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ailsa M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hermitage Hotel for 4 days in September 2011 and found it to be a really excellent hotel, and one that I would truly recommend. The accommodation was great, and the staff were extremely charming and helpful. I think the only drawback may be the position of the hotel which is about a 10-15 minute walk from the waterfront, and closer to the shopping areas, but we didn't find this too much of a problem. Vancouver is not a large city, and so it is easy to get around, even on foot. Although it was a little bit more expensive than some hotels, we felt it was good value for money and would definitely go back to this hotel if we were visiting Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “A true luxury home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Karen B
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in October 2011 for our wedding anniversary. We were upgraded to a suite with a full kitchen with tea, coffee, fridge, cooktop and oven! The room was impeccably clean. Our suite was 3 rooms with a fireplace. The staff are warm and friendly, the valet service prompt, and the concierge, David, couldn't have been more helpful and nice! My husband and I have traveled the world, and found this hotel to be a gem! We hope to come back to Vancouver again, and will definitely stay here. Thanks to the professional and friendly staff. This hotel is a must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Way beyond the call.”
Reviews.Author: Jay F
Reviews.Content: We had a one day, one night stay in Vancouver coming off a cruise ship from Alaska on our way to Seattle. We arrived about 10am and the friendly staff checked us in and stored our bags since checkin time is 3 pm. and the rooms were not ready. (We knew this would be the case ahead of time). The concierge was extremely friendly and helpful, getting us a discount ticket to the Vancouver trolley tour (on and off when you please). His recommendations for lunch and dinner were also excellent. The room was fabulously sleek, clean and modern, as was the bathroom. The room faced the pool which was great. The computer room was fine, and the lounge/breakfast area has to be seen to be believed. One of the wheels on my wife's luggage broke, and the staff fixed the wheel, and put the bag back in our room as if they do this all the time. Fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: Limeside
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hermitage at the end of a five week world trip. Without question the experience was simply the best of the entire trip. The suite was exceptional in size, quality, comfort and cleanliness. We thoroughly enjoyed the food and beverage service, and the extended breakfast hours which added to the relaxed nature of the hotel. The Concierge service meant our daily planning was efficiently and economically (in time and cost), taken care of. Without question, the best accomodation experience of our entire trip. Can't wait to return to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Elthamite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this small hotel in Vancouver with our two friends on two occasions in August 2011 for a total of four nights. On the first occasion we chose to book a larger room with a sitting area as we were staying for three nights and on the second booked a petit boutique room for one night. Both rooms were lovely, well appointed with attractive furnishings and all amenities. The bathrooms were also spacious. Everything about the property was tasteful, spotlessly clean and well maintained. The breakfast room and lounge area were exceptional as was the library where internet access was provided. The outdoor pool terrace was gorgeous and a peaceful haven in the city. The level of service from all staff was outstanding. We highly recommend this hotel for its position, service and facilities. We could have stayed there forever.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Khrys T
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the L'Hermitage Hotel Vancouver. It was absolutely lovely - the staff at reception were very friendly and helpful on arrival. The Concierge was also great - the suite was faultless, light and bright with all the home comforts! The breakfast room and terrace gardens were exceptional. You couldn't go wrong staying at this hotel which is incredibly central to everything and pricing was excellent. The Q4 restaurant next door was very good for dinner (so you didn't have to walk far). Khrys & Geoffrey Thomas Perth Western Australia

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: BrianC865
Reviews.Content: A surprisingly small hotel which was a definite plus resulting in excellent service. Ideal location for exploring Vancouver. We spent three full days here (5 nights) which was about right to get the full L'Hermitage and Vancouver experience. Relaxing in the pool and jacuzzi followed by a glass of wine in the lounge was my personal highlight.

Reviews.Title: “best of the best--you will be spoiled!!!”
Reviews.Author: shaynashayna
Reviews.Content: You will hate to leave!!!! Ray is so helpful, he makes you feel like you are the only guests he has to care for. Great staff, large super clean rooms, great location, everything here is the best of the best. Only downside? You have to leave and may never find another hotel so special with a staff that is also so special. Cannot wait to go back. Hope you will be waiting for us Ray!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Derek1971
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at alot of luxury Hotels all over the world and this would have to be in the Top 3, without a doubt. The service is outstanding and attention to detail second to none every positive you read about this hotel is spot on. The staff makes this place and were always professional, helpful and polite and the concierge Raymond was brilliant. Hotel Facilities- The Hotel itself is in a great location downtown and close to everything, I actually damaged my passport and needed regular trips to the consulate and this would not have been possible if I had stayed further out. Close to Steve Nash Gym and Robson shops cafe etc location was just great!!! The attraction for me booking this place was the rating and the 'boutique style' which I am becoming more accustomed to now as the service is better than the larger resort chains and this place oozed quality service. I actually felt at times that I was being over serviced if that makes sense and that the staff was trying too hard. This is no fault of the Hotel but highlights the attention to detail the guests are given in a smaller boutique style hotel. The rooms are spacious and very well maintained; I booked a Boutique Solarium room and was upgraded to the signature suite at no cost. The room itself was large and well equipped with full kitchenette and washer dryer etc and large bathroom. Soap products were of a very high quality and these are the types of details I note. The sun room was awesome and was used regularly for an office to check work emails etc. Beds were comfortable and had awesome pillows again an important element to any hotel stay. IPhone docking station on the bedside drawers!! (Another simple but very thoughtful touch) Bathroom was large with twin shower heads and a bath. Kitchen was a great addition and fridge had ice maker and there was an expresso machine also. Internet was complimentary Dining - Q4 Restaurant downstairs was open every night and served quality Italian fare. I ate there twice and could not fault the meals at all. Room service was quick and served a varied menu, zero complaints at all with the food at this Hotel. Hotel buffet breakfast was cheap at only $17.50 and served a combination of hot and cold food. Recreation facilities - Very good, outside pool I did not use due to the average weather when I was there, did not use the spa either so cannot comment on either of these. The hotel gym was simple but basic with 1 'Multi Station' gym and some free weights and cardio machines. I did not use this but instead used the Steve Nash gym one block away. (5 mins walk) Transport/Parking - The Hotel has free push bikes fir use and undercover valet is available but I am not sure of the price as I did not use it. The place is so central you do not really need transport. All in all an enjoyable stay and will definitely stay here again when next in Vancouver. Alot of other Hotel could learn alot from the service this place provides, highly recommended!!! Regards and happy holidays

Reviews.Title: “One of the best,”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshiretrev
Reviews.Content: What a place to stay. Every positive you read about this hotel is absolutely true. All the staff and especially Raymond ( Concierge) and Shaun (doorman) were so friendly, pleasant and at all times professional. Our room which was spacious, comfortable and had an excellent bathroom looked on to the swimming pool and had its own little balcony. If we were to return to Vancouver in the future this would be the first place we check for availability.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Dancer46
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here at the end of an extended Alaska vacation which ended with a Princess cruise. Rather than use their hotel and transfers, I opted for taxis and L` Hermitage. The service at this hotel is just outstanding. We arrived too early for the room to be ready and they took us to their BEAUTIFUL lounge for coffee while we waited. We decided afterwards to start our sight seeing and Raymond, the conciere, was so accommodating and knowledgeable. Everyone there wears a smile and offers a warm greeting always! We had the petite suite and it was more than adequate for our luggage which was extensive. Bathroom to die for! We even had a small patio(5th floor)!! Just can't say enough about this wonderful find!!! Go, enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Souvenir_hunter
Reviews.Content: The L'Hermitage is simply one of the best. The rooms were comfortable, luxurious and spacious, lovely views and a beautiful bathroom. But the best about the L'Hermitage is its staff. Everyone is incredibly helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. We instantly felt like home. Especially Raymond, the hotel's very own foodie, is a jewel. And if you get lucky, you will be welcomed by Hippo, the best canine concierge there is. In the end, we even stayed an (initially not intended) third night at the L'Hermitage because we simply could not (wanted not) to leave yet. A perfect stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: beverleyHampshireUK
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay here after reading the reviews. I was travelling on my own which I was not used to The staff were very helpful in helping with questions and especially Raymond the concierge Room was excellent spacious and clean Such a good location for everything in downtown vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with fantasic staff”
Reviews.Author: Andybmac
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel,the staff, without exception we excellent,knowledgeable,helpful,and willing to offer ways to improve your stay. The room was super, good size, with bath and shower.we had breakfast a couple of times, and though a touch pricey it was very good. My only negative was the wifi reception was poor, which considering that most travellers will us it is not acceptable. The hotel know and are working to resolve this, apart from this a gem!

Reviews.Title: “There is a Good Reason This is #1!”
Reviews.Author: SageGuy
Reviews.Content: I really can't do anything but echo the sentiments of other reviewers that rated this property as Excellent. What makes this hotel especially good are the people who work at it. You can make a property look great with bricks and mortar but if the heart and soul of the business, the staff, don't bring it to life, it's just a building. Bringing the guest experience to life is what separates L'Hermitage from its competitors. From the time I drove up until I left, I felt like I was a welcomed and valued guest. This is a rarity these days. Suffering from a hearing impairment can make it difficult for myself and others. The staff at L'Hermitage handled this with good grace and courtesy. If you don't have a good experience at L'Hermitage, I think maybe a first look in the mirror may be warranted.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karencha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hermitage after our Canada/Alaska tour and it was more than we had expected. The reception staff were excellent. We had arrived at the hotel early due to the docking of our cruise ship and our room was not ready, we were offered complimentary tea and coffee in the guest lounge while we were waiting. The suite was well laid out and we felt so comfortable and could relax after our four week tour. The location is great with easy access to all the attractions and shopping in Vancouver. There was an excellent restaurant next door which offered guests of the hotel a 15% discount - food was wonderful. We could not fault this hotel, the staff were so friendly and helpful. We would thoroughly recommend it to everyone. Thank you for making our stay in Vancouver so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura C
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. My husband and I stayed in a room that had a kitchen and washer dryer which was a nice plus. We were able to buy some food and have a leisurely light breakfast in our room before we went out and about for the day. The location is fabulous and we walked to dinner every night. The staff were wonderful and no request was too much for them. We were welcomed and called by name each time we came back to the hotel. I would highly recommend L'Hermitage Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Judith H
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The suite was beautifully laid out with great furnishings and amenities, and was extremely comfortable. However, it was the staff who really made it for us. They were all fantastic - we were called by our names, each member of staff we met spoke to us, the concierge, reception and breakfast and bar staff were so helpful. We felt really special. I aplaud the staff training. The location of the hotel is great, in a relatively quiet part of down town but within easy walking distance of many locations. The suite also had a balcony which got the late afternoon sun - a real bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: George B
Reviews.Content: Very classy hotel. We spent two weeks which was our honeymoon. We recieved complimentry wine and cheese board when we checked in. A fire alarm went off one morning and we were given a 100 dollar off our stay as compensation. Very well located but the staff were great. Nothing seemed too much trouble for them. Deserves to be the number 1 hotel in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is: wow, wow, wow”
Reviews.Author: JMtl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews, and I was blown away. I've travelled a lot, and stayed at many hotels, but this was something else. We booked a small boutique room, but when we arrived, they upgraded us to an apartment (2 bathrooms, living room, office, kithchen, laundry, balcony). It was insane! The room must have been 500 a night, but we payed 200. High end finishes everywhere (quartz surfaces, travertine/glass, nice furniture). The staff were incredibly friendly, taking care of anything we needed, making recommendations, etc. Location was right downtown, so we could walk everywhere. They had bikes available (though it was raining...welcome to Vancouver). And they have a resident dog, which was a nice touch. I'd return in a heartbeat - I could live there! They actually have residences available...hmmmm. ;)

Reviews.Title: “best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: david s
Reviews.Content: Staff made our 50th anniversary vacation to British Columbia extremely special and memorable. Arrived 10:30 pm, tired and in need of a snack. What a surprise to find a complimentary plate of delicious fresh fruit in our with a happy anniversary card signed by the manager! Room was clean, comfortable and marble bathroom was classy. Raymond, our concierge, went the extra mile to ensure our Vancouver visit was a once in a lifetime experience. When he reserved excellent restaurants for us, he obviously mentioned our 50th anniversary to the host because we received complimentary desserts. When we took a bus to UBC, Raymond told us to take a particular bus because it was an express and faster. We can't wait to return to Vancouver and stay at this incredible hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Steph1e
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L’Hermitage for four nights recently. The hotel do everything they can to help and all the staff were very polite, the dog was really sweet! The hotel is well located and we found that we could walk most places. They also have a few push bikes that they loan out and we used these one morning for a ride around Stanley Park. Overall a most enjoyable place to stay and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ejs1988
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! Me and my husband stayed here for our honeymoon and had the most amazing time. The staff were so friendly and helpful and made sure we were well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Audrey52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. This was our first visit to Vancouver and L'Hermitage is in a perfect location to tour the city. The staff was very helpful with providing info as to where to visit and to eat. There is a lovey rooftop pool and cafe. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and hope to be able to come back again sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Property!”
Reviews.Author: ABKBPeoria_AZ
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Vancouver and we stayed for 4 nights in a one bedroom signature suite. It's a small, modern, very clean hotel we had a small patio with chairs and a view of the city (7th floor). Easy walk to a grocery store down the street to buy wine and goodies for the room. We also walked to dinner. Vancouver was getting great weather so we used the pool and outdoor jacuzzi. I'd come back if I wanted to be in the downtown area. Service at the front desk and bellman very good. It doesn't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality, Kindness, Professionalism, Comfort, Trendy/Hip”
Reviews.Author: shfn
Reviews.Content: After many hours of flight across Canada from Iqaluit to Montreal to Winnipeg and arriving in Vancouver I was distressed to find out Booking.com had me booked for October instead of September 16th-18th. Jason and Ted from the front desk were above and beyond helpful. They were attentive to my mentioned allergies/asthma and booked a lovely room for me in spite of the fact they were not expecting me. A sigh of relief upon the lovely room and location. Unfortunately they had no room for tomorrow night. In spite of this, Jason spent almost one hour helping to find me another hotel for the following night. Not only does L'Hermitage deserve its #1 Tripadvisor rate, but Jason at the front desk and Ted made a potentially very stressfull situation completely reassuring by their steady kind help. These gentlemen represent the highest standard of consideration, hospitality, and professionalism. My only regretb is that I cannot stay longer - but will certainly come again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Chic”
Reviews.Author: Denise3d7
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage staff was wonderful and friendly. My fiance and I had a late check-in and staff was there to greet us with smiles. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The room was beautiful and spacious. It's within walking distance to a lot of shops and attractions. The shopping center is right around the corner. I would definitely recommend the L'Hermitage when visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with the best staff I've even enountered at any hotel!”
Reviews.Author: married∈love
Reviews.Content: After reading the rave reviews I booked this hotel for our first trip to Canada and it was a wonderful choice. We stayed in a solarium room with a king bed and loved it so much I hated to leave for our next destination Seattle and our stay at a Westin there (read Westin towers review). What makes this place so great? The over top accommodating staff that you have to be a celeb to get in LA but is just how they do things here. And if you haven't been to Vancouver yet its clean, green and the people are friendly although it has the big city issues all big cities have like; pan handlers, drug addicts that ask for food or change on Robson Street where people of all types walk around at night. Things to do while visiting: Stanley Park: is a beautiful green park with wonderful views of the harbor that you can bike, drive or walk around and it would be perfect for a picnic too!
