It's my new favorite park! Capilano Suspension Bridge: fun walk across a long suspension bridge and several other smaller suspension bridges but pricey at about 35.00 each! Take your triple A card for a discount and yes, they have Triple A in Canada but its called something slightly different. The Farmers Market: there's an area on Vancouver Island where there is an ongoing, small farmers market that also incorporates spaces for other artisans showing & selling they're works. You can find gourmet cheeses and breads and lots of lovely things to buy & take back to your gourmet kitchen at L'Hermitage including some lovely flowers for your room! Drive to Whistler: I like to drive around, so we kept a car while in Vancouver but you could do without. So, when our seaplane to Victoria was grounded for fog in the am we drove to Whistler instead which is a modern and well planned out ski area that was a fun little day trip after a 2 + hour drive, which gave us some lovely views along the way. Victoria Island: fly over on a sea plane as we did and have a new adventure + save yourself the long ferry lines and time it takes to get there. Keep in mind the planes are prop, smaller and rock while docked before taking off in the harbor. So if you are claustrophobic and get seasick easily, take the ferry instead! Bonus, there's a lovely little park and walking area very near the seaplane docks if you'd like a nice walk after or before your flight! Buchart's Gardens in Victoria: lovely, but small in size as far as I'm concerned and I was underwhelmed but we enjoyed it. We got a packaged deal through our hotel and walked to the bus that took us to the gardens which were around 30 minutes from downtown Victoria. Whale and killer whale watching in Victoria: a great way to see more than just parts of island is to get on a small plane (which we did) or out on the water. So, we enjoyed doing this although we didn't see any whales killer or otherwise and only sea lions and some dolphins. I have to add that it was very surprising that our tour company was so apologetic and kind for of our not getting to see the whales, that they offered to let us come back again for free. Only in Canada have I even been offered anything like that! Canada your manners rock! All in all we had a lovely time & I know you'll enjoy your trip to Canada too:)

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: JetsDad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful; I would highly recommend a stay here. The hotel has a terrific staff and the really take care of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: caropete
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage was a fantastic place to stay. The hotel is chic and stylish, and the staff really know what customer service means. From the moment we arrived early, when we were invited to relax with a complimentary coffee by the pool until our room was ready, to the moment we left, we felt incredibly well looked after. Our room was beautiful and spacious with the most comfortable King size bed, the Orangerie dining room provided an exceptional breakfast, and all of the staff were attentive and friendly, offering suggestions and help which made our stay special - especially the recommendation that we take the hotel's bicycles to explore Stanley Park - good fun! We would love the opportunity to stay at L'Hermitage again if we find ourselves back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: traveler9999999999
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very nice located in the city centre, pleasant staff very service orientated.

Reviews.Title: “pcfamily”
Reviews.Author: pc1546
Reviews.Content: Excellent standards, well positioned and friendly boutique hotel. Perfect for business or leisure stays.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: sergeantWorthing
Reviews.Content: We will use this again. We stayed on 3 separate occasions in quick succession. The staff were always helpful, charming and friendly, the rooms elegant and spacious (wonderful bathrooms) and the location was great, particularly if you are flying in (2 blocks down from Vancouver City Centre station on the Canada Line. Don't even think about a cab, on a Sunday when there is no $5 surcharge it cost under $6 for my wife and me to get to the airport. Heathrow and London Underground hang your heads in shame). Treat yourself to the $17.50 breakfast buffet, it must be the best "posh" value in Vancouver !

Reviews.Title: “R.J. and M.C.”
Reviews.Author: Guinness442
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in particularly in regards to location,quality and attitude of all staff and standard of room..We were warmly greeted by the front desk staff and given lots of help.The concierge staff went out of their way to accommodate requests for information,the breakfast staff were attentive and friendly and the the room service staff always spoke and smiled if they walked past you.We would definitely stay here again if we are able to return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location ...”
Reviews.Author: BuddyMiles
Reviews.Content: Yes, L'Hermitage is ideally situated between Yaletown and Gastown and you could spend all your vacation just roaming between these two Vancouver neighborhoods filled with great restaurants, bars and retail stores. But that would be ignoring the quirky elegance of this hotel, and the other great areas of town. First, we had a three bedroom suite overlooking the pool area from a private veranda the size of a dance floor. Comfortable bedding, marble bath rooms with large showers en suite, personal expresso machine and very quiet surroundings made for a welcome home after a hard day hiking the City. Top this off with a friendly staff with a french bulldog mascot greeter in the lobby (which my kids loved!), along with a decent price point and you can see why we will be coming back to L'Hermitage!

Reviews.Title: “It really is as excellent as everyone says...”
Reviews.Author: rjs121
Reviews.Content: I have to say I'm a picky Brit when it comes to accommodation and particularly customer service so when I saw the reviews for this hotel, it had to be the choice for our long weekend in Vancouver. I remained however skeptical - until we arrived. After a long and bumpy flight from Heathrow, we were extremely tired and having driven into the city on the 'other side of the road' in a strange car, we were also pretty cranky. All of this however disappeared when we arrived. Ted and the other staff at the front desk whisked the luggage up to our room and check in was a breeze with everything clearly explained. I'd only got a boutique room - I say only due to the price but the room was large, immaculately designed, exceptionally clean with a really large bed which led to a glorious nights sleep. The hotel is peaceful and civilised, the breakfast buffet is superb but above every single member of staff was polite, informative, helpful and positive. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Having been round the world twice now, I'm struggling to think of a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff and service.”
Reviews.Author: Trevor J
Reviews.Content: Great location in the centre of the city. Nothing was too much trouble. We would highly recommend it. And a $100 discount offered when a fire alarm (false alerm luckily) woke the guests at 5.30am was above and beyond any necessity. Thank you to all the staff Trevor & Dianne Adelaide, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Perfect end to our Wedding night”
Reviews.Author: Reinier H
Reviews.Content: The front desk was fantastic. Check in and check out were a breeze as they let me spend more time with my family and getting to the wedding. It was the perfect end to our wedding night, the room was top notch! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alisha R
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and loved it. The hotel, staff, and location were wonderful! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Bon Anniversaire, Hippo!”
Reviews.Author: Mdmjames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at l'hermitage for 3 nights at the start of our honeymoon. The location is perfect for exploring Vancouver and the rooms were extremely spacious & very good value for a city centre hotel. Most importantly though the hotel really has a character. The staff were unbelievably helpful & we will never forget Hippo's 5th birthday party! Thank you, Hippo

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: lover2travel78
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights and absolutely loved it. Concierge was amazing and took care of all reservations for us, gave us good tips for sightseeing and were always one step ahead of us in our expectations. The hotel is beautiful, we had a fireplace in our room, bathrooms were gorgeous, had chocolates on our pillows every night and the lounge was beautiful as well. We would definitely come back and highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barry G
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very modern and luxurious. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. There was one issue which was handled extremely well. We were awoken at 5:30am by a false fire alarm due to a sprinkler system error. The hotel gave everyone who exited the hotel a $100 credit toward their stay, which we felt to be extremely gracious.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyG09
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at L'Hermitage at the hotel truly is spectacular, gorgeous hotel, beautiful rooms we'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It's a home, not a hotel! Loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: ro953
Reviews.Content: We had the privilege to stay 3 days prior to our Alaska cruise. I found the hotel through Trip Advisor as this was our first visit to Vancouver. What we didn't realize was that the L'Hermitage is primarily a residence that they rent a small portion of the units as a hotel. You can imagine our surprise when we arrived and found our room equipped with top-end appliances (e.g.: SubZero refrigerator!) and a washer/dryer combination in the closet! We also dined at the attached restaurant, Q4 Al Centro which was also excellent and gives you a discount if you are staying at the hotel. The hotel is also located adjacent to a grocery store at the corner - which is very convenient, particularly when you are traveling with kids. The only thing that we'd note as a minor negative is the small bathroom (we were in a 1 bedroom unit suite) so we had to use the kitchen counter as overflow space. If you are traveling with a family and want/need a kitchen and washer/dryer, this is your only and best choice for a luxury property.

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Place for a Date”
Reviews.Author: FirstClass2011
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect place to complete that special night with your special girl. I swam in the rooftop pool, took a dip in the hot tub, and had breakfast in the lounge. Your girlfriend will love the special attention to detail that this hotel has. Absolutely blew me away. This is not a place you want to stay if you are on business. I give it a low rating for value because I personally don't see much "value" in luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: ad0ree
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the two bedroom suite with family members. It had everything one needs,including a terrific full kitchen,; the beds are very comfortable; and the service is excellent, plus it is very centrally located in downtown Vancouver. We would definitely return to this hotel gladly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Lavagna
Reviews.Content: If and when I visit Canada again this hotel will be a definite. It is great!

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Tonyviz
Reviews.Content: As soon as you walk in you see smiling faces waiting to help you. The room was big and clean with WiFi. The bathroom was clean as well, the fan in the bathroom was a little noisy. They had a Nespresso coffee machine in the room. I also got to use the business center with access to a computer and printer. I like the staff there who are eager to help you enjoy your stay. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Joo Y
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 31 nights. The people who are working for the hotel treated me like their family members and made me feel so comfortable as if I were at home. They are so friendly that I almost forgot that I was far away from home. If you ask whether I like to stay at this hotel again next time, I will definitely say "why not?"

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: DebNewCity
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage is a beautiful, accommodating, clean and friendly hotel in an absolutely beautiful city! The staff go out of their way to make you feel as if you are on vacation in your home! The suite we had was wonderful! I couldn't recommend this hotel more! It's is really a find!!

Reviews.Title: “Could they possibly do anymore for you?”
Reviews.Author: Islasusan
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot. We arrived at L'Hermitage after more than 2 weeks on an Alaska land/sea tour. We all were emotionally and physically exhausted. We had decided to add 3 extra days to see the city of Van Couver, BC. We arrived at the door of this hotel to be greeted by a staff member who seemed to read our mind. "Don't worry about your luggage", and we had a lot. Jennifer, greeted us like she was waiting for us to arrive. She took care of everything, excorted us up to a private louge to enjoy a respite with drink and fireplace. I wanted to curl up on the sofa in front of it. Then we went down and she introduced us to Raymond the magnificent concierge. We sprawlled in chairs by his desk while he took care of everything, multitasking phone lines, arranging everything we were to do for the next 3 days.When we arrived back at the hotel from our trips to Victoria, too tired to think we could get to dinner, he sent us across the street to eat. We walked in the door and the hostess called us by name, said our reservation had been taken care of and seated us at a reserved table. We felt like royalty at L'Hermitage. Have I mentioned the mascott? Yeah, greeted by the cutest bulldog ever. Now, let me tell you about the suite. We walked in to see a full kitchen, ultra modern with stainless steel appliances, in suite washer/dryer, living room, balconey,sattelite TV, 2 full bathrooms, bedroom with kingsize bed to die for. I was in heaven, I could live there. I don't know when I will or if I will ever go back to Vancouver as it's a 2 day trip cross the US for us, but I would go back time and time again just to stay and be enveloped in the warmth and kindness of the staff of this truly gorgeous, incredible hotel. Do not miss the chance to stay here. Take a trip to Vancouver just to stay here and then absorb everything Vancouver and everything surrounding it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Most fabulous hotel stay anywhere”
Reviews.Author: a b
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage was perfect on so many levels. The staff is top notch- friendly, knowledgable and completely service oriented w/o being stuffy or over the top. Location is great. Very convenient and central. We stayed in the Signature Suite (to which they upgraded us to help accommodate an out of town guest!) which was simply wonderful. The little study off the bedroom is great for view and also served as a perfect spot for the crib! The kitchen was well appointed and stocked (toaster, blender, Nespresso machine..). The bed was super comfy. We will definitely be going back to Vancouver. And definitely be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanying c
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage Hotel is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at.The rooms are beautiful and tastefully prepared. All employees extremely friendly and very helpful. If I'll ever come back to Vancouver again that's the place I'll stay.

Reviews.Title: “a lucky find”
Reviews.Author: t4f1051
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel in a great location. The accomodations were luxurious and relaxing. The staff were all friendly and helpful. Everything that we wanted to do was within walking distance of the hotel . . .if one is a good walker. There is grocery store on the corner too. Complimentary bikes are also available. The 5th floor breakfast buffet was very good too. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tina D
Reviews.Content: Large comfortable, moden rooms. Good outdoor pool and gym. Friendly staff, Raymond the concierge was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: fourcats
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights prior to our Alaska cruise. Great location downtown close to shopping and attractions. Grocery store at the corner . Beautifully decorated . Very high end kitchen. Staff is so friendly and helpful. We actually felt like they appreciated our business. Unlike the big chains who really could care less if you stayed with them or not. Will definitely stay again next time we are in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rocksville
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2011. Admittedly we got an upgrade, but the suite we ended up with was just fantastic. To make matters even better, we thought the breakfast was without doubt the best we had over the five week period we were away. When we needed to check our bags while we sorted out car hire the next day staff could not have been more helpful with directions and service. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Jean-Michel makes this place great”
Reviews.Author: InformInteriors
Reviews.Content: we showed up late and with a broken window on our car. they helped us bring everything in before parking it - then proceeded to vacuum it all out and in the morning rang with an estimate for replacing the broken window asking permission to proceed... all without request! the car was not ready on time and they let us check out very late at 4:30. outstanding hotel. outstanding client service and a huge thank you and bravo to Jean Michel, his team and Hippo!

Reviews.Title: “a lovely oasis in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: luvgreathotels
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant, quiet and upscale boutique hotel right in the middle of downtown Vancouver. Within walking distance of many of the tourist attractions. I loved the one bedroom suite with kitchen [ask for a unit overlooking the pool for a nice view and spa-like sounds!!]. This unit is like a condo with a large sitting area [like a living room], a patio overlooking the pool area, a nice-sized bedroom and bathroom. The kitchen is ultra-deluxe and well equipped and is great for preparing morning cofffee, snacks and meals. The room is very quiet and amazingly sound-proof given you are right in the heart of dowtown. The staff are very pleasant and accommodating. The business centre [free internet] is luxurious and has a a home library feel. The lounge and breakfast area is lovely [you can sit outside] and the pool area is spotless and very esthetically pleasing. Oh yes, HIppo the dog is adorable!!! When I return to Vancouver, I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ed K
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of our anniversary trip through Canada. Vancouver was our last stop and we wanted a Boutique Hotel near the downtown area. When we arrive, which was well before checkin, we were greeted by the friendly, helpful and accomodating staff. They checked us in, put our car in a very safe place and guided us to the 5th street lounge for coffee and tea while they readied our room, which by the way they upgraded to the one bedroom suite free of charge! Here are a few observations: 1. Always attentive staff. 2. Very clean facilty 3. Excellent location. Just blocks from downtown, marketplace, waterfront, dining, etc. 4. Free city bikes to ride 5. Safe! Security protocols and systems best-in-class 6. Good value 7. Grocery store under hotel 8. Starbucks right across street 9. Bus line right out front door I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... great position”
Reviews.Author: gris1969
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice, clean and has a great position!! Try it and you'll never be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays I've had.”
Reviews.Author: Jacob L
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews but rarely write them. I've worked a lot in hotel and restaurant management. I've also had hotel stays in 49 of the 50 states. This is one of the loveliest hotels I've ever had the pleasure of staying. The petite suite was larger than most standard hotel rooms. The bathroom was huge and gorgeous. We arrived at 8am and since our room wasn't ready, we were invited to have tea in the 5th floor dining/lounge. Salt water pool was great. Everyone on the staff, from the GM Mr. Eleiter to the maid service was really pleasant. The canine concierge complete with business cards was a brilliant touch. I don't think the restaurant next door Q4 was technically associated, but it was equally as pleasing. I only stayed 2 full days and 1 night, but am looking forward to revisiting. The rates were pretty reasonable considering the quality of service and amenities. JL NYC

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: neilgleeds
Reviews.Content: Superb suite which had everything that you could want. The staff were very helpful and attentive. Excellent location within walking distance of most tourist areas.The breakfast was really good. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great start of our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jrg81
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here upon our arrival in Canada. Wow, this place is lush! Great location, fantastic room, friendly staff and very reasonable priced considering you're in down town Vancouver. Free bycicle hire, book On time as they only have 2 available. Breakfast is a DO! We'll stay here on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: nick07
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suite with a very comfortable bed. Within walking distance of most down areas including Gastown, Canada Place and the Museum. We even walked to Granville Market in about 20 minutes (via the little passenger ferry)./ Breakfast although expensive was superb. The 5th floor pool and spa were very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: brassbander
Reviews.Content: Fully deserves it's high rating. Staff very attentive and polite. Beds very comfortable - not always a given. Included wifi, pool and gym all added to an enjoyable stay. With a severe food allergy in the family, having the kitchenette and the grocery store on the corner was useful too.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: T_Seattle_2011
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vancouver frequently. Recently, our usual hotel was converted to a condominium building, so we branched out and stayed at the L'Hermitage property. We were very pleased with the service, room, and overall experience at the hotel. We were greeted upon arrival with friendly staff and canine concierge. The suite was spacious and impeccably furnished, and was spotless. The neighborhood was conveniently located, and the staff were helpful in making reservations and providing directions. We will definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: woodstockeros
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at L'Hermitage, we were treated as esteemed guests. Everyone, (including Hippo the canine concierge who greeted us at our cab), went out of their way to welcome us. I wondered if this level of attention would be sustained throughout our stay, and to our very pleasant surprise, it was. Raymond, one of the human concierges, was particularly helpful, providing us great recommendations and assistance on restaurants and other outings. It was evident that every employee, down to the cleaning staff, was trained to engage us and to make sure they were exceeding our expectations. The rooms were elegant, the bathroom spacious, and the beds comfy. The location couldn't have been better as it's mere steps from a busy corner of Robson where several world cuisines could be tasted in one street block, including the must-try Japa Dog! On our return to Vancouver, we won't bother to research other hotels or deals. We'll simply give Hippo a call (yes he has business cards) and arrange for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend you stay here.....”
Reviews.Author: UKDannyboy
Reviews.Content: Ideal location, lovely hotel, excellent service, attentive staff, great rooms, a wee gem in a big city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Naturelover212
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage deserves all the superlatives it receives! A wonderful experience with attentive, courteous hotel personnel.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: BJ Z
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay at L'Hemitage could not have been more perfect, from the personal greeting from the late night staff when we arrived close to midnight from a horrible cross country flight to the comfort of the gorgeous room, to the lovely terrace, to the incredible snacks and wine, The hotel is small, intimate, close to everything in Vancourver, and ideal for the serious traveler who appreciates value and comfort. I could live there!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect home base for Vancouver exploration”
Reviews.Author: cora2364
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful and at the same time comfortable place to return to after a day of adventures in the city. Elegant and welcoming at the same time is the best way I can think to describe it. We loved it. Of course, there's also Hippo, the canine concierge - not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Kateb07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in a 1 bedroom signature suite. After reading all the fantastic reviews on Tripadvisor, I was slightly worried that the hotel would not meet all my expectations based on the reviews, however, I did not need to be worried as it certainly lived up to all the expectations I had and more. All the staff were extremely helpful and welcoming. Our suite was lovely with a fully fitted kitchen which came in handy when we decided to cook one evening due to having a bigger lunch on one our days in Vancouver. There is a supermarket on the corner of where the hotel is located where we stocked up and a Tim Horton’s is also next door to the supermarket which was handy to grab a bagel and coffee in the mornings for breakfast as an alternative to eating in the hotel. The hotel is in a good location just a few minutes away from Robson Street for shopping, lots of restaurants nearby and about a 5/10 minute walk to the front. We ate in the restaurant in the hotel on our first night and appreciated the 15% discount that hotel guests receive. We also ate at the Tea House in Stanley Park, Joe Fortes and Coast which were all fantastic. Would we stay here again? 100% yes!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Live Like A Local - In Style”
Reviews.Author: civilizedtravel
Reviews.Content: I started staying at L'Hermitage earlier this year after hearing great reviews about the hotel. Honestly it is much more than a hotel, as the property is much more like a condo complex than a hotel. The rooms are spectacular with the suites really being like full apartments complete with designer kitchens, balconies, heck one even had a solarium in it! The service at L'Hermitage is outstanding and I've found that I frequently get upgraded complete free of charge. They also have these great fireplaces in each room that are simulated but can still provide heat for a nice warm and cozy feeling. If you want to experience condo life in Vancouver this is a great hotel and being only steps away from Granville and Robson you're sure to find a good bar or restaurant close by.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sillyme45
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel and LOVED our room with full kitchen and solarium. The staff was friendly, helpful and always very polite. Definitely the place to stay in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely excellent, if we are ever in Vancouver again we will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Ernest K
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and comfortable, amenities such as the pool and hot tub are phenominal and the entire staff is to be highly commended. Price is just right but should include a full breakfast. The only other, mildly negative item is that Fox News channel should be made available. We are happy to highly recommend this hotel to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel away from coal harbour”
Reviews.Author: skysydney
Reviews.Content: My initial room with air con malfunction was not good so they changed my room to overlooking the pool . It was quiet , spacious , and the bathroom huge . The staff were fantastic and personable . It was a great stay and i highly recommend this hotel to discerning travellers .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Stalex24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this great hotel for 2 nights, got upgraded to a boutique room with fully equipped kitchen and laundry. Asked for a quiet room when making reservation and the room was perfect. Very clean and well maintained. Staff very friendly and helpful. Supermarket conveniently around the corner. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's Jewel”
Reviews.Author: mousey_11
Reviews.Content: We recommend you stay at this delightful boutique hotel if you want the best location for shopping, dining & entertainment!! The L'Hermitage Hotel has the most efficient and friendly staff who fuss and make everyone who walks through the double entry doors feel SO special. The rooms are understated opulence from the gorgeous furnishings to the decadent bed linens. No feature has been overlooked for the comfort of each of their guests. The Management MUST be commended for keeping the standard of this little jewel at the highest level ever since they opened their doors until present. We LOVE LOVE LOVE L'Hermitage and so will YOU!! When you go don't forget to give their "mascot" Hippo the resident bulldog a friendly pat on his head......it's all a part of the ambiance that is ONLY L'Hermitage.

Reviews.Title: “So Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah A
Reviews.Content: There are not enough words to say how wonderful our stay at L'Hermitage was. It is a beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of Vancouver, close to: Lupo, a fabulous Northern Italian restaurant; great shops; museums; the Gaslight District; Yaletown; biking; walking and so much more. The staff is wonderful and very attentive to your every need. The rooms are beautiful, the pool a real treat, and breakfast is delicious. Hippo, the mascot French bulldog, provides the perfect welcome along with his best friend the hotel manager. We look forward to staying there for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller1404
Reviews.Content: A wonderful small hotel in the centre of Vancouver. Helpful staff and a delicious breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Godel
Reviews.Content: Fantastic apartment. Bedroom, office, living room, first class kitchen equipped with gaz range and all other amenities plus washer and dryer. Two full bathrooms and an office and a terrace. We spent a week there while visiting our daughters. We could buy fruits at a grocery store next door and eat our breakfast ¨at home¨. We even had the girls for dinner after picking up sushis at one of the numerous sushi shop nearby. Centrally located and great staff who were very helpful for reservations and directions.

Reviews.Title: “The location and service are great!”
Reviews.Author: lbhamilton27
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for the last days of our recent Honeymoon. Our room was very clean and the bed and sheets were comfortable. We really liked the "turn down" service and thought that was a great touch to this location. We had a nice patio that sat next to the pool, so it sounded like we had fountains running outside our room. Loved that element. The location is great. You can really get to anywhere in the city by foot (if you are a walker). I would recommend reserving the bicycles early, as we tried to book them but they were all book. We were also there on a holiday weekend, so that might have been part of the issue. All the staff members were very nice, especially David the concierge! He worked very hard to help us find information for an event we wanted to attend. Thanks David! And of course, Hippo the canine concierge. We loved this addition to the hotel. It really makes this place stand out. On our last night we really didn't feel like heading out, so we went to the restaurant downstairs, Q4. It was delicious and our server was awesome. We had breakfast one morning, and overall it was pretty good. The eggs were a little uncooked for us, but we know people like them that way. We really enjoyed the small fruit and yogurt parfaits! Overall, our stay here was wonderful and we will definitely be back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful hotel and fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: PerthSmarts
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night as part of our honeymoon trip and even though it doesn't look like much from the outside, the inside more than makes up for it. The hotel and rooms are magnificently furnished and maintained and we couldnt pick a fault with the service. They were extremely courteous and even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine for our honeymoon. The location of the hotel is also fairly central and within easy walking distance of the main shopping centre of Vancouver. Would highly recommend staying here if visiting Vancouver and would definitely come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: MarcWolf
Reviews.Content: We arrived by taxi and were met by Sean, the Doorman who greeted us with a big "hello and welcome to the L'Hermitage". We entered the beautiful lobby and were greeted by the front desk employees (sorry, do not remember their names) with smiles and also big hello's. Hippo the Canine Concierge also greeted us in the lobby. Every member of their staff that we had contact with were very friendly and offered to assist in any way. They recommended restaurants, city tours, shopping areas, ect. Our room was beautiful and I wish we were able to stay longer. Internet access is provided free of charge. Their business center was equipped with two computers, a printer and no-charge internet. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “THIS HOTEL TRIES VERY HARD!”
Reviews.Author: elev121
Reviews.Content: We reserved for five nights but found our room to be way too small and asked for a larger one (there are three sizes.) We were told that the middle size was available for the last three nights, but we would have to stay in the small one for the first two. After a lot of juggling and computer tapping we wound up with one night in the small room and the balance of the stay with a single upgrade at a lower rate than originally booked!! Very nice of them. The hotel is about four blocks from the center of town-an easy cab ride to anywhere. Be aware that all restaurants charge $7 or more to valet park which is much cheaper than a round trip cab ride from the hotel with a tip. Nespresso coffee makers in every room and we got a drip coffee machine in addition. The hotel's attitude towards service is unequalled. Every request by phone is handled at the front desk-no transfering to different departments. They fall at your feet to accommodate every request. The only negative thing that I might say is that their doorman many times is nowhere to be found. No one to greet your car at arrival. No one to take your bags from the car and no one to take your car when returning from a drive or an outing. On the positive side someone is always there with a bottle of water when leaving the building.

Reviews.Title: “Could not stay but experienced excellent front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: tropicalia
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Vancouver only to discover a mistake by our travel agent, the wrong date, two days later. Unfortunately, the hotel was full, but the front t desk staff could not do enough for us, ensuring our comfort while they searched for a hotel room. They found us another excellent hotel, but I can only praise the attention we received, the staff went beyond any expectation. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: cre8gale
Reviews.Content: Came across this hotel on trip advisor - we had been booked into the Fairmont on Georgia and hated it. We tried to book L'Hermitage first, but they were booked. Apparently they had an opening and we were able to switch over for 2 nights. It was an excellent move. The staff was very accomodating, rooms were very spacious and modern. Their lounge for breakfast was perfect - we loved the small hotel feel and will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Aussie family of 3 stays for 10 days - great visit and comfortable suite accommodation”
Reviews.Author: whizzyPerth
Reviews.Content: Selected the Hotel based on reviews - ours was a 1-bed Signature suite for 3 people - 2 adults and a 16 year old on the sofa bed that was created by the turndown team, who also left chocolates. Accommodation very clean, quiet (except for a little noise from the ac system as mentioned by others, but we turned it off...) and top quality fittings and fixtures. Staff always polite and warm..and humorous, which we liked. Hippo was loved by all. We bought granola, fruit (blueberries were yummy) and bread for light breakfasts (from the nearby IGA) and cooked a few light meals in the fully equipped kitchen when we felt like a night in. I used the gym - great and never that busy at 6pm. Did our endless laundry in the suite - washer and drier installed and very useful. We walked everywhere, very pedestrian friendly Vancouver and safe. Saw all D&K Eyewitness Top 10 things in 10 days, no probs and still relaxed. Nice Guest's Lounge area where we enjoyed wine and cheese. Suite and Hotel perfect for our needs and would choose again for a return trip. Also would recommend this place to our friends. One more thing - free wifi incorporated in our room rate.

Reviews.Title: “New and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeSnow
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at L'Hermitage. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was terrific, with modern fittings and a lovely balcony. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was huge. Robson Street is just round the corner. Definitely good value for money and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice hotel and the people were incredibly accomodating, but don't stay on the pool side”
Reviews.Author: eprogers
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a good location and the rooms were nice. We had a couple situations that required some special assistance and the staff was incredibly accomodating. e.g. only expresso machine in the room. I asked if they had a coffee machine and they delivered one in minutes. No coffee though...called back and in 5 minutes they delivered enough coffee for 3 days. Everything was very nice except were were on the 5th floor and the pool was just one floor below us on our side and the noise from the pool was a continual problem. Stay on the non pool side or the top floor. 8?

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: perrin99
Reviews.Content: This was a stopover on our way to Whistler. Perfect service and good location for a Canucks game (10 min walk). The reception staff managed to get us a table at a fantastic italian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: RFBoston
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage does it just right on so many levels.The hotel isn't stuffy and the facility is beautiful. The staff in every department are well trained and very pleasant and very pro active. Our standard room was spacious and very quiet. The bed and linens were great. The Nespresso machine got a lot of use and it was a great addition to the room. Breakfast buffet in the posh dining room was yummy. The pool and jacuzzi was very nice as was the fitness center. If you have time, take advantage of the free bikes. Vancouver is so bike friendly and its a great way to see the city. You may have the pleasure of running into 'hippo' the official hotel bull dog......he's a real cutie. I only wish there were more l'Hermatage Hotels --- i'm hooked!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in Every Respect!”
Reviews.Author: robotmuppet
Reviews.Content: We simply loved this hotel! Great location, great service, beautiful rooms and bathrooms, free internet, well-equipped gym, nice pool... and a really cute dog in the lobby. Without a doubt we would stay here again in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “LHermitage is the greatest”
Reviews.Author: PeterProud
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for a long weekend at L'Hermitage and have nothing but rave reviews. The room was spectacular as was the staff and service. Great location and we really couldn't have asked for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hermitage is one of the top 7 Hotels in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: advcardio
Reviews.Content: Once we stepped into our room we were greeted with soft music, a large king size bed and a private outside patio (table with 4 chairs) with privacy screens. Double doors opened up to a large modern marble bathroom with a separate shower, deep bathtub (no jets) and a closed toilet area. The towels were just "meh" and not luxurious but rough to the feel- the same as the comp guest robes. What did impress was the "guts" to offer ONE bar of soap not two or more for a one night stay. They offered other "Green" options as well- bonus points. The bed and linens equaled of a 5 star quality. One previous reviewer even stated that no movement from the other sleeper could be felt- agreed! The sound proofing was good but if you choose to keep a window open you will hear noise from the traffic below. The "fireplace" in the room was nothing more than a dancing light, no real flames or romance with this feature. We stayed in the Loden Hotel last year but feel the L"Hermitage was better simply for room size and a place to relax in the Cosmo but cozy lounge called L'ORANGERIE. Business centre’s in hotels are important for us and they again scored well with this upstairs modern centre however the wi fi in the room was a BUST- as it kept losing bars or signals and simply could not use it. The hotel offers a very clean comfortable room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful,simple elegance - definately will recommend!”
Reviews.Author: cklassen3
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the location, attention to detail, helpfulness, friendliness....found the AC in room not as effective as it could have been - very warm at night and the AC kept on kicking off....other than that.....superb wknd with family,and would definately be back for another one!! Thankyou!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: junetalks
Reviews.Content: L' Hermitage Hotel was one of the best places we have ever stayed. The level of service was comparable to the Peninsula in Hong Kong. Our suite was the perfect pied a terre for our stay in Vancouver. The concierge led us to fantastic restaurants we would have never chosen on our own. There is even an old library in the business lounge with books and encyclopedias from the early 1900's. Best of all this is a reasonably priced hotel with better rooms and services than many places that might charge a lot more. Treat yourself to L'Hermitage if you visit Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: ann_and_aron
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the past few years having recently had kids, we are normally big travelers, so I'm picky. This place was perfect! We stayed in Room 704, pool view room, very quiet. I can't sleep with city noise so normally need fans and white noise, but it was remarkably quiet. We stayed in a 1 bedroom signature suite. The bedroom was closed off from the main room consisting of a couch, chair, kitchen with better appliances than most peoples' kitchens, a cute little Nespresso maker (delicious little cappuccinos every morning, if I didn't have a Keurig, I'd buy one of these...well, I want both). The bathrooms were clean and I actually walked in on a maid at one point CLEANING the toilet very thoroughly. This was just surprising to me since you see so many stories about how dirty hotel rooms are and that the maids just make it look surface clean. Anyway- that was a biggie for me:) My husband and I tried to make it back before 10 every night so we could get in the hot tub. It was very hot but awesome - and since the hotel is small, it was always just us or maybe another couple with us. We actually went to a larger fancy hotel just to get massages and they shared their locker room with the hotel guests and it was pretty nasty and chaotic in there. I was so glad we picked L'Hermitage. I picked it based on other Trip Advisor reviews and luckily, it was right on for us. Now, the royalty comments I kept reading about - that's a little extreme, but they were courteous and we had great service if we ever needed anything - exactly how I'd act if I knew someone might turn around and write a review about the experience for the whole world to see. The location was such a nice central spot. If we had realized, we'd have taken the sky train the whole time rather than taxis or that hop on/hop off tourist bus. The sky train was WAY better, we took it back from the airport and should've used that much more often. L'Hermitage is small enough that you have to have the address for taxi drivers, or just say Richards and Robson. Rent a car one day and drive to Whistler in the morning and go Ziplining with Ziptrek- we're so glad we did that - wonderful company as well. I would also recommend biking through Stanley Park - L'Hermitage is nice enough to let you use a couple for free for 4 hours, but we were too scared we'd kill ourselves riding in the streets to get there- so we rented bikes and had a nice lunch at Tea House. Spent a lot more money on bikes that way but it was worth it! Anyway, fantastic hotel, wonderful city - you have the city, mountains and ocean all wrapped up in one. We will come back...some day.

Reviews.Title: “One of my top 5 and I've stayed in a lot of hotels...”
Reviews.Author: WWKY
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Boutique hotel feel. Half residence and half hotel setup. I almost wanted to buy a unit in that building. Staff was amazingly professional but personable. Room is one of the best - great size, huge terrace, and AMAZZZING bathroom!!! Can't say enough!!! Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top-shelf accommodations and service”
Reviews.Author: SimiSue
Reviews.Content: Located conveniently in downtown Vancouver, L'Hermitage provides a comfortable refuge. The staff are knowledgeable and helpful, including reception, housekeeping, room service/breakfast service, and bellmen/valets. One valet even changed a tire for us! We had a great time and would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: hawa
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel where the service and staff were so friendly and accommodating. They even have "Hippo," a French bulldog who serves as their pet concierge. Our room was delightful, comfortable and quiet. We overlooked the small lap pool and hot tob which were very welcome. We had breakfast at the buffet-everything was delicious and fresh, and twice used room service. The hotel's location is exceptional-just off Robson St. and a few blocks from Yaletown. We could walk to most restaurants and sights but used the hotel's valet service when we wanted to explore Stanley Park and the U. of British Columbia. This property was truly a find-in fact, I found the hotel by searching TripAdvisor. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough and would surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “everything was perfect1”
Reviews.Author: Jill520
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel because of the reviews on tripadvisor - and we were not disappointed. The service was great - Kimberly at the front desk was especially helpful. The room was quiet, bright, and comfortable. The location was perfect for walking all over vancouver. And it was convenient to public transit (including the aquabus) if you wanted to venture further out. I would definitely recommend the L'Hermitage and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service - lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: cas2814
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central and clean and attractive and comfortable and the staff are very helpful. Well done to the director of operations Jean Michel for running such a great hotel. Highly recomend

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barbaralanphere
Reviews.Content: From Hippo the french bull dog concierge-Yep! To Jean Michel, to everyone working in the Hotel--Quality, Warm and Gracious! Rooms were comfy and Lovely, Pool area beautiful. Location allowed my husband and I to walk or Ride bicycles everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - first rate”
Reviews.Author: 2wheeltraveller
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Stayed for 4 nights and could not ask for better. Staff were fantastic by helping out with any question or query and rooms were fantastic. We booked the 1 bedroom suite which was so comfortable. Huge bathroom and living room. Location was perfect too - right near the central Vancouver district but easy to get anywhere else. Make sure you say hello to Hippo the canine concierge if you stay - he's gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “ranks as one of the best hotels we have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: HJames32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after an Alaskan cruise and prior to catching the train to Banff. From the time we arrived the staff were so helpful and pleasant, nothing was any trouble from booking a local tour to organising the bellboy to help us with a 15kg parcel to the post office. Would love to stay here again Wheelers hill ,Australia

Reviews.Title: “Trip Advisor right on the money, as usual.”
Reviews.Author: PnM53
Reviews.Content: Once again Trip Advisor steered us in the right direction. Stayed two nights after an Alaskan cruise to check out Vancouver and could not have asked for a better hotel experience. The room, service, cleanliness, all top shelf. Good location, nice pool .....You get the idea. This hotel is a wonderful choice for a stay in Vancouver. Thanks again Trip Advisor for another right on recomendation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect & Clean Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: PghRunnerGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here two nights prior to an Alaskan cruise. The location was easy to find by taking the skytrain from the airport and walking a few blocks, & we found it centrally located within the city. The staff was extremely helpful & friendly. The room was spacious with a fireplace & balcony, and the bathroom was also spacious with a large, sunken tub & separate shower. We enjoyed using the fitness room with Life Fitness equipment, the saltwater pool & hot tub. It was like being on a cruise ship as the staff was constantly cleaning. Also, loved the dog, Hippo.....he's absolutely adorable!!!! Would recommend this boutique hotel to anyone travelling to Vancouver!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: fitchboy
Reviews.Content: Our room was lovely. Asked for an early check in and they accomodated. Told room would be ready in a little while and to go have a coffee on them while we waited. Told them it was our anniversary and received a bottle of wine. Very nice. Staff was very attentive and the breakfast buffet in the morning was quite good. The only thing I can say negative is that no one was there to help with luggage from cab to hotel entrance when we arrived but they were quick to make us feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with super customer service”
Reviews.Author: TraceRemington
Reviews.Content: Add us for a positive review of this hotel. We arrived early and had requested a room with a balcony online before our visit, and it was ready for us with a smile. From check in to check out, we could not have been happier with this hotel. The desk staff was polite and helpful with any request. Our king boutique room was on the fifth floor - room 553. It was alongside the pool...only downside for some folks would be children having fun in the saltwater lap pool, but not a problem at all for us. The hot tub alongside the pool is a must at night - felt wonderful with the cool rain coming down. The steam room was clean and very user friendly. We did not use the fitness room, but it looked very clean and had whatever one would want to stay fit while on vacation. The patio is small, but it works well and is private enough fro drinks and light meals. Shower is nice, did not use tub although it could have been a nice place to soak ... toilet separate from bath area. Bed is firmer than what I am used to, but comfortable nonetheless...my wife loved it. The room had a refrigerator which was a nice place to store beverages or snacks as well as chilled beer and wine glasses, which were replenished daily by staff. We did not eat breakfast there, but there are many less expensive options blocks away. Room had espresso coffee maker and a Cuisinart hot pot in room for herbal and regular teas, but there are many coffee options nearby. The room had an IPod connection as well as free WIFi connection if you want to use it. Nice TV with more than adequate channels. Baths have soft water and very nice toiletries. We felt the hotel was in a safe area - didn't feel afraid to walk at night. We were greeted every time we walked in the door and needed our room cards to access the elevator or anything in the hotel, which made us, feel safe as well. The room had an in-room safe too. We usually don't eat hotel food, but found dinner to be most excellent...we ate there twice even without the discounts that will be mentioned next. We took advantage of a 15% discount on dinner if you stay at the hotel, plus they have a card in their literature that gives you a free dessert for lunch or dinner. We found their food some of the best for Italian...we enjoyed the beef carpaccio twice and the penne amatriciana twice (which was fantastic) and mushroom ravioli pasta, and a great rib steak special. The wine selections were very good - beer selections were limited local and international brands but very good. The local Stanley Park beer was very good. Staff was wonderful and accommodating...very good service. We used their bikes with helmets twice. - a good idea to reserve in advance for up to four hours. They will give you water for the road. We returned after dinner to have our radio playing, dim lights on, and chocolates on the bed. We would like to extend a thank you to Sean who took good care of us, and is a very genuine, personable guy. We told him we were going to a certain restaurant, and when we got there they had a free appetizer for us...impeccable customer service; staff genuine and not sterile. Need we say more - we would return in a heartbeat per my wife.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: KeswickTraveller
Reviews.Content: If you can find a better hotel in Vancouver you will have done well but if you can find a better hotel in Vancouver without paying a whole lot more money it would be astonishing. Stay here - simple as that.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Dcm1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. We booked a suite here for two nights, and had one of the best rooms I've ever had, including a huge terrace, and large living area. The staff were all wonderful and friendly and the facilities at the hotel were second to none. Don't stay anywhere else in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: letoler
Reviews.Content: There were 3 of us going on an Alaska cruise and we decided to come early and see Vancouver. We wanted a boutique hotel and not a chain. The suite at L'Hermitage was just perfect, plenty big with 2 separate rooms and so very nice. The hotel staff was excellent as were the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodation for family.”
Reviews.Author: jpossum
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights with our young children in this hotel. Good points. Room was spacious, clean and well equiped. Staff are excellent. Supermarket nearly next door and pool lovely and warm. Less attractive points. Location. Opposite large car park and in less attractive part of town. Too far to get to buses that take you to main attractions. Missing extra touches we commonly encounter in similar priced hotels like small gifts for kids on arrival. They might also like to invest in cot sized blankets rather then giving babies double bed blankets! Street noise can be an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Intrepidtraveler1950
Reviews.Content: Good location. Walking distance to China Town, Yaletown, Gastown, major shopping areas and waterfront. Helpful staff and just overall really great experience in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Davies20
Reviews.Content: We booked the cheapest room but were very pleasantly surprised when we saw it; it was more than adequate. The staff were the best we have come across and we are very well travelled. The breakfasts were excellent also. The location would take some beating as the hotel is within walking distance of mot of the main attractions. The only bad news is the parking charge of $25 a night, which rises to nearly $34 with taxes.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie L
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 2 nights and I can honestly say I wish it had been for 2 weeks. The room was spacious, clean, beautifully designed and very user friendly. Everything had been thought of, even down to a magnifying mirror in the bathroom so that ladies could apply their eye makeup and men could have a decent shave. The staff were extremely helpful and pleasant and really couldn't do enough for you. There was an adjoining Italian restaurant, which wasn't actually part of the hotel but you could enter through the lobby and the food there was wonderful. The outdoor swimming pool area was great and there was a fitness suite also, which unfortunately we didn't get time to use. The hotel also offer a very good business service to their guests and there is a lounge area where you can have wine/cheese and biscuits in the early evening. I can honestly recommend this hotel to anyone, it is one of the best we stayed at on our trip throughout Canada. Well done and thank you for making it such a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamela060
Reviews.Content: great hotel with friendly helpful staff and lovely spacious rooms

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nb_101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights on the first leg of our Canada holiday. Fantastic staff, very helpful and friendly! Location is great (very convenient for all main attractions) and rooms are very clean and comfortable. Also impressive facilites such as free bike hire, free internet access, gym and roof top pool and jacuzzi. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves to be number 1 in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: arjunlamba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on our 4 night stay in Vancouver. I had not heard about this hotel prior to our stay and only booked here due to the Amazing reviews it got on trip advisor. And were glad to stay here. The other 2 nights we spent at the Fairmont Pacific Rim. The L'hermitage came out on tops the rooms, the service and the cozy feeling of a boutique hotel were all part of the charm. The service was amazing and they have the best and most knowledgeable concierge in town according to me. The rooms were vey spacious and reasonably priced in regard to other top hotels. Even there Italian restaurant was top class. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 4starlover
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nicely decorated and the staff are very attentive, friendly, helpful. The decor is modern, contemporary but not cold. The bed is the most comfortable we have ever slept in. It is well situated for getting to everything w/o feeling like you are in the middle of a city. We highly recommend it and esp. for the price. We stayed on the floor where they servce breakfast and it was delicious and a complete breakfast. There's a great office area too where you can use the computers. You can take the Canada line to w/in a few blocks of the hotel and walk there w/ your bags if they roll. (Take the City Center exit)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. A haven of tranquility and great comfort”
Reviews.Author: ALICEAMELIA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hermitage for a total of 5 nights spread over 2 visits, at the beginning and end of our recent holiday in BC. We had a junior suite for the 3 nights of our 1st stay which was superb, luxurious and tasteful but not overwhelming. Sadly we could not get a junior suite for our last 2 nights there as they were all ( unsurprisingly) fully booked. However our room was equally lovely ,stylish and very quiet. The decor of the hotel is very elegant and understated. The staff are really brilliant. Nothing is too much trouble; they are unfailingly helpful and courteous and a real credit to the hotel Breakfasts are delicious and a variety of different foods are offered catering to all tastes . L'Hermitage is quite small, which we really liked as it felt personal. Many of the hotels in Vancouver are extremely large, and whilst I am sure they are all very good they may lack the very personal and individual service and ambience of L'Hermitage. It is also very central, and convenient for Downtown, shopping in Robson Street and wandering around Gastown or admiring the cruise liners at Canada Place.There is a nice pool and a large outside hot-tub, perfect for resting the muscles after a hard day sight-seeing. European visitors to Vancouver, and Canada generally I believe, should be aware that the check-in times in hotels are late by comparison to Europe. We arrived about 12.20pm but could not check in until 4pm which was rather inconvenient as we had just got off an 11 hour flight. However it does say that in their literature, and they looked after our luggage in the interim, gave us the use of the lounge and provided tea and coffee. I would certainly stay there again if I were to return to Vancouver and recommend it most highly.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel, we loved stayinh there”
Reviews.Author: sandro2
Reviews.Content: A lovely central hotel, comfortable room, helpful staff and excellent buffet breakfast

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest and friendliest hotels we've ever stayed in!!”
Reviews.Author: brisben86
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here for 6 nights as the first stop on our 6 week Honeymoon in Canada - and it couldn't have been a better start. The room was spacious and well equipped, the staff were friendly and accommodating and it was superbly located in the heart of the Vancouver Metro Area. The buffet breakfast was also delicious and the whole place just had a very relaxed atmosphere. The only downside was the cost of the parking at $30+ per day once taxes were added on, but it was for Valet service and they were very quick and professional in taking down and bringing up our car. We will certainly be staying here again on our next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, large rooms, but can be loud”
Reviews.Author: wywanderlust21
Reviews.Content: Great location! No views to speak of, but it did have a small balcony. Unless you plan on waking at 6 am every a.m., don't get the two bedroom suites. Both are on the same side as a loading dock and commercial garbage compactor. We were awoken every morning to the sound of trucks backing up. That is my only complaint, however, as the staff and hotel are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “ecellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: voyager9999
Reviews.Content: Overall excellent hotel: great location, unbelievable service. Nothing negative to say. We'll stay here again when back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: anthonydoan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful. The staff is great. And the the location is perfect. Everything was in walking distance. Worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “A first class oasis”
Reviews.Author: anushena
Reviews.Content: This hotel was outstanding in many ways. The room was excellent - spacious, good fittings, view over the lap pool and an excellent bathroom. The bathroom had a separate shower, loads of room to move around nwear the basin and a a separate rom for the toilet. Access to the Internet was easy in the room or in the nearby lounge/library. The breakfast room was delightfully spacious and peaceful, with welcoming staff. The food was excellent and it all made for an easy start to the day. Staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful. Access to restaurants, shopping etc was easy on foot. After 2 months of traveling this hotel was a comfortable and welcome oasis - far more restful and enjoyable than some of the 5 star properties we had stayed in before this.

Reviews.Title: “Not too impressed”
Reviews.Author: ejf292
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful, but there was a few things that did not impress me. First, when we got there the bill I had to pay was $150 more then what the original confirmation email told me it was. It turned out there is a $50 deposit few in case you bang up the room, which was no where to be found in their emails or on their websites. That tied up a good portion of money that I could have used to take my new wife out to dinner with. Second, their breakfast buffet that you have to pay about $20 a person should not include powdered eggs, hashrowns from a box, and extremely ripe fruit. The Hampton Inn provides a much more excellent breakfast and for free - I'm sorry but for $20 a person I shouldn't have to toast my waffle, I should get to put the raw batter into a waffle iron and cook it. The room was nice, the marble fixtures in the bathroom was romantice, but overall I had expected more from such an expensive hotel, not just a little romance and helpful employees.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Cascadevalleyinn
Reviews.Content: Arrived a day early - no problem. They accomodated us and upgraded the room at no charge. Excellent recommendations by staff for restuarants that fit our special occasion request and did'nt break the bank. Took advantage of free bikes to tour and explore the city. Room was spacious and very clean with a wonderful deck. Staff quickly learned our names and acknowledged us as we walked in and out. Highly recommend for the location and price!

Reviews.Title: “Why wouldn't you stay here”
Reviews.Author: rnizmo
Reviews.Content: A great hotel with friendly staff. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay, our room was absolutely brilliant and we enjoyed relaxing in the spa and pool facilities. Not much more to say except if you’re in Vancouver stay at L’Hermitage.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy111
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous, spacious room. Lovely bathroom, comfortable bed - no complaints whatsoever. They forgot to bring our luggage up from the car when we arrived. The Duty Manager visited our room to apologise and sent us a bottle of wine by way of apology which was a nice touch. When the riot (when the Canucks lost) was going on right outside, not only did we have ringside seats, we got a 'phone call from the manager to reassure us that the hotel was secure. Breakfast was lovely and room service was also very good. The Concierge was very helpful and had excellent knowledge of both Vancouver and other areas including Whistler. Do talk to him when you stay, he really knows his stuff! The service is exactly what you should expect from a 5* hotel. Some of the best service we've had outside Asia! Valet parking is expensive but Vancouver is expensive. At least you don't have the hassle of trying to park and you know the car is secure. We'll stay here when we visit Vancouver again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - definitely worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneRosemary
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and found the staff extremely helpful. Our room was spacious, large bathroom and very comfortable bed. We had an early morning departure from the hotel and they even organized complimentary coffee and croissants at 5am before we left. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Business is Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: BritIt
Reviews.Content: Superb reception, assistance, Maitre D/concierge, doorman, room. Bathroom almost bigger than that bedroom with King size bed. Balcony not used and near to loud air con but interior room very good. Turn down service. In room assistance for adjusting temperature/air con operation. L'Orangerie free coffee or tea, beautiful modern fire place. Never swam in outdoor pool (raining). Great ambassadors for Vancouver, and gave great support to nearby police action re: post Canucks game 7--told visitors how supportive Van residents are, and peaceful (attested to by messages on local businesses apologizing for hooliganism...). Storage room for luggage if in transit. Best stay this year (I've travelled 37 nights). Will return without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: RatchfordJ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel to stay two nights prior to boarding our cruise ship to Alaska. If we were doing it again we might very well choose L'Hermitage again. We found it to be a great location for seeing Vancouver. It's about a 2-block walk to catch the SkyTrain, and about 1-block to a Hop-On/Hop-Off sightseeing tram stop. We arrived in Vancouver by AmTrak from Seattle and the cab ride was only 5 minutes and less than $10. When we were ready to cruise, it was a pleasant 15-minute mostly downhill walk from the hotel to the Canada Place pier terminal. We never needed a car or another taxi. We had a suite in the hotel that was very modern, attractively decorated, clean and well appointed with excellent customer service throughout. A memorable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bernie1976
Reviews.Content: It was great to arrive after a long journey to a crisp, clean room. Staff were very friendly and helpful and we had a lovely relaxing time here. We stayed here for 3 nights on arriving in Canada before travelling up to Whistler - my only regret is that we couldn't book back in on our return and ended up staying at The Sutton Place which was far inferior to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: HKtravelHK
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel, everyone is so helpful and really want to make your stay the best they can. In some ways I wish it didn't get such good reviews as I want to keep it a secret for any other trip I make to Vancouver as the prices are bound to go up as it's so good. We were in Canada for our honeymoon and stayed at 6 different hotels and this was the best by a long long way. Happy to recommend it to anyone on any type of trip

Reviews.Title: “Definitely returning!”
Reviews.Author: SarahHonolulu_HI
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything we needed and more. The suite was perfect for our family and the service was exceptional. We loved our time in Vancouver and will definitely return, and we will without doubt be sure to stay at the L'Hermitage.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the family - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: creedAz
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights prior to a Disney cruise. The room was a small apartment and perfect for a family. There was a grocery store on the corner, so we were able to pick up anything we may have forgotten to pack. Plenty of restaurant options in the area. Would have loved to see a kids menu in the hotel restuarant. Excellent customer service from all staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bgc11
Reviews.Content: We found the rooms to be very nice. The nespresso coffee machine was a nice touch along with the fireplace. Also, we had a huge deck. Staff was very helpful and breakfast area was nice. Overall a modern and hip hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: dmg071
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I would recommend L'Hermitage to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: espanolosa
Reviews.Content: From the friendly front desk at check-in to the great Concierge, Raymond, this hotel was perfect for our 2 night stay.The only thing that wasn't perfect was that it was only FOR 2 nights! We were upgraded at check-in to a spacious suite with a state-of-the-art kitchen and nice private sitting area. The living/bedroom were a good size with a wonderful bed with luxurious bedding! It was hard to get out of bed in the morning to do our site seeing and shopping which is right outside the hotel door. Great location- great staff- great hotel. It's now our one and only place to stay when we come to the city for our little get-aways!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, service, spaciousness, and value”
Reviews.Author: kathy1966
Reviews.Content: I reserved two rooms for my family and parents at this wonderful boutique hotel. Our suite was huge with living area, fully furnished kitchen, two bathrooms, study , and outside balcony. Lots of natural light from windows, high quality toiletries, extremely clean, comfortable king size bed, washer and dryer, and excellent service from the front desk, to the concierge, and L Orangerie breakfast staff, and house keeping all were very friendly and helpful. Boutique bedroom also very spacious. Great breakfast buffett style served with organic scrambled eggs, smoked salmon, bacon, sausage, plentiful fruit (strawberries, blueberries, melons), granola, pastries, etc. Nice fitness center and heated outdoor lap pool as well. A huge thank you for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hippo was the cutest mascot ever”
Reviews.Author: JaeCon
Reviews.Content: This hotel just spills luxury and over the top. Robes and slippers in the rooms, marble tile in the bathrooms, comfy bed to sleep in, and espresso/tea machine in the room. This is definitely my "go to" when returning to Vancouver. Hippo is their mascot and he's a joy to visit with. The gym and pool are awesome too by the way. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC ONE BEDROOM SUITE”
Reviews.Author: RICHSHAR
Reviews.Content: After Toronto was not sure what to expect. The front counter were freindly and efficient, the Bulldog mascot was not present. We checked into our room and it was wonderful, just opposite the club lounge. Our room was well appointed with good size kitchen and lounge. The bathroom was a good size and our bedroom shared the balcony with our lounge. The morning breakfast in the club lounge was one of the best I have tried with organic food and individually cooked items. A small number of people so service and responsiveness was excellent. Would thoroughly recommend and will stay again. Just a short walk into the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: judylamb
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took my Mom to celebrate her 90th birthday. From the moment we arrived every detail was looked after. We had a very comfortable suite and the staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. I had my dog with us who was also treated so well. We were 'slightly" disappointed with the restaurant as it was a very busy night and my Mom is very hard of hearing so it was a bit difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't imagine a better place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MikeyBee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just 1 night after an Alaska cruise tour to rest before the trip home. Picked it because of tripadvisor rating and was NOT disappointed! Room was luxurious , super comfortable bed, great shower, and every staff member was as pleasant and went out of their way to please. Robes and slippers in the room and a very helpful concierge in the lobby. Restaurant was pricey but their are plenty of places to eat nearby. I thank the L'hermitage for a great ending to a great cruise!

Reviews.Title: “We won't stay anywhere else on our next visit!”
Reviews.Author: CdnLuv2Trvl
Reviews.Content: We recently returned to one of our many trips to Vancouver and opted to try a hotel that wasn't on Robson this time. Looking at a map and the hotel's website of photos and lists of amenities, we decided to give L'Hermitage a try. The hotel is perfectly situated, with an easy walk to everything: Gastown, Yaletown, Chinatown and shopping on Robson. The staff was always friendly, including the cleaning staff passing in the hallways. The room was spotless and well-appointed, too. It's worth having a drink in the 5th floor lounge with its gorgeous fireplace and soothing design tones. Also worth doing is going for an early morning swim in the heated saltwater pool on the 5th floor. Definitely one of the highlights from my trip! Be sure to look out for Hippo, the hotel's canine concierge. Looking forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: ScotsFriend
Reviews.Content: Selected by some friends in England as a place to stay both before and after an Alaskan Panhandle cruise, it met our requirements perfectly. The staff is friendly and very helpful and the location is central to the downtown area, waterfront, Gas Town and Chinatown. Rooms were quite spacious and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and beautiful rooms for a great value”
Reviews.Author: lit2kim
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on Valentine's Day weekend. We had a one room suite. The room was beautiful, the bathroom was huge, and I loved the toiletries. I only wish I could find where they sell full sized versions of the shower gel and shampoo. L'hermitage was pretty close to the Vancouver City Centre sky train station. I thought the location of the hotel was great. Close to Robson st around a lot of restaurants and a grocery store. The hotel even allows you to borrow an umbrella or one of their bikes to ride around the city. The concierge and hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. I would definitely come back to the L'hermitage to experience the luxurious rooms and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend it”
Reviews.Author: skardm
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in Vancouver. Good location in walking distance to a lot of places. Lovely room with good amenities. Quiet rooms and comfortable beds. Loved our balcony too. Friendly and helpful staff and concierge assistance. Loved using their complimentary bicycles to bike to Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: JennyK57
Reviews.Content: Service at L'Hermitage during our 2-day stay was outstanding in every respect: staff were friendly, extremely competent and well-trained. The room was stylish and had everything we needed, albeit the bedroom was a little small compared to the sitting room area.
