The hotel's location is ideal for a city-centre holiday - close to the waterfront, to central shopping and sightseeing. The hotel's amenities are also outstanding - well-equipped gym, small but beautifull lap pool and terrace. We did not have the opportunity to use the restaurant although this looked very beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A QUALITY EXPERIENCE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: brissiegirl2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights recently and found this hotel exceeded all our expectations.Great service, very professional, staff very courteous and went out of their way to be extremely helpful.The room was very spacious and modern with very,very comfortable king size bed. Location is also excellent.Would not hesitate to stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Justifiably #1”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_and_Wendy
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Vancouver so we really appreciated the guidance of TripAdvisor reviews. Thank you to everyone who has taken the time and effort to contribute. In our experience, L'Hermitage fully lived up to its excellent reputation. From the moment we arrived (very late at night and tired after a 12-hour flight from China) we were made to feel wonderfully welcome by the reception staff and porter. From then on we always got a cheerful greeting whenever we passed in and out. We soon discovered that Canadians generally are very helpful and friendly people, but the L'Hermitage staff were spot on. We booked a 1-bedroom Signature suite, primarily so we'd have a washing machine and dryer to catch up on our laundry after a week of travel. The apartment was just as good as described on the hotel's website - bright, spacious and fully equipped. Everything was beautifully clean on arrival and every day of our stay. The location is superb, adjacent to the main shopping area and just a short walk (10-15 minutes) to attractions like the sea ferry terminal (for the cross-harbour ferry to Grouse Mountain) and Yaletown (for the little ferry to Granville Island). Stanley Park is a bit further, 20-30 minutes walk, but well worth it. We had planned to use the hotel's complimentary bicycles but the weather wasn't kind enough during our stay. There are plenty of restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel. Le Crocodile was our favourite, again with thanks to TripAdvisor reviewers. Also there is a mid-size supermarket and a bottle shop just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: karench14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were visiting Vancover for just 2 days so we booked 1 night at L'Hermitage Hotel. We were so pleased with our choice! The front desk staff was very accommodating and nice from the minute we walked in the door. There was a small miscommunication about whether our bags were being brought to our room but they were quick to fix that thanks to the BEST concierge - Raymond (I am terrible with names so I have his name wrong - I am so sorry). I asked him for help picking a place for lunch and dinner since it was my husband's birthday and when we showed up to both places, there were little extras (appetizers at both and a wonderful dessert at dinner) thanks to him!!! It made us feel very special. We found the staff that we encountered in the halls always had a smile and a kind greeting as well. It was such a pleasant atmosphere. We called down to the desk to ask if we could reserve the bikes for the next morning and it was very easy. We took them at 7:30am and went for a 2 hour ride around Stanley Park (a must see when in Vancouver). It was perfect! What a nice touch to have the bikes available for no charge for 4 hours if you need them that long. The beds and pillows were comfortable, the bathroom spacious with a tub and separate shower, and a great balcony (we overlooked the pool and spa). I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Oh and the resident dog is a fixture at the hotel. He is adorable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, value & great concierges”
Reviews.Author: Jim6851
Reviews.Content: Although upgraded the kitchen, laundry, and space of the den & separate bathroom features helped us recover from the long flight from Australia. The room was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was of a very high standard. Appreciated the fruit, muesli, freshly cooked egg, croissants and wholemeal toast and espresso. The Concierges helped with informed unbiased advice & arrangements on a foodie restaurant, travel to Seattle (confusing ferry, rail & bus options) and more.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find on Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Littlebitkitty
Reviews.Content: We loved L'Hermitage!! We stayed here for 3 days before a cruise to Alaska. Perfect location within walking distance of everything in Vancouver. Great service and accommodations. A very small boutique hotel that has rooms on the 5th, 6th and 7th floors of a tall residence building. You share the pool with the residents but this is not an issue at all. Free wireless, bathrobes and even comfortable disposable slippers. And they have free bikes you can borrow for 4 hours at a time. The only complaint I have is that the breakfast is way too pricey ($17.50) for a very small buffet. Everything else was just perfect.If I return to the lovely city of Vancouver, I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Rated #1 for the right reasons”
Reviews.Author: rcafta
Reviews.Content: This was our 1st trip to Vancouver and without a doubt we will chose to stay at L;Hermitage when we return. The entire experience from arrival to departure was 1st class and excellent. The location is ideal if you want to access a variety of experiences. The staff is excellent in making your stay exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay, Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: braunwynn
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better stay in Vancouver. Our hotel was fantastic, in a great, walkable area with an incredible staff. Polite, efficient, warm....every positive thing that a guest could ask for was available at this hotel. We loved it! By the way, we stayed in a corner, 1 bedroom suite and our room was wonderfully spacious.... We also enjoyed the great coffee machines and the toiletries were divine!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: SLCollins78
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our 1year old daughter & loved the hotel! Given that our daughter crawls around I always check under every item in a room for when she explores & the hotel was immaculate. Clean + which is very important for a floor dwelling little one! Breakfast was delicious & the amenities throughout were perfect. The staff were polite, engaging & helpful. The pool & garden are a paradise. Our room was beautifully appointed & had lots of space. I could not recommend the hotel more. We will be back without a doubt. A wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place!”
Reviews.Author: Olivacourt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to the L'Hermitage for our 20th Anniversary. The reviews were very favorable so we chose this location. We were not disappointed. The staff is friendly, helpful, solicitous. Rooms were quiet (even during the Stanley Cup Finals!). The exercise room had all I needed as a strength/lifting enthusiast but also has endurance equipment. The location was convenient enough to walk everywhere we wanted to go in town-no taxis necessary...We will definitely return next time we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here, it's excellent!”
Reviews.Author: The3ofUsCheshire_UK_
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage is one of if not the best hotel I've stayed in. Staff are incredibly friendly, nothing is a problem. We stayed in a signature suite which is spacious and well appointed, perfect as a couple travelling with one parent and a teenager.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel and totally recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: Madaboutleo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Vancouver over the Easter weekend and came back for another night after driving to the Rockies Mountains for a week. We had a great room on the first occasion. It was clean, spacious and tastefully decorated. The coffee machine makes a nice cup of coffee not like the usual awful filtered coffee you get at the other hotels. The staff was helpful and courteous. The location of the hotel is great as we can walk to Chinatown and along the waterfront to Stanley Park. We walked back from Stanley Park through Robson Street back to the hotel. Shopping were great at Robson Street. There is a supermarket around the corner and some takeaway shops nearby as well. On the second time when we returned to the hotel after our Rockies Mountain tour, they were kind enough to give us a free upgrade to a one bedroom suite. It was really great to have a kitchen to use for cooking our breakfast. There is also a washing machine and dryer in the suite which we were glad to use before our next leg of our trip. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay in Vancouver and L'Hermitage made it even more so.

Reviews.Title: “"Ohhh this is a nice start to our holiday!" It was indeed.”
Reviews.Author: daglesj
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We arrived tired and grubby from a 9 hour flight from the UK to be welcomed to this lovely hotel. We met Hippo the hotel dog (what a cutie!) and found our room was spacious and just the level of luxury you want when you arrive. Comfortable, free wi-fi, good coffee maker and (much to my other halfs delight) free slippers. She also enjoyed the pool though found the 8 or so water fountain jets along the side a bit off-putting if trying to put in a serious lap swim. They look nice but dont actually help swimmers. Breakfast was really good. Due to being 8 hours ahead body clock wise we went early and the scrambled eggs are delicious. Breakfast staff very attentive (and I thought very cute but dont tell my other half) and efficient. It was never a mad scramble to get seated, very very relaxed as it should be. Though they do need better toasters but we found that across Canada toasters just dont cut it there. Maybe its the 110v power or something but properly toasted bread takes like 5 minutes or more, but I digress. We were not in a hurry. We would definately stay there again. It made a great start to our three week holiday. We did have only one grumble, the aircon in our room sounded like a cement mixer when switched on and that may not have been the only instance in the hotel. However, as it was Vancouver in early May (you had to be there) it wasnt really a problem. We just switched it off and opened the window.

Reviews.Title: “Our Absolute Favorite in Vancouver - Second Time Back!”
Reviews.Author: mssking
Reviews.Content: This was our second time in this wonderfully located, dog friendly, nicely appointed boutique hotel. The service was friendly and sincere. The location is outstanding (Richards and Robson). Our Suite was clean and comfortable. The Nespresso coffee in the room was a nice amenity. We had a full kitchen complete with good ole' Sub Zero. The space planning of the suite is spot on. And, the walk out veranda was a bonus for me. Oh yeah, forgot to mention the wireless web (included without nickle and diming). The pool area has a working, hot Jacuzzi (imagine that). I usually don't write these reviews unless I am impressed; guess what?!? Anyway, we'll be back. This quality doesn't come cheaply, but you get what you pay for. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Boutique hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: keitharrowsmith
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that occupies three floors of a modern apartment block. Rooms are a good size, and were well kept and equipped, with free wifi. No noise from the internal corridors, but we could hear people moving about above us. The double glazing doesnt keep out all of the street noise (esp on days when the local ice hockey team is playing!) All of the staff were excellent. The restaurant on the ground floor isnt part of the hotel, but serves a good evening meal (italian) with great service, even if the double height room itself is a bit noisy. The hotel serves breakfast in a nice room on the fifth floor - but it has a limited choice for a fairly high fixed fee. Better food is available at local cafe's.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Day Made Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Steph94356
Reviews.Content: My friend just had her wedding at this gorgeous hotel. It was amazing! We had two rooms, one with a kitchen and one without. I highly recommend the suite with the kitchen. We also had a dog with us and they had a complimentary gift basket for him! Definitely the one thing that made with stay enjoyable was the staff. They are the nicest people in the world that would do ANYTHING for you. Even a starbucks run... Next time we are looking for a hotel room, this will be the first place we go!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that will impress”
Reviews.Author: Margaret A
Reviews.Content: The service at L'Hermitage is extremely customer-focused from the moment you arrive. You are welcomed with a smile and true interest in ensuring your stay is 100% to your satisfaction. The rooms are immaculate and roomy - even the smaller rooms are decked out with comfortable beds and lounging areas. The only inevitability is the rumble of trucks at night, but other than that, it's a restful stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is truly a gem!”
Reviews.Author: skeptic2
Reviews.Content: As is my nature, I was skeptical. How can one hotel be so great? Believe it or not it is better than you can ever imagine. I recommend the suite with the kitchen. I (I don't know if all of the rooms are like this but having the kitchen is unbeatable if you like to have light breakfast as soon as you wake up. It is also great for take out left overs. The hotel of course has great room service. I did not have a chance to try the restaurant, but friends of mine said it was wonderful. I also recommend the pool view.

Reviews.Title: “Very little to complain about”
Reviews.Author: MSB1111
Reviews.Content: Very well run hotel - much better than "big" ones. Room had everything you could ask for except one thing - enough room on the bathroom counter for all your toiletries. Had to use the dresser in the bedroom for most of them. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel. Nice location and Hotel Staff very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: agnursmith
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect option for anyone who is going to Vancouver. Very clean rooms, big bathrooms, nice TV, good AC. The Hotel is very well located. I am 100% satisfied with the choice that I made. The hotel staff is very friendly, especially Ted! Also Wifi free...

Reviews.Title: “Intimate and personal”
Reviews.Author: LAXbuzz
Reviews.Content: The service is so friendly. I felt like I was an old friend returning to my own home. We arrived early and we waited in the lounge area which is full of light. Free tea was offered. Then when my room was ready I couldn't believe how gorgeous it was. We had the solarium room. We ordered wine and cheese prior to arrival and it was waiting in our room. This place is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a great experience that's centrally located to mass transit and downtown walking?”
Reviews.Author: acationFun
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a wonderful staff, beautiful rooms and great dining. We took the Skytrain from the Vancouver Airport to the Vancouver City Centre station. From there, we took a short walk to the hotel. The hotel staff provided great directions for our downtown walking adventures and the local tours. This is a beautiful city with friendly people, museums, conservatories, parks and great views. We’ll definitely be back to Vancouver and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel and staff I have ever encountered in thousands of stays around the world.”
Reviews.Author: Smittyman10
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was fantastic and the staff were exceptional! Friendly and helpful staff combined with an amazing Hotel made for the best Hotel Stay I have ever had. I will be back throughout the summer and for many years to come!! BDS

Reviews.Title: “Impressed by the courtesy of the staff and the quality of the room.”
Reviews.Author: joectk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem. We were very impressed with the level of service offered and the understated elegance of the room we stayed in.. All the members of the hotel staff were courteous and made us feel welcomed. We would definitely go back and feel that it is a far more superior hotel than the Westin Grande which is next door and where we stayed last year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travler54
Reviews.Content: We loved this boutique hotel. Great location, not far from anything downtown. The staff was wonderful. Everyone was polite and helpful. Lovely hotel with one of the best bathrooms we've ever had in a hotel. We loved being on the sixth floor near the business center and one floor up (accessible by stairs) from the restaurant and gym.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kandjvdberg
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel! Great staff, beautiful room! (especially the bathroom) Our room didn't have a view but had a cute little porch area/patio set. Nice pool and hot tub as well. We would LOVE to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing level of service, 1st time in Vancouver was perfect”
Reviews.Author: magaussie
Reviews.Content: We wanted to ensure we didn't waited too long before giving this place full stars as it really deserved it. The service is amazing, attentive and genuine. The Manager and his team are really doing an awesome job and should be congratulated for it. We stayed in a one bedroom suite was perfect for our little family and a cot was waiting for our little one. The kitchen was really well organised but we also tried the delicious room service. We had breakfast in the beautiful area 5th floor and all was delicious, quiet and perfect. They have huge wardrobe and comfy beds. The location is good with nearby supermarket and walking distances from Robston and Gastown. We highly recommend Granville Market and Sandbar Yum! Don't hesitate more book now

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and romantic”
Reviews.Author: Buttons_n_Beans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night. Everything about our stay was perfect. The staff were really great about making sure we got a room with a fireplace even though they were booked solid and they had left a bottle of wine in the room for us in congratulations. The room was very quiet. Even though there was a hockey game happening in town we never heard any street noise or noise from the hallways or other rooms. We tried their room service for both dinner and breakfast and everything was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anon2011-05
Reviews.Content: GREAT HOTEL!! Great staff - so helpful and obliging. Wonderful boutique room - very spacious. Excellent location - a stones throw from Robson Street Very handy store on the corner - Market Place Last but not least, Hippo - so sweet!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: jeanstake
Reviews.Content: Great well-kept boutique hotel near Robson on Richards. We were in a one bedroom suite, like a small apartment.. Not cheap, but you get what you pay for here. Small, but well equipped exercise room, and steam rooms, a heated salt water lap style pool and jacuzzi on terrace. I didn't use the pool, but used the gym daily for 4 days. We were on 7th floor overlooking Robson, yet it was actually very quiet inside , and the gym and pool are on the 5th floor. There is an excellent Italian restaurant (Al Centro) adjoining hotel and lots of ethnic and other more casual (and cheaper) restaurants within easy walking on Robson which is a main shopping artery with Pacific Center within 2 blocks. There is a well stocked small market on the corner of the block. The hotel staff was very accomodating and courteous. (The real kind of friendliness) The room was very clean with a fully equiped stainless kitchen with Sub Zero refrigerator and DW, a washer/dryer combo, and the bath had a tub and separate large shower with lots of towels stashed away. Sat. TV in living room and bedroom and a great comfortable bed. The lighting was excellent throughout. Also free internet. The security here requires a card for the elevator, rooms and most facilities. A big plus to us was the Skytrain (Canada line Town Center Station about 2 blocks away. It goes to YVR in about 20 minutes with various stops along the way. (About $3.50 CA, or less if you are over 65) Scotia bank is around the corner also if you want to draw on a debit card with Bank of America for free. Hotel within easy walking of Gastown, Chinatown, Waterfront. (seaplanes), Yaletown restaurants and pubs. A walk to the south for approx. 6 blocks will take you to the small ferries toodling around False Creek and stopping at Granville Island (Farm Market, restaurants and shops). Walking to Stanley Park is more of a stretch however, but doable, yet you may be too pooped to do the park then. A great place to hole up and never leave, except that Vancouver is fun to walk around or visit anytime, rain or shine, and for us it was a bit rainy.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectation”
Reviews.Author: sherryrsf
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just returned yesterday fromL'Hermitage Hotel in Vancouver. We chose it from the recommendation on tripadvisor and did expect it to be very good from the comments and photos. It actually was even better. The room and bath were spacious and immaculate. The bed was pllush and incredibly comfortable. The service was instantaneous and wonderfully friendly as well as helpful. I would stay there again and again and will recommend it highly to friends and family travelling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “High Praise”
Reviews.Author: KathrynCBCB
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at L'Hermitage and cannot praise the welcome, friendliness and helpfulness of the front of house staff enough. Our room was spacious and clean and very comfortable and although we didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, we ate at Al Centro, the adjoining restaurant and the food was excellent. Use of the internet in the Library was very welcome too. It is the excellent assistance of the staff which remains in our mind however. Nothing was too much trouble, even to the extent of assisting our daughter (who was not a guest at the hotel). First class customer service which made for an excellent stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “If you are accustomed to top quality designer/boutique hotels, then this is your hotel!our”
Reviews.Author: room570
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend two to three weeks out of most months travelling for business and pleasure, mostly in Europe and truly understand what to look for in a hotel. We like the privacy and personal attention of smaller hotels, but do not want to forfeit luxury, service or comfort. L'Hermitage was exactly what I had hoped it would be. The moment we pulled up in front of the hotel and handed our keys over to the valet service, one look at the beautiful, tasteful entrance to the hotel, I knew I had found a jewel. We booked 8 nights here and during our entire stay, we could find no fault with the rooms, staff, service or location. There was no request that the staff did not kindly, gladly and efficiently fulfill and often gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants and shopping. The tastefully decorated room had every comfort to suit are needs and we loved the attention to detail. The location is within walking distance of fabulous restaurants, theatres, shopping and the waterfront. We will certainly be back again and can warmly recommend this hotel to you. Room 570

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: Mervlehr
Reviews.Content: We were down for Easter weekend had a great time loved our room. Staff were awsome hipo the lobby dog was friendly. Made our visit to Vancouver rememberable. Merv

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Downtown Gem”
Reviews.Author: asonenbe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully put together with style and comfort (great bed!) and perfect location for shopping a walk to the waterfront. The staff is accommodating and lovely and help out with all things "traveling in Vancouver". Will always go return!

Reviews.Title: “Would go back for sure”
Reviews.Author: stewsimon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the 2011 Marathon, close to centre, close to start line. Nice big room with full kitchen, well finished. You get more for your money at this hotel than some of the big names. Just a couple of blocks walk from the Granville station sky train too, so quick and easy airport access

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canis_Family
Reviews.Content: We were there with our 18 month old daughter, and loved it. We had a room with kitchen, that overlooked the hotel pool. The pool is heated enough that one can go swimming there even in the Spring, and the hot top "under the stars and highrises" was increadable! The service was great, and we were treated really well by everyone. The parking is very expensive. This hotel is not recommended for those that are sensitive to noise, as there is a constant noise from an air vent outside, that is so loud that you can hear it through the closed windows. On the other hand, it is in the middle of Vancouver, 1 block from Robson St., so it is normal to have noise.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LonelyBlade
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Canada saw us spending the first 6 nights here. Without knowing anything about the city apart from my own initial investigations before travelling, the hotel was absolutely fine with very pleasant staff in the foyer at all times. Having said that we are active holiday makers and tend to be out and about discovering places and sights rather than sitting in our room. Coming from England the room was enormous compared to our own country and we had no problems with the size of the bathroom with separate shower and toilet. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to other people - especially with the market at the end of the street for all our needs!

Reviews.Title: “All that you want in a hotel and more”
Reviews.Author: fieryowl
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the majority of the other reviewers in giving it 5 stars. This is a hotel that exceeded my expectations in quality, service, and location especially compared to other similarly priced hotels. The thing that stood out most is the service - every hotel staff was courteous, friendly, and professional, similar to the type of service you would expect from a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons but without paying their prices. The hotel is centrally located, and within walking distance to all the shops and restaurants on Robson. Have to try Japadog a half block away if you go! We were there for the BMO Vancouver half marathon, and it was in walking distance to the expo and starting line, right next to Rogers Arena (home of the Canucks). The rooms are very clean, warm, and elegant, beds comfortable. The hotel pool located on the 5th floor is small, but big enough to get a swim in. The attached restaurant next door, Q4 al Centro, was okay. I thought it was a bit overpriced for pasta. I probably wouldn't go back there - decent but nothing special for what you pay. You'd be better off trying any of the places on Robson street - one recommendation is Guu (Japanese Tepanyaki). Lastly, we loved seeing Hippo, the hotel's French bulldog. Made us smile everytime we saw him in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Don't see how this place ranks #1 in Vancouver on TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: Dog513
Reviews.Content: Booked for a few days after leaving ski vacation in Whistler to hang out in Vancouver . . . (which is the greatest city). Booked L'Hermitage after seeing the ranking on tripadvisor, so my expectations were high. I should have known that I was in trouble when the friends we were going to hang out with asked where we were staying and we got a nonplussed reaction, which is different from when I have been staying at other places which proved to be really nice. Booked 2 Bedroom Suite. The rooms and bathrooms are beyond tiny, and though "re-done," aside from the very nice Kitchen area, it is anything but first class. The hotel is close to the worst part of downtown, parking (even with the valet which is sometimes nowhere to be found) is difficult, at best . . . though the staff is always nice and tries to be helpful. If you can get over all of that . . . you are never really far from anything in Vancouver, and you are still within walking distance to many good things... but I have stayed in Vancouver several times, and I would easily preferred to spend more $ for a place which lived up to the higher ratings here.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good but needs to improve on service”
Reviews.Author: Michloh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and was blown away when we first arrived. The room had a fireplace and music playing when we opened the door. Very good for a first impression. We settled in and found things amiss. The tv was not working and the water kettle was spoilt. I called the front desk and the guy who came up to help did nothing for us. My husband had to coach him thru the tv manual instead. He also said he will replace the kettle and was gone for more than 15 min. We told the front desk to replace it tomorrow. The next day they replaced it - with one that had a rusty bottom. On closer inspection this hotel was blacking in ways that other hotels do wellThere was a blood stain on our bathroom floor that remained for 3 nights. When we asked the lady at the front desk ( maryann) abt places to dine in Victoria she said that since it's a ferry ride away she doesn't know what to recommend. I was baffled. Isn't that what a concierge is supposed o do!? And she passed me a brochure and told me to read it myself. She recommended 2 restaurants and both left us puzzled. The food was mediocre and nothing to shout abt. They are Kirin in downtown and the Dining room in Butchart Gardens. I felt that I was wasting her time as I asked her and she appeared arrogant and busy. I would like to say thanks to Kimberly and Jason as they are sincere and helpful at the front desk. The ladies at the lounge were also very personable. All in all, looks gd but if you stay long like us faults appear. The staff seem to only want to give superficial advice and not recommend restaurants or places that are really enjoyable. I would still recommend this hotel for the location. We walked everywhere and good groceries were nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, convenient location, spa-like décor and comfort”
Reviews.Author: LRR_11
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for a three-night stay prior to a family wedding elsewhere in the province, using the reviews on Tripadvisor to help make our decision. It's a lovely hotel, warm and welcoming with professional and helpful staff. We arrived before check-in time, were greeted immediately and completed check-in, and were invited to L'ORANGERIE DINING ROOM & LOUNGE while we waited. Had just enough time for coffee and a beautifully prepared snack before being advised personally that our room was ready, and so it was, with our luggage already inside. Calming décor, fabulous bathroom, attentive and thoughtful staff, great location, and many amenities. As tourists, we appreciated the personalized, helpful advice from staff, and "Hippo" the dog was an added friendly attraction! I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “AAA customer service”
Reviews.Author: Marcelo_Pagodinho
Reviews.Content: We went to Canada to celebrate our 7th anniversary and, after staying in Whistler we headed to Vancouver for a chill out time. The choice of hotel could not be better - excellent location (really 5 mins walking for everything), very nice rooms and a staff really interested in making your stay memorable. The concierge and the rental bikes also need to be highlighted. Definetely when we're returning to Vancouver (and we will) I don't have to waste more time looking for accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetigger2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The service was excellent and the location great.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in vancouver”
Reviews.Author: tgcsw
Reviews.Content: I live in San Diego. I travel to Vancouver at least four times a year. I haven't stayed in every hotel in Vancouver, but I've stayed in a good deal of the best ones (I try a new one every time I travel). That's over. After staying in L'Hermitage --- this will be my hotel of choice for all my future trips. Stay there. You'll see why.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 611lulu
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay at L'Hermitage, and it was flawless. The staff were incredibly helpful with setting up tours, delicious breakfasts, and a beautifully appointed suite with dreamy bed. They even indulged us by sending extra chocolates with our turn-down service. :) Incredibly centrally located, there was a grocery store on the corner and we were able to make good use of the well equipped kitchen. Would be thrilled to stay there again anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great service at the L'Hermitage.”
Reviews.Author: darthestar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on the advice of friends. It did not disappoint. Very nice rooms - large, super comfy bed, great bathroom. The service deserves a speical mention. Everyone we encountered was very accomodating and gracious.

Reviews.Title: “The Sweet Suite”
Reviews.Author: jlberger
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazing - friendly, helpful, cheerful. We were upgraded to a deluxe suite with a kitchen and I would highly recommend reserving this suite. My husband is a chef and it was fun for us to go to the Granville market to purchase fresh local items that he then used to create a wonderful in-room dinner later that night. The location of the hotel is superb. We parked the car when we arrived and didn't use it until our departure. Staying at the L-Hermitage was the foundation of a wonderful vacation for us. This is a tiny quibble, but the closet in the bedroom is impossible. It is long and narrow with a motion-activated light at one end. Unfortunately, the motion activator doesn't work if you are needing something on the far side of the closet or if clothes get pushed in front of the activation unit. It would have made a great video to see me repeatedly contorting my body and waving my arms around a dark closet to get the light to turn on so I could access clothes or the in-room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its great reputation”
Reviews.Author: DoctorGusSydney
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here. Staff, especially the manager, went out of their way to help me after i made an error on my booking and i am extremely grateful. Everyone was very friendly, the breakfast was delicious and outdoor hot tub a nice touch. Kudos for the free bikes and wifi too. Very close to the city and within 10min walk from some great places to eat like the Pourhouse and Twisted Fork. Thanks guys, keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round top end hotel”
Reviews.Author: NewRecruits
Reviews.Content: Great pool,jacuzzi and leisure suite. Good central location. Room airconditioning noisy and needed to be turned off for a decent nights sleep. Like the napresso machines - novel touch!

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond!!”
Reviews.Author: kristabelle57
Reviews.Content: Above and beyond!!! Squeaky clean, ultra comfortable ... at L'Hermitage they have thought of everything ... even a new box of Tide everyday!! All of the staff were incredibly helpful and super friendly, offering maps, directions, ideas about what to see and where to go. We arrived on a weekend and 'Hippo' had the weekend off. As we were checking out on the Monday, my grandchild really wanted to see 'Hippo' so the clerk called the office and 'Hippo' appeared in the lobby which delighted her. We really enjoyed our weekend in Vancouver and will surely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Karen154913
Reviews.Content: The amenities, breakfast buffet and service at this hotel are excellent. Concierge helped us reserve a table at a great restaurant nearby (Goldfish) and we used the bikes to see Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for our first trip to Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: ccbbSeattle
Reviews.Content: I made our reservations based on Trip Advisor reviews, and I'm glad that I did! The hotel is centrally located in the downtown area of the city -- a ten minute walk from Yaletown and Gastown and close to shopping on Robson St. From the moment I made the reservation until our departure, the service was excellent. I requested a quiet room and we were given a room on the top floor of the hotel facing the pool, which was perfect. We reserved a suite in order to have extra room and a kitchen. While the bedroom was a bit small, the living room and kitchen area was very comfortable and it was nice having free wireless service. In addition, the kitchen was the best hotel kitchen I have ever seen -- fully equiped with modern appliances and accessories (they even had a toaster, blender, and electric tea kettle) and it had a gas stove!! There is a supermarket right around the corner from the hotel which is very convenient. Every member of the staff who we interacted with was friendly, helpful, and gracious. When I needed something from Housekeeping, they came right away. The Concierge gave us a number of restaurant recommendations. Kimberly helped us plan a wonderful outing to Granville Island and happily answered all of my questions, offering lots of great advice. We had breakfast one morning at the hotel and really enjoyed the variety, service, and ambience. I was impressed that they served organic eggs! I recommend the Kingston Taphouse across the street from the hotel as well as Nuba, a Lebanese restaurant in Gastown. We also took the Aquabus from Davie St. to Granville Island, which really added to the experience. Overall, L'Hermitage is a great hotel to explore the city, and I plan to stay there again next time I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Elegance - Don't Hesitate to Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Humres32
Reviews.Content: I'm picky. I rearch everything via Tripadvisor, Fodor's, Frommer's, etc. This place was fantastic and I'd stay here again. Modern, spacious and well maintained. We upgraded our room to what constitutes a small 1 bedroom apartment. The room was very nice. The bed and pillows were comfortable; the bathroom is segmented so the toilet is separate from the shower & sink. Nice touch with having bathrobes and slippers. We were lucky to get a corner room with a decent view. Parking will run $25/night plus tax. Tim Hortons and Starbucks are right around the corner. We opted to go there for breakfast versus paying the $17.50/person breakfast at the hotel. We did eat at the Italian restaurant and it was very good. If you are wanting to stay right in the main hub of activity, then you need to know the main activity (shopping on Robson Street and the clubs/bars/movies on Granville) are several blocks away. Not a bad walk, but thought I'd mention it. If you're looking for suggestions on what to do, we drove to Stanley Park and did some walking along the river. We then up to Grouse Mountain. It was a nice day. We only had a short visit in Vancouver, unfortunately. Stay at L'Hermitage. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “C'était merveilleux; It was marvelous.”
Reviews.Author: MarylandKalicat
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the hotel. I chose to stay here as opposed to the Fairmont Vancouver (the conference hotel). From the moment i walked in where they welcomed me by name, even before i checked in to the note on my night stand addressed to me welcoming me; to the free internet; business center; the muted sense of luxury and pampering; it was superb. They upgraded me to a boutique room with a fire and balcony; and the rates were so reasonable. Remarkable service. And a great restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful in all ways!”
Reviews.Author: Brick23
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful inside and out. In the middle of the night a fire alarm went off (turned out it was set off by the restaurant attached and turned out to be a false alarm) and we all evacuated for 30 minutes. This was a hassle but not the managements fault and they hurried to make it right! In the morning we were given a free breakfast and $100 off our room rate. For something that wasn't even their fault! They were very professional and very kind throughout our stay. Housekeeping was wonderful and all the staff extremely helpful. We will go back as soon as we can! Walking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lepotage
Reviews.Content: My second time at L'Hermitage and it's still #1 in my opinion for the best hotel in Vancouver. The rooms are super clean, comfortable with just the right amount of luxurious touches. Things I I love about this place: the compact but very functional kitchen with high-end appliances; the charming common outdoor space with the heated saltwater lap pool and the hot-tub. Location also great, next to the entertainment district (but far enough away from the noise) and next door to grocery store, and loads of restaurants, shops. Normally I don't find the service at hotels anything to comment on but this place is noticeably different. Everyone, including the porters are very friendly and all seem to be socially gifted. They're happy to talk to you, answer your questions, joke with you and help you with whatever you may need. Lots of nice touches at this hotel - (e.g. they delivered a complimentary bottle of chilled bottle wine to our room for my husband's birthday). Can't say enough good things about L'Hermitage. I hope it never changes, they've got the right formula.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: GirlOnTheGo77
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage made our first visit to Vancouver a wonderful experience! The staff was incredible and helpful, the location was perfect, and everything about the room was wonderful. One of the highlights of our trip was biking around Stanley Park on the hotel's bicycles. We have relatives in Vancouver who have invited us to stay with them during our next visit, but our experience at L'Hermitage was so fabulous that we will definitely plan to stay there for at least part of our visit. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely peaceful place to stay in the middle of the city.”
Reviews.Author: AlitNorthamptonUK
Reviews.Content: Very beautifully kept hotel, immaculate in fact. We had booked months before our stay and made a request for a light and high room at the front of the hotel but were given a very dark small room at the back. We felt very hemmed in and asked to be moved, but were told that there were no more rooms available. However, after persisting, we were soon upgraded to a much lighter room. This was dealt with professionally and with good grace. The breakfast is not very comprehensive but at only $17 is reasonable value. All the staff and friendly, helpful and smiling. Concierge excellent. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “an incredibly comfortable, friendly and hospitable, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: RFPierce
Reviews.Content: The staff are fantastic; courteous, informed, friendly and helpful. The hotel is immaculately clean and within walking distance of everything in Yaletown and Gastown. The amenities are great and the L'Orangerie is a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique centrally located great beds”
Reviews.Author: basmoon
Reviews.Content: In room fire place, comfortable beds and great room service.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: farmgirl91
Reviews.Content: Perfect room, perfect bed, perfect location, L'Hermitage has it all!

Reviews.Title: “High accolades and focused attention to detail in all categories, from a premadonna business traveler.”
Reviews.Author: vsz
Reviews.Content: Attention to detail...a standard for success in any business model, is truly understood at L'Hermitage. The design of this hotel is crisp, but warm...no fussy, non-essential aesthetics. The entire staff (including the housekeeping gang) are very well informed, engaging and willing to assist in any way. This goes for the General Manager as well, who I have met a few times during my business travels to Vancouver. As a monthly traveler, I have stayed in (and have the option of staying in) the larger chain operated 4-5 star hotels in this city. I choose to stay at L'Hermitage for their professionalism, warmth and engaging spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay at this Vancouver hotel”
Reviews.Author: HungryTraveler84
Reviews.Content: This place just gets better. We stayed here around the time of its opening a few years back and it was really nice but service was a bit hit or miss it seemed. This time though the service was great the whole time through. The rooms are very nice if you get the signature suites since you get a kitchen and washer/dryer. The only downside is you have to vallet your car if you are driving in and its $25 a night which isnt that bad but its just you should plan for this ahead of time since its not included in your rate when you purchase the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location - great pool!”
Reviews.Author: Shortyshortcake
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon in Vancouver and spent 3 nights at L'Hermitage in Vancouver. Location is great - really central to all the sights but not too noisy, the staff are welcoming and helpful. Rooms are good value for size and location. Our very favourite bit was the lovely outdoor pool which was often empty and meant that you could swim in the middle of the city, surrounded by sky scrapers. It was amazing. Would def return if we go back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “BEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER.”
Reviews.Author: cavaliers88
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I had to travel to Vancouver for a family emergency, but the impeccable staff at L'Hermitage made this trying time for my wife and I much easier. The general manager, Jean-Michel, went above and beyond what was expected of him. On top of my family emergency, I also got sick, but have no fear, the staff at L'Hermitage is here! They personally went out and brought me baked potatoes to ease my pains. I have never experienced customer service like this from a hotel, or any other establishment for that matter. Everyone from the bell hops to the general manager catered to my every need with smiles on their faces. But don't think this hotel is a hole in the wall with incredible customer service; the rooms were spotless and I have HIGH standards when it comes to cleanliness. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, big and becoming”
Reviews.Author: PaBlo2k
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The one bedroom suite that we had was enormous and fantastic value for money. I will stay here again when I return to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: clarkio
Reviews.Content: On the Trip advisor no1 hotel in Vancouver recommendation we stayed for two nights on March 8&9 and we were not disappointed. Having come down from skiing in Whistler and stayed the Fairmont Chateau we wanted to continue with the same standard of accommodation and we were not disappointed. This hotel is only 2 years old and the attention to detail is fantastic. The Hotel and rooms are modern without being too sparse and the bathroom is the best I have had in a long time with separate shower enclosure and bath and tiled from floor to ceiling in modern travertine or marble, with German fittings.

Reviews.Title: “Staff attitude......”
Reviews.Author: msdgmagee
Reviews.Content: Service was substandard because we booked online. It was insulting to be treated as second class because we did not book directly thru hotel site. My husband has stayed several nights prior to this visit and we have spent money at this hotel. This trip was beyond disappointing. I left after 1 night and the front desk still claimed our car was parked in their underground. This is not the luxury boutique hotel they are claiming to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ladyola
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel where they are very interested in making your stay the best it can be. From walking around the desk to serve you (instead of hiding behind it), to the beautiful library, nicely appointed rooms, quiet hallways and chocolate at turndown, this hotel is a winner. Hippo the hotel dog is awesome too!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JoFinch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a lovely surprise. My husband summed it up perfectly when he said "it's just what you want from a hotel - a room so nice you're torn between going out exploring or staying in to enjoy it!". Hippo is cool.

Reviews.Title: “Simply a wonderful place to stay..”
Reviews.Author: TobyinSydney2050
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hermitage twice during our trip to Canada. Once for three nights before we headed to Whistler to get married and for one night when we were leaving to go home. The staff at this hotel know the true meaning of customer service. Everyone, from the housekeepers, to the maintenance staff, to the doorman, to the front desk was friendly and helpful (and smiling). We returned a month after our initial stay and were greeted by congratulations on our marriage, a lovely note from the manager and a bottle of decent wine complimentary in the room. It is attention to detail that make a hotel successful and its guests feel special and this hotel is outstanding at making people feel welcome. The rooms are modern, well designed and comfortable. Location is perfect , close to the Canada Line for easy and fast access to the airport. This hotel deserves to be ranked at the absolute top of hotels anywhere in the world because it does the little things well and truly its staff are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff, service and location.”
Reviews.Author: satkins
Reviews.Content: Centrally located in the heart of the city with exceptional ammenities. Our room was well appointed and spotless. All staff....the doorman, the front desk staff, food service staff, housekeeping staff, and hotel management..were extremely friendly, professional and accommodating. Everyone went out of their way to ensure we had an exceptional stay. I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is "Just Great"”
Reviews.Author: cpearson001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two days in February. The stay was great, from the service to the room. Perfect sized room, very clean, good location for us. The real treat for us was the excellent service we received from the whole staff. We will be staying here again anytime we need a hotel in the Vancouver area. Thanks again L'Hermitage.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FOODIE1Dublin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at L'Hermitage for one night before our ski trip to Whistler and for four nights on our return to Vancouver before returning to Ireland. We found the hotel and staff excellent and highly recommend it. The adjoining restaurant Q4 al Centro is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: TWILLIA17
Reviews.Content: Very clean and the staff couldn't do enough for us. Very friendly and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunbunnie69
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel,perfect location,Hippo the canine concierge is pretty cute!!We were upgraded to a very nice suite for our one year wedding anniversary....we will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable and classy hotel in Vancouver, luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: julio313
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms and swimming pool, wonderful staff and a friendly dog called Hippo make this one of the few options in Vancouver for the traveler who demands 1st class service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: yam42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one evening only on our way back from Whistler to NY. I had read some great reviews on this site so gave it a shot since the price was really reasonable, but I had no idea what I would get. The hotel was absolutely amazing. We arrived early even though our check in was supposed to be at 4pm. We were told that they could have a room ready in 30 minutes, and offered their beautiful lounge (with complimentary tea and coffee) to wait in. We waited there for probably only 15 minutes when the woman at the front desk personally appeared and gave us our room keys. She told us our bags would follow us up. We stayed in one of the petite rooms (we were only there for one night - no need for a kitchenette, etc) and it was GORGEOUS. Beautiful decor, amazing bathroom, wonderful shampoos and bathroom goodies, a Nespresso machine in the room. We wished we could have stayed longer - the pool and jacuzzi looked fantastic though we weren't able to use them. All in all, I was really really stunned by the level of service and the quality of this hotel, especially for the price. It's an amazing deal. And you really can't discount how valuable good service is. Everyone we dealt with was friendly and helpful. I'd absolutely stay there again. Highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Oh - and great, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Boutique Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: casha1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 4 times in the last three months and have loved it each time. The location is very convenient to shopping, theatres and sports venues. But what we enjoy the most is the wonderful atmosphere - there is a very comfortable elegance to this hotel and the staff is so gracious and helpful. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the overall ambiance and personal attention”
Reviews.Author: ClaireCalgary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are frequent visitors to Vancouver for both business and pleasure. Previously we had always stayed at the Sylvia Hotel which admittedly can't be beat for its beautiful location right on English Bay. However, on our last couple of visits we have been finding the Sylvia rather dated, the rooms small and cramped, and the abundance of sound transfer from the surrounding rooms most annoying. Particularly on grey, rainy winter days as was the case on the weekend of our recent stay, one looks forward to a certain level of comfort and spaciousness in the room, especially when one feels the need to retreat back to the hotel. Hence, we decided to try something different and decided on L'Hermitage. It certainly met our expectations in this regard. The rooms are roomy, quiet and elegant and the small touches such as the gas fireplace, teacups, provisions for wine, and separated toilet area are much appreciated. There is a feel of intimacy to the hotel, unlike, for example, many large "chains" which frequently exude an institutionalized atmosphere. The location in the core of downtown Vancouver, while not on the water, is very handy and most sights, theatres, shopping etc are easily walkable.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of luxury and an oasis in the downtown district!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell890
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed 2 nights after a ski holiday. Everything about the hotel was top class and I just loved 'Hippo'. Well done staff you run a terrific establishment and I would recommend the hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for a Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: The_Nerd_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Reservation through hotel website was easy and very clear. No need to use a discount site to get the best price. Attentive and discreet service. Very quiet room and fabulous bathroom. The Petite boutique room we chose is a bit small for our 8-days stay. First class amenities, perfect lap pool & whirlpool, and adorable Hyppo canine concierge. Staff very professional, honest and knowledgeable. Easy access to subway (5 mins walk) and downtown activities (all walkable). Valet parking responsive but the taxes (governmental, not hotel) on parking fee are unacceptable (35%) so be aware as it applies to other hotels too. Overall: highly recommandable.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Treasure”
Reviews.Author: skychaserCalgary
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage is a gem in every way....this is my second stay here and I wouldn't hesitate ever to come back. The staff are fabulous and treat you like you are family. Hippo, the resident mascot, is a wonderful quirky addition to the hotel...he is such a friendly soul. It is well located and within walking distance of everything that Vancouver has to offer. It's one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overall - would return”
Reviews.Author: mimikaayu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a condo building. Some floors are residential while some belongs to the hotel. This hotel is nice overall. Clean, good location (if you are driving), nice room (very spacious bathroom). It also has a nice outdoor hot tube and pool. It was cold when I was in Vancouver otherwise I would have used it. Price is decent as well and it's located right downtown. I would return to this hotel next time I'm in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful find”
Reviews.Author: LorriePerth
Reviews.Content: Great location and very good service. We will be back in a few weeks and are looking forward to seeing the staff again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ianrob84
Reviews.Content: A boutique hotel in the heart of Vancouver's West End. A gorgeous little hotel, with attentive, courteous and pleasant staff. Stunningly decorated, right down to the fine detail. Very reasonably priced, this hotel made our first trip to Vancouver even more memorable and wouldn't think twice about staying there on our next visit. Highly recommended for couples! Gorgeous rooftop pool and jacuzzi... Perfect for a soak after a long day exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding in all respects”
Reviews.Author: eekandboo
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every aspect of our stay at l'Hermitage. We were first time visitors to Vancouver but upon arriving at and checking into the hotel, we immediately felt welcomed and well cared for. All aspects of our stay at the hotel well outstanding, most memorable, however, were relaxing on the wonderfully comfortable bed, sharing a crisp evening swim and hottub with our too little seen Seattle-based son and enjoying each encounter with the friendly, highly professional and well-informed staff.

Reviews.Title: “unblemished stay”
Reviews.Author: dacurrie
Reviews.Content: Tthe hotel occupies a number of floors in an apartment block - the reception is on the ground floor with a door man the rooms start a few floors up and are accessed by a lift for hotel guests only. There is a long thin heated swimming pool mainly, I suspect, for those athletic types! there is also a gym. We originally booked a One-Bedroom Boutique Suite and i asked for a King size bed - the Hotel e-mailed me back and said that, this standard of room had either a queen size or king size bed but that we could not book this in advance. When we arrived only a Queen sized bed was available. This was disappointing but the lady behind the desk offered an upgrade to a One-Bedroom Signature at a reduced rate. We accepted and had no regrets. This room was really a small apartment with a full size kitchen with everything you need to cook and serve a meal also a great coffee machine with complimentary cartridges replenished each day. A nice sized lounge, balcony, two bathrooms (both with excellent showers one with a bath also) a reasonable sized bedroom and a study room which was perfect as a dressing room. Beautifully clean, modern and comfortable I could not imagine anything better. Canada is at present (to those who use the pound anyway) very expensive- food and accommodation. Wine is particulary expensive even in supermarkets (3 X that of the same wines availalbe in the UK). With this in mind the accommodation is good value in comparison to other hotels. We stayed in the Pan Pacifc waterfront also which was of comparable price (and lovely) but the accommodation was a single room without a kitchen or balcony. The concierge was brilliant, we had an unfortunate meal at a restaurant he had recommended (it has since shut down), a sign of his commitment was evident when he then rang the restaurant with our comments he followed this up and later informed us that he would not send anyone there in the future, we agreed to go to another suggestion of his (Cin Cin's) It was again an indication of his and the hotels calibre that we were treated as VIP's and had one of the best meals we have ever had. Although without sea front views the locaion of this hotel has very many other advantages, this end of Richards street is a much better place to stay than the other. Each side of the downtown waterfronts are within 10 minutes walk. there are many restaurants within a couple of minutes (Yaletown, Richards, Granville). There are a couple of supermarkets nearby. I would not hesitate to stay here again and dearly hope that I will in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Lesaclover
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was lovely, the room was modern with great attention to detail such as complimentary turn down service with Lindt Balls every evening. The staff were extremely helpful with our favorite staff member being Hippo the French Bulldog. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again in ever back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: worldwanderlust
Reviews.Content: Top service, very private, lovely rooms and good facilities. This is the best 4 star I have ever stayed at. Location is fine (as I am a local) but some tourists may think it is bit on the edge of the nicer area of town. Prices are higher than some other 4 stars in Vancouver, but if a bit of luxury is worth it then it is a good choice. I booked a boutique room and was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite (which was huge and very nice). The outside pool is warm and can be used all year. I am already planning my next stay. :)

Reviews.Title: “Classic Boutique 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: RMB2000
Reviews.Content: L’Hermitage is a lovely hotel. Staff were very attentive and the room was cleaned thoroughly everyday. The bed was so comfortable and was a treat after a long day of shopping. The location is very convenient as you could walk to Gas Town, Yale Town, China Town and the large shopping centres. It is a short taxi ride to Stanley Park/Vancouver Aquarium and you also had the option of using the hotel’s 2 bicycles when they were available. You can also walk down to the wharf for a short boat ride to Granville Island. Ronald the concierge was very knowledgeable about everything that we asked of him. We had a wonderful 5 course meal at Q4 on New Year’s Eve which is located next door. The meal highlighted all the local produce which was wonderful. They have a wonderful wine list. Very easy to indulge….Definitely try the in-room dining breakfast menu – great after a big night out. We stayed there for 9 nights and did not regret any day that we were there. Nespresso machine in the rooms were a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: TheBluxt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and would recommend it unhesitatingly. Just off Robson St, and close to Yaletown, staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was lovely. No picturesque views from the hotel, but you certainly don't have to walk far in Vancouver to get that! This is our 5th time to Vancouver, different hotel each time, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Truly marvelous hotel, with an exceptional staff.”
Reviews.Author: dashingmd
Reviews.Content: This was, quite simply, a perfect hotel. From the desk staff, to the French bulldog in the lobby, to the perfectly appointed rooms, to the magical outdoor pool and jacuzzi, this is quite possibly the finest hotel experience I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed hotel with fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: Irene31020
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well-appointed and certainly an indulgent stay at a very good price! The shining gem, however, is the staff. They are wonderful – unfailingly upbeat, competent, obviously empowered to do what needs to happen to make your stay lovely. Even the cleaning staff will reach out with cheer when they think you might be disoriented or confused – everyone, to a man, is committed to customer service. The staff is knowledgeable and upbeat, seeming to really enjoy what they do and have a genuine interest in you stay being enjoyable. The location is GREAT! It is proximate to everything downtown while being just slightly (half a block) off the heavily-beaten path. I really like their little steam room, and the gym is reasonably well appointed – 3 elliptical trainers, plenty of treadmills, and a weight set. If you are a traveler who values a hotel stay as part of the overall travel experience, I think you’ll be very happy with these accommodations. These folks are wonderful ambassadors for Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Service, room, amenities, all great and the price was really good too.”
Reviews.Author: JPHO
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom suite w/out a kitchen. It was a great size, big bedroom, big bathroom and decent sized living area. We did have a small fridge for water etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had the buffet one morning but there is an IGA on the corner of Robson and 2 Starbucks and a Tim Hortons within a block. We ate at Q4 one night and ordered room service from them one night as well, food and service were excellent. The gym s a decent size for a hotel, they had 3 elipticals, 3 treadmills and 2 bikes. I will book again for our trip this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: SunnygirlSingapore
Reviews.Content: We arrived before the 1 bedroom suite was ready and were invited to the lounge for a complimentary drink and facilities to freshen up. The room was spacious with a marvelous full kitchen and washer/dryer which was appreciated as we had just come from 5 days of skiing in Whistler i.e. lots of dirty clothes. Only downside was that the sofa bed for our boys was lumpy and not very comfortable. Service at reception & bell captain was excellent. Location close to shopping area of Robson Street & Pacific Mall, about 10mins walk, was great.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, elegant accomodations, and one happy pooch made our post-Xmas visit lovely.”
Reviews.Author: Zlatucka
Reviews.Content: For three nights we were close to everything: Yaletown and its amazing restaurants, and downtown and the shopping. Driving in Vancouver was so easy, and the hotel's sweet valets helped us out so much. Our dog, once she got used to the elevator, was very content to stay in the room while we dined downstairs at the newly opened and yummy Q4. Hippo, the pet concierge, and his dad also made last minute reservations at one of the best restaurants in Vancouver: The Blue Water Cafe. Our dog happily stayed in the room while we walked the three blocks to the freshest of fish and wonderful service. We would definitely go back to L'Hermitage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ottobottodog
Reviews.Content: Staff all really friendly - we stayed in a petit boutique room and it was really lovely. Bathroom well appointed luxury and very spacious. Warm room, lovely faux fire, comfy bed. Everything excellent. Would highly recommeend this hotel. We were stuck 3 extra days in Vancouver due to heavy snow closing London Heathrow airport and we felt like the hotel was a home from home in the end. Hippo the dog added to the whole happy experience.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service in a elegantly upscale boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSTraveller10
Reviews.Content: I spent an entire month at L'Hermitage staying in a one bedroom signature suite plus den while I was relocating with my company to Vancouver from another city. Most locals and taxi drivers were unfamiliar with the hotel (it is also a residence) but I decided to book here because of the reviews--I was not disappointed! All of the staff are incredibly friendly and conscientious. The best customer service I have ever encountered in any hotel that I've stayed in, anywhere in the world, any star rating. The rooms are beautifully appointed, the full kitchen is stocked with superior, high-end appliances and the beds are extremely clean and comfortable. I've never slept so well outside of my own home! I used the fitness centre frequently. It has the most updated fitness equipment with attached TVs and the heated outdoor saltwater pool is great, even in the middle of December! Loved the organic free-range eggs for breakfast and delicious fresh fruit at L'Orangerie. Highly recommend this one to anyone and everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tsimtcu8
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the accomodations, the room was great and the staff was helpful. We were only in Vancouver for 1 day and the concierge was great with helping us plan our day in the city. We hit all the major attractions thanks to his advice. The room seemed brand new and the pool/hot tub was a great end to the night. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected pleasure,can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: geoffandirena
Reviews.Content: After travelling through Europe for ten weeks staying in some very ordinary hotels we were looking forward to ending our trip on a high note in Vancouver. Unfortunately one night in the hotel we had booked was enough, we had to find something better !! What a surprise when we discovered L'Hermitage. Great staff, everyone new us by name and the rooms, well we were living the life of the rich and famous without the cost. The greetings from the four legged concierge each morning was a good way to start the day.The location is walking distance to most the sights in Vancouver and close to all the shopping. If we are lucky enough to find our way back from Aust. I know where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at this hotel and I have to say the experience was outstanding. Beautiful rooms that were spotlessly clean with a very comfortable bed and furniture. Excelent service and very helpful advice regarding where to eat etc. Very welcoming when my wife and I and our dog arrived. The car was well secured in the underground parking. In short, great attention to detail resulting in a wonderful stay. Will definitely be back next time we stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hideaway”
Reviews.Author: bobedmonds53
Reviews.Content: Buy yourself some snacks, no room service, morning brunch available, very nice setup. His and hers steamroom, the pool and hot tub were great try and get the 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Restful”
Reviews.Author: UnamedReagent
Reviews.Content: We just completed our stay with L'Hermitage, and everything was fabulous. I stay in top brands all around the world, and L'Herimtage is right up there with the best of them. It's a good value right in the heart of the city, whose staff are very attentive and responsive--not to mention friendly. We were there during the restaraunt construction, and were unfortunately awoken two days in a row by drilling and hammering before 9am. While an unfortunate experience (the only issue of the visit), the response of the staff and especially the operations manager were exemplary. They should be completed construction by Dec 1, 2010 so this should no longer be an issue. We stayed in a Signature suite, and the well-appointed kitchen had all we needed to entertain friends. They have a couple of bikes as well for guest use, a lovely library/lounge area, and a heated outdoor pool among other ammenities. Oh, and if that's not enough, you have to meet Hippo, their Canine Concierge...he's an adorable French 'Black Masked Fawn' Bull Dog. He thinks he's a person, and is actually quite engaging to spend time with.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing everything! Recomend for sure!”
Reviews.Author: dreamofbeaches
Reviews.Content: The staff was unbelievable! Very friendly, quick and amazing service! Our room was fantasic, so clean and comfortable! They have great coffee with real cream and different flavors! Bathrobes and slippers supplied. The bed is VERY comfortable, and there is a large deck with a nice patio set on it! The pool and hot tub are amazing as well. Would highly reccomend this hotel! Everything was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and pleasant stay at L'Hermitage”
Reviews.Author: anonymousWAState
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to try another hotel in Vancouver this time and we were very happy to stay at this hotel. The last time we stayed in Vancouver we stayed on busy Robson street and it was a real hassle getting in and out of the parking lot when we needed to use the car. L'Hermitage is still centrally located, but it's on a quieter block, which was nice. The now famous Hippo was there to great us, as well as the very friendly staff. The valet parking was nice because they brought your car around for you if you needed it and parked it when you got back to the hotel-for those of you who have never driven in busy Vancouver and tried to park this is a nice perk. Our room was very nice and it almost felt like we had our own apartment in Vancouver. The separate living room was beautifully decorated and the bathroom was extremely spacious. The bed was comfy and everything was very clean. We loved the Nespresso machine too, it makes great coffee! The staff is extremely helpful and they were always ready to give suggestions, etc... We will definitely stay here again the next time we go to Vancouver. For those of you who want to bring pets they also allow them and Hippo the canine concierge is available to assist.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Apartment Hotel at Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: scoacc
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I recently spent 8 nights in L'Hermitage Vancouver (Oct'10). We selected this Hotel after consideration of Trip Advisor Reviews. The Hotel, which is very centrally placed in Downtown, was excellent in virtually all respects. Our Suite, Open Plan Living Room incl Kitchen Area, Bedroom, Office/Study space & Bathroom was both spacious and well equipped. The Kitchen area included Hob/Oven/Fridge/Dishwasher/MicroWave and Coffe Machine (Pods). Their were TV's in both the Lounge & Bedroom and wireless Wi-Fi was available. The Hotel also has an impressive Breakfast Room which provided an extensive Buffet Breakfast and a Coffee Machine providing decent Coffee which is usually difficult to find with Hotel Breakfast ( you might guess from this that my Partner is very "picky" where Coffee is concerned). The Hotel also has Gym/Outdoor Pool facilities which we didn't use. A Restuarant was about to open on the Ground Floor. Perhaps even more impressive than these facilities was the attention and support from the Staff. Staff on the front desk & in the Breakfast Room were always attentive, polite and helpful. However, I thought the Concierge Desk Staff were even more impressive. During our stay, amongst other things, they arranged Bookings at hard to get into Restaurants and sorted out Car Hire arrangements. They were also helpful in suggesting must do's for our Itinerary. All this for an Nightly Rate of only £150. Would I go back - I wouldn't look anywher else.

Reviews.Title: “An all encompassing and exceptional visit”
Reviews.Author: Ridgebackxhosa
Reviews.Content: Spacious, beautifully appointed rooms plus personable and very helpful staff + a canine concierge! Very conveniently located downtown. Well stocked breakfast buffet in spacious public rooms (available all day) and excellent service from all staff made this an unforgettable and, hopefully, repeatable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: kiwikaileigh
Reviews.Content: The L'Hermitage Hotel made me feel welcome right from the get go...I received a complimentary upgrade, this was very unexpected, however I was extremely grateful - the room in my opinion was massive for a solo traveller, which almost made me feel a little ashamed to be utilising on my own...! I have stayed in many hotels around the world and never experienced the simple touch of the personal welcoming card on the ktichen benchtop before...kudos to the GM of L'Hermitage Glenn Eleiter, walking through the doors & receiving this note reassured me immediately that I had chosen the right hotel...! Unfortunately I didn't spend that much time at the hotel itself so I wasn't able to enjoy all the amenities the hotel had to offer - however free internet in the business centre was appreciated... The staff were all very professional & friendly...the SkyTrain was within close walking distance making it extremely easy travelling to & from the airport... I had only wished that I had stayed more than two night at this wonderful establishment - I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to any of my friends and will definitely be back...!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: RJB72
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to Vancouver, but our first stay at L'Hermitage, chosen on the basis of previous reviews. Our room was a "Boutique" - not extra large - but the big, beautifully appointed bathroom had the toilet in a separate room. Excellent. We assumed we'd have cleanliness and up-to-date fittings (which we did), but we did not expect to be greeted by name every time we walked through the lobby! Made us feel special! L'Orangerie provided the breakfast setting we like - quiet, classy and good value for money. Kimberley served us quietly and efficiently and we enjoyed chatting to her. :) The supermarket around the corner had all we needed for snacks, etc. We borrowed the hotel's two bikes and helmets (which should be booked in advance), walked them to Stanley Park and then rode around there. Great fun and, of course, fabulous scenery! The convenience of secure, on-site, valet parking was worth the $25 a night. Hippo, the Canine Concierge, adds a bit of fun to the hotel and we have the impression that all the staff love working here. We plan to return to Vancouver, and L'Hermitage hotel will be the first thing we book!

Reviews.Title: “Unpretentious luxury, extreme comfort and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: HNLT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of spending two nights at L'Hermitage. Our room was a one bedroom boutique suite facing the street. The room was immaculate and tastefully decorated with high end treatments. The living area was a comfortable size, had sufficient space and included a fireplace and small wet bar area including a refrigerator. The bathroom was quite large with double sinks (marble), a separate water closet and glassed in shower. While the bedroom was small, it was adequate for a king size bed and provided a cozy and romantic sleeping area. Glass doors off the bedroom led to a balcony overlooking the street and included a small table and chairs. Even though the room faced the street, noise was not an issue.
