Excellent, high quality bathrobes were provided and the bed linens were a comfortable high thread count. Quite luxurious. The front desk staff and attendants were welcoming, friendly and very helpful with restaurant recommendations and local attractions. While we did not travel with pets, the hotel is extremely pet friendly and have a resident dog Hippo who sleeps quietly in the corner of the lobby and loves attention from guests. Hippo has his own calling card and title of Manager of Canine Services....a cute touch. The location is excellent and is in easy walking distance to shops, restaurants and bars. We had a car and parking is an additional charge but the valet service to retrieve the car was fast and friendly...worth the price as parking in Vancouver is a problem. If you are looking for a smaller venue of relaxed luxury and high quality service with a personal touch this hotel is for you. We loved it and would welcome the opportunity to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a quiet night's sleep, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Saxify
Reviews.Content: Reservations for 6 nights. Lovely hotel. Attentive staff. Asked for a quiet room - the 5am (unasked-for) wake-up was trucks in back of the building, backup signals blaring, tailgates crashing. I was told by the hotel desk at 5am that the hotel had complained to the city before about the garbage collection noise early each morning. All I wanted was a nice, quiet room. The hotel could have put me on the other side of the building, away from the noise they new was going to occur. Instead, I was given a room that was blasted by the vehicle noise for over an hour that morning. I made arrangements around 7am to move to another hotel. At 8:30, when I went to check out I was then offered a change of rooms, even an upgrade if I would stay. Thanks but no thanks. The quiet room was mandatory, not optional. The hotel I moved to, not as nice esthetically, but quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thebarnesfamily78
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is centrally located in downtown Vancouver, and is only a couple of blocks from the underground, which gives easy access to the airport. It is amongst the very best hotels that either my wife or I have stayed in - the ambience, the friendliness/helpfulness of the staff, the facilities - are all top notch. We were upgraded to a suite on our arrival, at no extra cost. The suite was exceptionally well appointed and very clean. We hadn't intended having breakfast in the Hotel, tried it the first morning, out of convenience, it was so good we went there every morning! Can't be recommended too highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous find, We will Stay Again!! Great service/amenities/ambience!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianGirl53
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay downtown because we were going to Hockey Game. Normally stay at the Wedgewood but we thought we would give L'Hermitage a try!! Glad we did. We had booked a Boutique suite and got upgraded to a Signature suite!! Sub zero fridge fully stocked kitchen with granite counters and bar stools. Had friends over for drinks and appetizers before the game and after, our little humble abode away from home!. Had a fabulous breakfast in L'Orangerie. We will come down for 2 nights next time!! Loved the dog concierge "Hippo" he loves to sleep on the desk as likes being same level as humans not on the floor!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: kenbug
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in heart of city....clean, comfortable...rooms good but not great...neighborhood O.K....friendly, helpful staff...buffet breakfast available for additional charge (we paid $15 each): eggs, waffles, sausage, etc....computer available...overall nice place, decent value for price, but not particularly great.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute must visit”
Reviews.Author: grif858
Reviews.Content: This review is hard to write. To compare this hotel to any other I’ve stayed at would be unfair. You need to understand, this hotel is far and away something very special and unique. For starters, this is actually a condominium property with a segment of the building dedicated for this hotel. Staff is very friendly and more than happy to assist with any question you might have. An example, when I checked in my room wasn’t ready so I was shown to a cool lounge area upstairs (half of which doubles as their restaurant). The one bedroom suite is just that, a huge one bedroom condo with high end touches throughout. The deep soaking tub was a real bonus. As for price, I’m blown away it’s not much more. I’d expect this to go for $400-500/night, it’s really that good. As for location, it’s hard to find something better than this. You’re a few blocks away from the main downtown area and still a few blocks away from the waterfront and Yaletown. The subway system (called the Skytrain) is only two blocks away and I’d highly recommend it coming from/to the airport (same speed as a taxi and way cheaper). Side recommendation, if you like sushi, walk 10 blocks south to Kaide Sushi and be blown away. Other reviews were correct that there is no dedicated restaurant for room service but they are beginning construction on a new restaurant. My only wish (mind you this is a stretch) is they had a higher quality shower curtain and rod. The rest of the room was so high end that the rod and curtain looked so cheap in comparison. Overall, this is one property that must be at the top of your list if you ever visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: sqprincess
Reviews.Content: We (3 adults) chose this hotel mainly because of the location (quiet yet convenient) and the large room. We stayed in a one bedroom signature den which came with a separate bedroom with master bathroom, a little "den" or study room, a living room with sofa bed, and second bathroom, kitchen and a balcony. The room lived up to its photo and description on the hotel website. There was also a washer and dryer (with soap powder included) which was great! It was all we expected and more - clean & staff were polite and efficient. Of course, there was also the star "employee" Hippo, the Canine Concierge :) It was too bad that were were only there for 2 nights - we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great, comfortable place in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: RMW80
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at L'Hermitage three times in the last year or so. It is a small hotel on about 4 floors of a building with residences on other floors. So the service is personal, which you don't get with large commercial hotels. It is walking distance to the Skytrain station, many great restaurants, and the hockey arena. I have two kids, so we need two bedrooms. This hotel has two bedroom suites that have full kitchens and there is a pull out bed in the living room. Very nice furniture, quality bedding, and quiet. Last time we went we asked for a cheese plate, which was really wonderful. With taxes, a two bedroom suite runs about $380 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great service, beautiful decor.”
Reviews.Author: studiobg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 wonderful days at L'Hermitage. The staff was warm, friendly and very helpful. We absolutely loved Hippo, the Canine Concierge and were very impressed with the cleanliness and beautiful decor. We also liked the lap pool which we didn't get to use but will definitely do next time! Our suite was very comfortable, great bed, spacious bathroom with a tub, shower and private WC. We had complimentary Nespresso coffee and tea every day. The Orangerie offers fresh breakfast every morning, we enjoyed the fresh berries, juices, and wonderful croissants. There's also a nice lounge where you can sit and have coffee or tea and read. The hotel is located right on the corner of Richard's and Robson Street, downtown Vancouver, so we were right by the shops and restaurants. There's also a Market Place store right under the hotel. We will definitely go back !!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: MPMG8r
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage is a boutique hotel that provides 5 star PLUS service. Everyone on the staff, including MaryAnn at the front desk and Raymond at the Concierge, were exceptionally friendly and helpful. The lobby, hallways, and rooms were immaculate. The rooms looked exactly like the pictures posted by other reviewers. Bed and pillows were perfect. Pros: the staff were easily the best I've ever come across in all of my travels. Everyone knew our names, held doors open for us, gave helpful tips about our stay - you name it. The service was quite simply unparalleled to anything I've ever enjoyed. Having a full kitchen with refrigerator and dishwasher is really great when you have an extended stay with kids. The hotel is also very close to an IGA food store so it was easy to get things like milk, drinks, etc. Our room also included a washer/dryer - which meant we could pack lighter for our international travel. The hotel's location in the center of Vancouver meant we could walk to just about any part of the city in 15 minutes or less. Hotel provides free wireless internet as well as a business center where you can print things like boarding passes for airlines. Cons: none, really. The hotel was fantastic and I will definitely choose staying there again. One note: the fireplace in the room is decorative - it doesn't actually generate any heat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike02
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Vancouver and want some independance and have some of those pleasures of home, here is the place. Great staff. roomy rooms and home away from home appeal. . Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, perfect price, perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BDM22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at L'Hermitage, primarily based on other user reviews, and could not have been more pleased. Excellent location -- right off of Robson with lots of local eateries. (Must try a shawarma wrap at Falafel Maison on the opposite corner...best food we had all week, and it was under $10.) Robson is very noisy at night in some areas. The hotel is in the quieter section. It's decorated very nicely and with a calm, modern flair. Hotel staff were so polite and helpful. We didn't have a car in Vancouver, and chose to walk everywhere. While Stanley Park is nearby, it's still over a mile to get there...I recommend a bus to get to the park because you will want to walk as much as possible once there. Such a pretty park! Overall, we paid about the same for a hotel in Chicago the weekend before we went to Vancouver, and I feel L'Hermitage was a far better hotel...extremely nice and welcoming. Plus, Hippo is an adorable dog...he rode in the elevator with us!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: PeterCox47
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage HOtel in Vancouver was probably the best hotel that we have stayed in all year (and we stay in a lot). From the Front Desk staff and the concierge through to the delightful ladies in the small breakfast area the service was impeccable. The rooms (Signature Den) were huge - great value for money. Travelling for some time as we were we really appreciated the in-room laundry facilities. We would now stay nowhere else when in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: LeBrat1
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful, of good quality, boutique type hotel. The details are here, the staff was very classy and went above and beyond. I would highly recommend this hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable and reasonably priced- terrific value!”
Reviews.Author: Br00kline
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a comfortable 4 night stay at L'Hermitage. The hotel is well located, rooms are attractive with quite a nice bathroom. The staff was very friendly and helpful all around. WiFi and biz center are free, which I appreciate. We used the free bikes to ride around and had a great time. Given all the "amenities", the price was extremely reasonable- a real value. I would definitely stay again when traveling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “I WANT A FRENCH BULLDOG!”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFritz
Reviews.Content: Things we really liked: The location The nice,large,really clean room/bathroom The canine conceirge The free bikes for riding around Stanley park. The free Wi-fi. Things that could have been better: The parking arrangements, I'm not a fan of valet parking although it never took more than 15 minutes to get our car. The sofa bed is very uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: chirish61
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in a boutique solarium. The room was a studio apartment with a solarium, a large full kitchen, marble bathroom, washer/dryer, dining table with seating for 4, fireplace and the usual amenities such as hairdryer, coffee maker, etc. The room was immaculate and kept that way throughout our stay. We had a minor issue in our room and the staff couldn't have been more pleasant and accommodating. the hotel is also centrally located, very convenient. It was also a very quiet room, as we never heard our neighbors next to, above or below us. Street noise was not an issue. there is a grocery store right on the corner and cafes line Robson Street.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKas
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay at L'Hermitage every time I visit Vancouver. It was a fantastic boutique hotel right off the main shopping area of Robson Street. L'Hermitage is made up of residence apartments and hotel guest rooms. My spacious room overlooked a lovely heated lap pool and sun terrace, the windows to my room opened so I could hear the fountains all night. The room was beautifully decorated with a huge luxurious bathroom. Bedding was five star and very comfortable. Flat screen TV, fireplace, n'esspresso coffee maker and free wi-fi were much appreciated. The hotel has a wonderful gym and serves breakfast and cocktails in the library. There is no actual restaurant or bar on site but there are many closeby in Yaletown just a few blocks away. A grocery store is next door with ready made meals and anything else you need. Valet parking was expensive but there was a self-park or street parking nearby. I booked on Expedia for only $143 / night!

Reviews.Title: “Potentially perfect, but flawed in the details”
Reviews.Author: Chicagogoer
Reviews.Content: Pros: perfect location, very clean, nice elegant design. Cons: The lock to the balcony door was broken the first night of my 4-night stay. I propped furniture against it and rigged a booby-trap until I could ask the front desk to take care of it the next day, which they did. On the third day, housekeeping put wine glasses in the dishwasher, and I opened the dishwasher to find broken glass shards staring up at me. The dress code forbids robes in the elevator and halls, and who wants to get fully dressed after using the hot tub or steam bath, just to go back to the room? On the last day, I discovered too late that the fixtures were reversed in the washing machine in my suite, so my attempt to wash clothes in cold water resulted in a hot wash and hot rinse, which anyone knows can damage delicates and cause colors to bleed. Finally, a temporary charge (which I was told was for "incidentals" - but which was well over $1,300) was placed on my credit card when I checked in and after I paid in full for my stay using another means, I am still waiting for this to be released one week later. Laughing all of it off, and I may stay again, but would have enjoyed my stay more if I had been on the lookout for all of the above.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: jkcheng21
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the L'Hermitage and it was an absolutely wonderful experience. We got the signature suite and were thrilled with the contemporary yet classic decor. The kitchenette was amazing with a Nespresso coffeemaker. The gym had modern equipment. The hotel staff was amazing. They never missed a thing and were very responsive to any requests. The location of the hotel was great and we walked to the convention center within 10-15 min, great restaurants nearby. This place is a real find and we will plant to go back for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but.....”
Reviews.Author: CatrionaMcD
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location and because of a reccommendation from a colleague. It IS ideally situated, and the quality of every detail from the appliances to the toiletries is exquisite. On a rainy night after a very long day on our feet, however, room service would have been wonderful, and we certainly missed it! There are many excellent restaurants within walking distance or a short cab ride, but we were too tired to go out into the record-breaking rain that night. We ended up ordering food to be delivered from a nearby restaurant and ended up waiting for over 2 hours. One other thing: the toilet enclosure smelled persistently of urine despite efforts by housekeeping and myself. I actually bought a can of Lysol at the corner grocery and sprayed the entire area without any lasting results.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vancouver Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: theopup
Reviews.Content: The L'Hermitage hotel on Richards Street in Vancouver was just a perfect stay. It is in a wonderful location to tour the city, has great charm, excellent service & attention to detail. The rooms are lovely, we would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Nothing Less!!”
Reviews.Author: GwynantWales
Reviews.Content: We started our 18 day tour of Canada & USA from the L'Hermitage and finished it in the L'Hermitage The last 4 days in Vancouver we stayed in a 2 bedroon signature suite apartment in the L'Hermitage Hotel. When we went into the apartment we where told that this was best one in the hotel. The apartment had 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, kitchen, living room, a study and a huge patio looking over the swimming pool. This place had the WOW factor, everything was perfect. The reviews about this hotel i totaly agree with especialy about the staff. The location was wonderful, very close to main shopping area and canada place. Where Richards St meets Robson St, (which is only 15 metres down from the hotel) you will find a supermarket which has a good selection of fresh produce. It was a pleasure to stay at this hotel and it made a perfect end to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful boutique hotel- special, personalized hospitality”
Reviews.Author: EGN_10
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot, mostly European travel (always luxury)and this hotel is right up there with the best we have stayed at. The rooms are aesthetically pleasing and exciting in their concept, with space and thoughtful little touches (like robes that actually fit woman- not only XXL!), fireplace, Nespresso coffee maker. In our suite, there was a glamourous high-end kitchen that made a small party a real delight,and which our concierge arranged for us through a local sushi-house, simply and with no fuss. The bedroom was spacious and pretty, and the bed well-dressed (although North Americans seem perennially challenged by duvet covers; perhaps they are not available there?). The breakfast room was a delight, the food simple yet simply very good, with an indulgent, bottomless bowl of fresh barries and hot croissants.The roof patio hot-tub and pool are inviting and the excersize room looked state-of-the art.The business center was also very tasteful and would have been a very respectable venue for a business meeting. After reading other comments, I can only state that the management, to us, was exceedingly professional, courteous, and genuinely considerate , which enhanced our stay . We had a number of unusual requests and every request was met with in the most genteel spirit. The entire staff from chambermaid to front office showed the mark of professional management, neither overly familiar nor overly formal.Just a truly hospitable establishment which is rare, and a real pleaure to find.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, rooms very clean, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: oz50
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 4 nights . Rooms were very clean, good condition . We stayed in a one bed signature suite. I slept on the sofa bed in the loungeroom which was quite comfortable. Staff were very friendy and helpful. the view from our room was overlooking a car park across the road but location wise is very handy. 5 to 10 min walk to shops/gas town and Canada Place. if you want to save money by cooking your own food there is an IGA supermaket on the next corner. if not there are plenty of restaurants/ eateries around. The hotel is easy to get to from the airport. $7.50 ticket on the light rail, then a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “A beautifully presented hotel in the heart of downtown Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: Rod R
Reviews.Content: A pleasant greeting upon arrival. A spacious, well-appointed suite. A sumptuous swimming pool. A knowledgeable and friendly concierge. A position close to the Robson Street shopping district. This hotel has it all, and at a very reasonable price. After travelling for 3 weeks through western Canada, my wife and I agreed that this was easily the best hotel of our holiday. I would recommend it to any other couples looking for modern, quiet accommodation in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: LLStates
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the end of September in this very nice hotel. This was the most relaxing hotel we stayed during our trip in Canada. We had no chance to have a room on the pool-side, but even on the street side, it was really very quiet.The room was very well equipped and very clean. Perfect location too. We enjoyed the European touch and appreciated the Nespresso machine in the room with real cream in the fridge and also the very good selection of organic teas. Very nice, helpful and professional staff and as dogowners, loved the canine concierge called Hippo.We can highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, great location, 100% recommendation.”
Reviews.Author: comlab
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the L'Hermitage Hotel for 4 nights in late July ealry August 2010. We used this Hotel for starting our long 9 weeks Canada vacation and wanted to stay in Vancouve in central and very nice Hotel. The L'Hermitage Hotel fullfilled that completly. The very friendly staff at the Desk gave us a lot of helpful informatin about the city itself. We got a nice and big room with a king size bed. Everything was clean and in perfect condition. We would also recommend the concierge in the L'Hermitage Hotel. We got a 4 hour free Bike rental on a very nice day. We can 100% recommand this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else...this is ideal !”
Reviews.Author: Vanessacmc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at L'Hermitage hotel, early one morning, for our 3 night stay, absolutely full of colds and sneezes. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more caring towards us, they allowed us to check in very early and then set up hot honey and lemon to our room (without asking). We felt so looked after and pampered. We had no expectations for this hotel, it was a recommendation from a friend. However from past experience, we have learnt that for this price, rooms in the city centre will tend to be on the smaller side. I couldn't have been more wrong ! We had booked a basic room but it was a great size. A beautiful large bathroom, very modern and exceptionally clean. A good sized closet with robes and slippers, a lovely sized bedroom, a very soft and comfy bed and 2 equally comfy chairs. Plenty of room for the 2 of us, with all our luggage. There is a great room for breakfast, a good sized gym, a fun pool and hot-tub, both of which are outside. The hotel is excellent, topped off by extremely friendly and helpful staff. I'll definitely be coming back !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: SnapperLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we stayed in, out of the ten we used during our self-drive holiday. Most the others were part of large chains and we felt this was different. The rooms were very comfortable and quiet. The Nespresso coffee maker gave us the best coffee on the trip. Everywhere was very clean and we saw a "supervisor" going round with a clipboard checking tables in the public areas and the tops of picture frames, etc to make sure they had been cleaned. I think she also checked the rooms following cleaning. . The bathroom was very good and we liked the seperate shower and the WC being in it's own room. We had plenty of soap, shower gel and shampoo and found it no problem to get extra coffee pods etc. The staff were all excellent and very helpful. We had a late flight when we left and they suggested we could keep the room until 2.00pm. The breakfast selection was not as good as some of the hotels but was of a very good quality, very adequate and reasonably priced. Internet use was free in the business centre and in bedrooms. We used the Skytrain to return to the airport. Very fast and cheap. The City Centre station is just a couple of blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is definitely one of the best hotels...”
Reviews.Author: EitanIsrael
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the best hotels we stayed in. All was perfect no need to say more . If you are in Vancouver stay in this hotel and you will understand .also try their breakfast , it's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great end to our Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Markate
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel in all respects. Very helpful and friendly staff. Ideal location for restaurants, shopping and sightseeing. Free bike usage if available, I haven't ridden a bike in over 30 years but found it easy on their cycle paths and went from the hotel around Stanley Park. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This place can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: bunchanTokyo
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at L'Hermitage for 6 nights from September 15-20 with 8 friends. We were all accommodated on the same floor in 3 suites during our visit. We were married in our suite on the Saturday and it couldn't have been better. The staff were all extremely helpful with our many small requests. They truly went out of their way to ensure that we had everything we needed to make our special day very special. From the moment we checked in until the moment we checked out, the level of personal service was magnificent. The hotel doesn't currently have a restaurant or bar on the premises, but with the fully stocked kitchen facilities in each suite, and an IGA supermarket and a liquor store just around the corner, we were able to have whatever we wanted, whenever we wanted. The hotel is located within walking distance of Yaletown, Gastown and Robson Street, so there was never a doubt about finding great restaurant choices nearby. For the price and the friendly, personal service, L'Hermitage is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. It's not very well-known yet in Vancouver, but this will surely change.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies' Getaway in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: afeefam
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage was everything we had hoped for and more. We stayed in a suite which had a full kitchen, 2 bedrooms and 2 baths. It turned out cheaper than 2 separate rooms for the 4 of us. The staff was extremely accommodating especially with luggage lost by the airlines. Downtown location is a bit noisy with garbage trucks banging away at 6am but this is to be expected in a thriving, densely populated city. The location was worth it though-right in the center Vancouver giving us access to West End, Gastown, Yaletown and the Aquabus to Granville Island. We were able to walk everywhere, even Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Norie003
Reviews.Content: Arrived from Manchester, England and spent our first 4 nights in British Columbia at this great hotel. Check in was very smooth with delightful staff and our boutique suite was fabulous. Lounge, bedroom, balcony, bar, fridge and beautiful bathroom. The staff were particularly friendly and very helpful throughout our stay. Good situation within walking distance of many attractions in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Way exceeded my Expectations..really nice!!”
Reviews.Author: sipeebles
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVED our room at L'Hermitage! I read all reviews and it seemed a good value. But for the money it was AWESOME. Our room had everything we could want..fireplace, patio, bathrobes, refrigerator, and most important REALLY nice bathroom! And it was an EXCELLENT location..close to public transportation, Yaletown, Gastown, Canadian center, Robson St. Service was quite good too. I travel for work and found this to be one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. I HIGHLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary014
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about 10 min walk from the Sky Train Canada Line which cost just $7.50 into Vancouver City station (and $2.50 back!), it was also situated really well from the main tourist sites and Vancouver is a lovely city to wander around day or night. Our room was just as the website looks, very comfortable - excellent bed and a nice balcony which was great to take in those last summer rays after a day's wandering round Vancouver. Dont let the fact they dont have a bar or room service put you off - there is a great store at the end of the road and bars/restaurants open until v late just 5 mins walk away. We decided to have breakfast on day 1 in the hotel and it was very lovely - nice choice, great coffee and the waitress gave us some good pointers for our BC trip. The fact that it is not a big hotel is the big draw for us, as it was personal, comfortable and definitely a modern boutique style hotel Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but with attention to detail and customer service!”
Reviews.Author: pbchas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small boutique hotel situated in downtown Vancouver. The rooms are well equipped. Took advantage of business center, Bed was comfy, room was quiet, particularly liked the large bathroom with separate bath and shower and plenty of towels. The staff added to the quality of this hotel. Everyone was helpful, kind and courteous, even going out of their way to get you what you need. The concierge, Raymond, was extremely helpful recommending restaurants, etc. We were even able to get into some popular ones that were full, just because the concierge had a good rapport with them. Gave us umbrellas to use on rainy days. We thought the cost of continental breakfast was too high, but found the grocery that was just steps away to have everything we needed to make our own in the room. Transit system in Vancouver is handy and easy. Wonderful weather and scenery. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at L'Hermitage and in Vancouver!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! Very unexpected.”
Reviews.Author: aloha68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I planned our honeymoon trip to Vancouver and I did much research on hotels. I booked this hotel with some reservations, but when we arrived until the end of our 6 night stay we loved everything about our stay. The service was the best! We wanted a room with a kitchen and washing machine and it was more than we expected. All the appliances were top notch. The location was central, and walkable, to almost everything, Yaletown, Gastown, Granville, Robson, etc. The only thing is that it is a little bit on the expensive side. Other than that we have no complaints and would recommend it to everyone. We hope to stay there again on a future trip and still see "Hippo" the hotel mascot roaming the lobby. So cute! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sacka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must stay when in Vancouver. The people are very helpful and the location cannot be beat. "We particularly enjoyed meeting the hotel mascot Hippo." The room was lovely and the bathroom was very sleek and modern. The staff goes out of there way to be helpful and it makes all the difference in the world. Someone on this site mentioned that if you want good room view this is not the hotel for you. That is good advice. However,if you want a great hotel at a fair price this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about L'Hermitage is excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Moeder1963
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed 7 nights at l'Hermitage. The staff is wonderful, very helpful. We booked a Boutique Room and it was beautiful. The bathroom is amazing ! We had a pull-out couch for our teenage daughter. We had the computer room on our floor (which my daughter appreciated) and the terrace was a few steps from our room. The lap pool and jacuzzi were great. The location is ideal - within walking distance to shopping, restaurants and Canada Place. Having a grocery store around the corner was very handy. I highly recommend this hotel. There are no negative points.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Exceded Expectations, Made First Trip to Vancouver Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: k_a_sharp
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the hotel this past weekend! (Aug 21-22, 2010) It was my husband's and my first trip to Vancouver and it was amazing BECAUSE we were staying at such an amazing hotel! The entire experience, including all the staff, rooms, breakfast, were impeccable! We can't wait to stay again and will be recommending anyone who comes to Vancouver stays at L'Hermitage!~ Before we even checked in, I contacted the concierge regarding early check in and some dinner recommendations! They wrote me back immediately and said they would do their absolute best to get us checked in early (which upon arrival happended!), and recommended some fabulous places to eat (we dined at both, Blue Water Cafe and Cin Cin and enjoyed both immensely!). The morning we were checking out we took advantage of the breakfast buffet at L'Orangerie, it was amazing, for such a reasonable cost! Very tasty breakfast, yummy healthy options, overall a great way to end our stay at the hotel. Also while there we talked with bellman Bobby! He was amazing with suggestions for Whistler! We took all his suggestions and hiked the Shannon Falls, Brandywine Falls, and the "Chief" up to the first peak! They were all amazing! We ate at Sushi Village and are ending our trip at Rimrock, all based on his fabulous suggestions! Thank you again for making our vacation truly amazing, we can't wait to come back! Katie and Bill Chicago, IL, USA

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: nicoledueff
Reviews.Content: We took the train to Vancouver just for two days/one night and stayed at L'Hermitage. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The room was gorgeous and very clean (everything looked brand new), very quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in the perfect location. We walked to everything. We would stay in this hotel again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, home from home”
Reviews.Author: flossom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'hermitage for 6 nights 8-13 August. We booked a one bedroom signature suite and it was amazing. We couldnt believe the size of it, so spacious. We had a corner suite on the 5th floor of the hotel, which is the top floor. The floors above are residential. We had views of the pool are and city views from both sides. Having the kitchen are was fantastic while on holiday with children. The fridge was always stocked with drinks and food from the supermarket below. The freezer was refilled daily with loads of ice, it never ran out. The added bonus of the Nespresso machine was ideal. Any kind of meal could have been prepared in the kitchen with the appliances and utensils supplied, nothing was left out. In fact it was better stocked than my own kitchen! I forgot to do the washing up one morning and on return the maid had filled and turned on the dishwasher! Having the laundry facilities was an enormous help as we didnt need to pack as much as normal. The airconditioning in the room was great. Having more that one tv kept the peace at night! It was great to have free wi-fi too. Th location of the hotel was superb. 5mins walk to our favourite restaurant, Whitespot and 5mins from Roots where the kids love to shop! The hotel staff are outstanding, everyone has a friendly smile and always a good morning/good evening. The doormen were so helpful and friendly having a chat as you came and went. They even have a hotel dog! Having the seperate bedroom makes the difference when travelling with children. The bed was comfortable but a little hard for me, just being picky! The children slept well on the pull out bed and had loads of room. The living area was very large and we even had a seperate study are to chill in. The bathroom was very clean and toiletries and towels well stocked. Cleaning service was excellent. We never had the breakfast at the hotel, we never do. There was a Tim Hortons next to the IGA supermarket attached to the hotel and that was great, we prefer it to Starbucks for taste and for the price. The pool was a lap pool but roomy enough for a few people at once and very welcome after a very warm August day sightseeing. The towels are all provided at the side of the pool and there are comfy sun loungers and dining areas all round the outside. The pool is saltwater and was a winner with the children. The gym looked good, but on holiday we never use them. There was a changing area for the pool too. The hotel also provided access to computers and printers. There really is nothing bad to say about our stay at this hotel except that we had to leave. I highly recommend to anyone staying in Vancouver. It is handy for all public transport and a short walk from the Library, shops, restaurans and even Stanley Park was an enjoyable walk from the hotel. Every night we walked to Canada Place and always felt safe within the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cat3561
Reviews.Content: We did a Cruise to Alaska and ended up in Vancouver, we stayed for a few says, Loved this hotel, the rooms were beautiful and roomy ,beds were great, bathroom to die for.. the whole place has a wonderful air about it. the staff is superb, Raymond the concierge was top notch, the bellmen, Bobby and Jerry were great and very helpful, we had a truly wonderful experience staying here and I would highly recomend it to anyone who is going to Vancouver. The city is great.. will go agin for sure..

Reviews.Title: “A Stunner!”
Reviews.Author: DanielMayer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for our anniversary and we had the 1 bedroom suite with modern kitchen and all we can say was that the hotel, decor, modernist style and service was amongst the best we've ever experienced, and we've stayed at many 5 star hotels in most of the major cities and resorts of the world. We HIGHLY recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, incredibly spacious, comfortable suite”
Reviews.Author: puffinmaniac
Reviews.Content: My husband, my elderly mother, my two young kids, and I stayed in an immense two-bedroom suite. It was pricey, but not as pricey as getting two nice hotel rooms elsewhere, which was the alternative. (My mom got one bedroom, my husband and I got the second, and the kids slept on the sofabed.) The suite came with a complete kitchen, washer/dryer, and lots of closet space. One bedroom even had a sitting room with a desk. Everything was comfortable and clean (even the gym). The staff was courteous and helpful with all our touristy questions.

Reviews.Title: “Location, space and amenities make it a great family base.”
Reviews.Author: tfrancois
Reviews.Content: We chose l'Hermitage because it can be difficult to find a hotel room that can accommodate a family of five comfortably and affordably. Our nightly rate (after a CAA discount) was less than the cost of two standard rooms in any other comparable hotel we could find and we got many more in-suite amenities. We stayed in the Two-Bedroom Signature Suite (room 701). The suite features a full kitchen, laundry facilites, a small balcony, a HUGE terrace, two bathrooms and enough space, TVs and beds for us to relax comfortably after a long day of sightseeing with three small children. From the doorman, to the front desk, to housekeeping, to the waitstaff at the small breakfast-only restaurant (our children's meals were free), service was consistently top-notch and delivered with a smile. The concierge was particularly helpful, saving us money and time by arranging transportation for us. There isn't any view to speak of when you're surrounded by skyscrapers but the landscaping at l'Hermitage effectively creates an oasis among the towers. We particularly enjoyed the pool and hot-tub area. We found the location excellent. Not only is there a supermarket in the same building, but both SkyTrain lines are within two blocks of the hotel. We easily walked to Gastown, Yaletown and Robson Avenue shops and the major bus routes are only a short hike away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, can't believe it's so inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: atpanda
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night and were shocked at how chic and fancy this hotel was. We booked on Expedia and paid an extremely fair price for what we got. The hotel is impeccable. Very modern, extremely clean. We needed to catch the early train to the airport and it's only like 2 blocks away. You can also walk easily to Granville Street if that's your scene (and boy, what a scene it is!). The only thing is, I think we weren't expecting it to be as fancy as it was. We'd just finished 6 days of outdoorsy activities in Whistler and we felt a tad undressed coming into the hotel. We also didn't get a chance to use the pool, but it looked like something out of a magazine. Lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel; you'll be so glad you stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: mog66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I checked into L'Hermitage with a group of 12 family members for a 2 night stay in July. Every single staff member was incredibly kind and helpful to all of our group members. From checking in/out to recommending and reserving perfect restaurants and organizing tours, they could not have been more gracious. The rooms were beautiful, especially the large and luxurious bathrooms, and 5th floor rooms have balconies. The lounge is also very comfortable and attractive with a lovely outdoor patio and pool area. I would recommend this jewel of a hotel to anyone heading to Vancouver, as its location, ammenities and staff are unbeatable. A wonderful find and great value, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great staff! Great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Keekeeseetah1
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a family reunion in Seattle, Vancouver and the Canadian Rockies. In Vancouver we stayed at L´Hermitage and we loved it. We had 4 rooms (we are a big family) - 2 Signature Rooms, 1 One Bedroom and 1 Boutique. All rooms are different and I honestly think that the best rooms are the One Bedrooms and the Boutiques. The Signatures have a small kitchen, a washing and a drying machine - but unless you are going to spend a long time there or you have small children that require clothes to be washed constantly, I do not recommend paying extra for these. The rooms on the 5th floor are the best - most of them have a private terrace, that rooms on floors 6 and 7 don´t. The brekfast is really good and they serve it in their L´Orangerie restaurant which has a very comfortable and cozy terrace. The girls that work in the restaurant are very sweet and attentive. There is also a pool and a hot tub on the terrace, really good to relax after walking or riding a bike in Stanley Park. Christopher who works in the front desk is wonderful, he took care of us, and made sure we got everything we needed. The General Manager and the Director of Operations are also very attentive, nice and professional. We were impressed by the excellent overall service of the hotel. It is a small, boutique, attentive hotel located in dowtown Vancouver. We hope to come back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: HKSchwarzys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at L'Hermitage for four nights in July. Was incredibly lucky to find it since I was booking last minute. While it wasn't an absolutely perfect stay (jacuzzi didn't work a couple of days, and had some delays checking in and out), it was pretty darn close. The staff is incredibly helpful, friendly and responsive. Rooms are huge and have large outdoor sitting areas. Everything in the hotel feels new and clean. You can tell that the staff likes to work there and cares about whether the guests have a good visit. Both the room itself and breakfast (ate breakfast in the hotel 3 mornings out of 4) were great values, especially since kids eat free. We used the pool and the jacuzzi every day. Even though the hotel was full, it never seemed busy or crowded. None of the other hotels in a comparable price range looked appealing at all, and this place was a real gem. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable oasis in Vancouver downtown”
Reviews.Author: JohanDB
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this extraordinary nice hotel which is situated in an excellent spot in downtown Vancouver. I booked the hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews and I can now confirm that these are indeed correct! What we especially liked very much that we could sit outside at our own private screened-off mini-patio with green plants (room 551). Because our room was on the back-side of the hotel, we were mostly screened from the city traffic noises and it felt like a true oasis! For the rest: it is a very comfortable hotel, the people do their utmost best to make you feel at home. Whole-heartedly recommended! Also for kids with families as the hotel as sunny and open-air swimming pool. On the 5th floor!

Reviews.Title: “I loved the ambience, the great Service and the perfect breakfast. I highly recommend staying at this beautiful Downotow”
Reviews.Author: kenalter
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Vancouver and want a small downtown hotel with Fantastic Service and a European flavor, stay at L'Hermitage.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: moonlighttravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is Vancouver's best kept secret. It is a perfect hotel, situated near robson for all of your shopping needs, the hotel is also within walking distance of the waterfront and Yaletown. The staff is very friendly, especially the women who work in the hotel's breakfast room. The hotel room is well laid out and very clean. It is also handy having a full kitchen to use. Parking is also a plus being $25 a day, whereas most hotels in Vancouver charge over $40. This hotel cannot be missed, it may be farther up robson then most hotels but it offers a great value for money, while still being central to all of what Vancouver offers.

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss this perfect gem of a hotel in beautiful downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Lynn55711
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 25th anniversary in this lovely hotel in beautiful downtown Vancouver. The staff was superb with special details given to the turn down service each evening. We stayed in the King Signature suite and it was pure luxury. Kitchen had nice appliances and modern appointments. We cooked breakfast everyday and fixed a small dinner each evening. The IGA grocery store is a block away which was quite convenient. Bathroom was a little small, but the bedroom, kitchen and seating area was more than adequate. The king bed was heavenly and we can't recall a better night's sleep. We were blown away by the over courteous staff and concierge Raymond. Extremely helpful and gave perfect directions to anywhere we wished to trek off to. We were personally greeted each time we entered the lobby. Everyone there made sure our every need was met. We fell in love with Vancouver and will return to L'Hermitage hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NIce place”
Reviews.Author: dedempsy
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in the center of Vancouver. The room was beautiful. Parking is expensive $25, but all the hotels charge it. Staff was super friendly. An IGA grocery store is right beside the hotel. Good bagels. We had a corner room on the 5th floor. The living room was a little loud due to traffic noise. Bedroom was queit though.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Randyhanson
Reviews.Content: We were supposed to stay 3 nights but our plane was delayed and only could stay 2. I wish we could have stayed all three as this hotel was very clean, the service was outstanding, the rooms were spacious, and the hotels french bulldog was pretty cool! I would highly recommend this hotel while staying in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: mika0805
Reviews.Content: clean, stylish and updated 1 bedroom modern kitchen great service - received a complimentary upgrade

Reviews.Title: “L'HERITAGE HOTEL, VANCOUVER, BC CANADA”
Reviews.Author: 155019Lovetotravel
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience during our 5-night stay at L'hermitae. The staff were courteous, incredibly helpful and knowledgeable in all areas. The room was superb and breakfast each day included croissant from France - absolutely delicious. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to our family and friends. It's a 10 as far as we are concerned. There is no full service restaurant as yet, but this will change by the end of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: LoisOttawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be the best value in Vancouver. We found it on Tripadvisor, and it was everything we expected and more. We had a one bedroom suite, with a fully equipped kitchen, including dishwasher, washer and dryer ($247 including tax). After 4 nights on the train from Toronto, we really appreciated the ability to do our laundry. We could have cooked complete meals, but chose to make our own breakfast, the odd lunch and had the occasional glass of wine. There is a corner grocery store, and a private liquor store nearby, but beware--the markup is about double the BC liquor store price. Staff were very attentive and helpful. We preferred a regular coffee maker rather than the espresso machine that was in the kitchen, and one was provided within minutes. Front desk staff were quick to offer suggestions, book a taxi, or give directions. We like to walk and found the location to be perfect. Minutes from Robson, 20 minutes from Stanley Park, less to Gastown and 10 min. to Yaletown restaurants (try The Bluewater Cafe). All in all, I can't say enough about this place. Next time we are in Vancouver, we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at L'Hermitage”
Reviews.Author: BigC_19
Reviews.Content: Fantastic boutique hotel with the little things you expect from a larger chain hotel but often don't get. The room was clean and spacious and the staff friendly. We didn't have a room with a kitchenette, but ours was still very large. We had a private balcony which is such a bonus in a big city - meant we could open up the door and let in some fresh air. Location good - central to city (Robson Street) and waterfront. Loved the free wi-fi in the room. Fantastic value - we payed $CAD 185 per night plus tax. It was no problem to shorten our stay upon arrival (without penalty) as our plans changed and we decided to venture on to Whistler for a few nights. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LPLG09
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Excellent in every single aspect. Staff is great, helpful and nice, our room was great (looked even better and cozier than in the website), and location is fantastic. We stayed here for a week and throughout our stay excellence was consistent.

Reviews.Title: “Good apartment style accomodation”
Reviews.Author: austraveller007
Reviews.Content: This is a new property so the apartment was spotless. Security is good - manned 24 hours and you need to insert your keycard into the lift in order to access your floor. Reception always cheerful and willing to help. Apartment automatically cleaned although they did forget to replace my drinking glasses and jug, but that was rectified very quickly via a phone call to the front desk. Adequate towels, toiletries etc. supplied each day. Big plus - full kitchen with all applicable equipment and a washing machine and dryer as well. One extra nice touch was laundry detergent and dishwasing liquid, not alot but enough for all purposes. Also there is a supermarket next door with everything you could possibly need (if you wanted to cook) and a couple of Japanese places nearly if you don't. The hotel is in Yaletown so is close to other eating places if the above doesn't appeal. We loved the place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: syd_matt
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel - near new, small boutique style, great rooms more like small apartments with full kitchens. Fantastic pool and sun deck. Not a gripe, but you should know this hotel does not have room service - wasn't an issue for me, but may be for some travellers. great location - close to everything! Really reasonably priced compared to the other hotel i stayed in during my stay in Vanvouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel close to all amenities”
Reviews.Author: DaffyWorcester
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights here and would highly recommend. Large room with balcony with table and chairs and large ensuite with seperate wc and seperate shower. Very comfortable large bed. Down side was the view which was across the street and of a multi storey carpark. Breakfast was usual continental and of good standard, but we also found it cheaper to eat breakfast elsewhere. Swiming pool and hot tub on the roof. Staff polite and friendly. However 2 requests - 1 for ice to be sent up and 1 for towels to be replenished at the poolside - were not forthcoming. Overall however an extremely enjoyable stay. Recommend whale watching from victoria as a must and also a trip to the Capolino suspension bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Most professional staff out there!!”
Reviews.Author: pbaker2025
Reviews.Content: L'hermitage made our family stay in Vancouver such a pleasure. Located close to downtown and all the attractions, the staff could not do enough to make our stay so enjoyable. From Tunc on the door to Amy at reception - awesome staff. Well worth staying. Thank you all very much!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: NinaandBen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in May. We arrived by car earlier than the 4pm check in time. The staff were very helpful in storing our luggage and then providing a map and detailed directions of how to get to the airport to drop off our hire car, and how to return back to the hotel via the Sky Train. Check in was straightforward and we were provided the security code to access the free wifi. We had booked a one bedroom boutique suite. The rooms were stunning. Lots of space with high quality fixtures and fittings. The bathroom was amazing with marble fixtures, separate deep bath and shower cubicle and robes were provided. The bedroom had an ipod dock and a tv, as well as there being a tv in the living room. The bed was very comfortable. The room was spotlessly clean. The location of the hotel was perfect. Very central. Robson Street is one block away. It was easy to walk to restaurants and shops. Overall, we had a fantastic stay at L'Hermitage. It is pricier than other hotels, but it is worth it if you are looking for somewhere luxurious to stay whilst in the city.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Home Away From Home in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: EDM_Stowaway
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed four nights at this great downtown Vancouver hotel and loved it. I stayed in a King Boutique room. The room had a comfortable full king bed, a small sitting area and a functional natural gas fireplace. There was ample room, even in this studio layout. The bathroom was behind double French doors, appointed in marble and stainless steel sculptural fixtures. There is a separate water closet, soaking bath and shower stall. If you're into hotel bathrooms, this one is one of the better ones. There is also a minifridge, in room laptop sized safe, ironing board and iron, bathrobes (slippers on request), a Nespresso machine, and a flat screen lcd tv with full satellite access. The hotel also has suites with full gourment kitchens: granite counters, Bosch appliances and a Subzero fridge. It may be a better kitchen than the one you left at home. Amenities include a breakfast room and well appointed guest lounge, a small but well equipped 24 hour gym, a sauna and steamroom, and an outdoor heated salt water lap pool on a 5th floor terrace. WiFi is free! Service is friendly and fast. The concierge desk is Clef's D'Or affiliated so they can get you anything, even at your next destination. The location cannot be beat. It's a block to the Vancouver Library and Library Square, two blocks from Granville, three block to downtown centre/Vancouver Art Gallery and Yaletown in the other direction, and it sits on Robson. There is an IGA Market Garden grocery on the corner (H-mart Korean grocery is a block away), next to a Tim Hortons; you cross Robson for Starbucks. The neighbourhood is full of pubs and restaurant choices from take away to sit down including Japadog. The bars, clubs and venues of Granville are a block up Robson. Although the rack rate is high, you can easily get a deal thorough Expedia, Hotel.com, Hotelclub or Orbitz. It's well worth the stay. While I am a Fairmont Premium President's Club member, and there are four great Fairmonts in Vancouver, this has become my favorite Vancouver hotel. You can't beat the room, the included amenities, location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, wonderful customer service”
Reviews.Author: CourtKel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a friend's bachlorette party. First off the rooms are very stylish apartments so for 3 ladies hoping to have a great weekend, it was perfect! Our full kitchen with beautiful appliances was totally put to use many time and the outdoor hot tub was fun to hang out at when it was raining. The best part of this hotel was the staff. They greeted me by name when I entered the hotel and then suggested an excellent choice for dinner. We were treated like queens the entire time we were staying at the hotel. Hunter at the concierge desk was especially helpful with getting us hard to obtain reservations. I have never seen a hotel with such friendly and helpful staff members. The entire weekend was so fun and perfect and our choice of hotel was the main reason why. From now on everytime I visit Vancouver I will stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: flychick129
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located on Richards and Robson Streets - easy walking distance to most of the city. City buses very close by for easy transportation - can buy day passes at the 7-eleven around the corner. IGA supermarket on the corner open very late if need food/snacks. Hotel is three floors in a private luxury residence building. Room was spacious, gas fireplace, balcony and the bathroom was beautiful. Very well sealed when balcony doors closed - heard little to no street noise. Bed very comfortable and rooms very clean and well maintained. Front desk staff and concierge were extremely helpful. No restaurant on site but believe they are opening one in next few months. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior hotel and wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: 1WagMore-BarkLess
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage is a rather new hotel that shares a building with condos. The staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful. The room was very plush and had its own balcony with a table and 4 chairs. It had a fireplace (didn't try it) and a refrigerator. At the corner is an IGA store that carries delightful treats. Across the street from the IGA is a Starbucks. The decor was contemporary. The bed was comfortable. The location was superb. Best of all- it was spotless !

Reviews.Title: “A real home base”
Reviews.Author: One_Woman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay if you want to feel like you are living in the heart of downtown Vancouver. There isn't much of a view as it's completely centrally located (between buildings), but it is modern, luxurious, and without room service or a restaurant onsite it forces you out into the city to experience it more like a real person and less like a tourist. There are dozens of restaurant options nearby, and a grocery store and liquor store just at the end of the block that are easily found and that both have a wide selection. There's no need for a car - two blocks from the SkyTrain and just off of Robson Street it's easy to grab a taxi or hop a bus, and everything downtown is close enough to walk to in under 30 minutes - even Granville Island and the aquarium! The staff were very friendly and non-invasive, adding to the feeling that this was MY place. I kept the 'Do Not Disturb' sign on almost the whole time and yet every time after returning from my adventures no matter how long I had been gone for, my room had been picked up and tidied, with appropriate lighting for whatever time of day it was. The fireplace in the room is flame and heat-less, and very enjoyable at nighttime with the screen-less windows open to waft the smell of rain in to combine with the cozy and modern living area. I had a wonderful experience here - no surprises or let-downs at all except that my iPhone wasn't compatible with the iPod docking station so I couldn't play my own music - easily remedied by the fact that their satellite TV had over 40 music stations for me to choose from. I will absolutely be returning to stay in this hotel on future visits to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandinmyveins
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days in a 1 bedroom suite - included a kitchen and a fireplace. Room was very clean when we arrived and kept that way on a daily basis. Maids would wash any dishes and replace the Nespresso Pkgs (some place will charge for this) at no charge. Large balcony overlooking Richards, and plenty of light entering the room. Very spacious room and a great price - don't even dream about getting something like this in NYC. Staff was helpful and polite, directing us to great restaurants and sightseeing. Small gym, continental breakfast (well priced) and a saltwater lap pool. No 24 hr restaurant - but not expected - open late IGA on same corner. Will stay here going forward for all Vancouver trips. Pet friendly but you wouldn't know it by the cleanliness of the rooms (we also had a friend in a smaller room) - also great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Superb”
Reviews.Author: Medhatbear
Reviews.Content: The nicest hotel stay I've encountered. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly in a nonintrusive way. The hotel is bright, new and appoints in the room were modern The room was extremely clean and very large. The bathroom was heaven with a soaker but and separate shower. Lots of towels and extra'.........in the bathing area. Now this has limited amenities.... no restaurant as it si part of a condominium complex. Interesting I only stayed here two night and instantly wish I had stayed more after I booked in at the famous Sylvia Hotel....what a disappointment after this wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ebintulsa
Reviews.Content: Was our first trip to Vancouver. We could not have made a better choice then staying at L'Hermitage. The staff was great and the room was amazing. We walked to almost all activities that we had planned. We can't wait to get back again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvcruising
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on Priceline because it was close to where we were going to a show and it WOWWED us. For the price I don't think any other hotel in downtown Vancouver can beat it. The "rooms" are actually a good sized condo!! We had booked a boutique king room but they "upgraded" us to a solarium ROOM! It wasn't just a room. There was a full kitchen including a full size fridge, stove, microwave, and dishwasher. It had a dining room table and 4 chairs as well as a gas fireplace. There was even a stacked washer & dryer in one of the closets!! The huge king sized bed was the most comfortable I've found in a hotel. This was the first time we've stayed downtown in any large city and not heard sirens & traffic noise all night. I guess you get the picture - I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great room at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “great room, good location”
Reviews.Author: vacationbarb
Reviews.Content: A really nice boutique hotel. Enjoyed the hot tub and pool, Extremely friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “You will not regret this choice !”
Reviews.Author: hawaiiportland
Reviews.Content: I am very very hard to please. I look and search and check and check to try to find just the perfect spot wherever it is that I am going. This was a Great Choice! Very surprising. I loved the Boutique Suite. Great bed, perfect linens and pillow choices (and lots of them). They changed the linen everyday, but of course if you prefer for them not to, I am sure they would accommodate. I loved the marble bathrooms, fully equiped with all that I needed and more. Lots of room, luxury right down to the towels. The breakfast were over the top, and delicious, but pricie (worth every dime, but if your on a budget you might check that part out before you eat). Other than that the location was perfect, the rooms met and exceded our expectations and the service was wonderful. You cannot make a mistake by staying here. I will again and again. Happy journies.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location, service and value”
Reviews.Author: sbeisler
Reviews.Content: Our 1 Room suite was huge. The living room had a sofa, 2 chairs, table and chairs, fireplace and flat screen TV. There was a wet bar with small refrigerator. The bedroom had a huge king size bed with another large chair and desk. The bathroom was beautiful, marble walk in shower and large tub, with separate toilet. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was excellent. Robson street is 10 steps away. The City Centre area which has all of the shopping and restaurants was 2 blocks away. There is no restaurant or room service because this is a boutique hotel, but the IGA grocery downstairs had everything you could want. I thought the price was excellent for a suite like this right in the center of everything. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: czieli
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hermitage for three nights at the end of our ski trip in Whistler. While there was absolutely no fault with our room (one bedroom boutique suite with a beautiful big bathroom) or the excellent personal service provided by the Lobby and concierge staff (such as restaurant and sightseeing recommendations, taxi bookings) this hotel is new and unfortunately doesn't currently have a restaurant or bar. We understand this is likely to change in 2010. In addition, note that the outdoor lap pool and jacuzzi access is through the gym and with no slippers being provided to guests you need to be prepared to walk barefeet in the winter to benefit from this facility. However, the hotel is in a good downtown location, with easy access to all the major sightseeing Vancouver has to offer, and minutes from Robson Street - perfect for teenagers needing a retail fix!

Reviews.Title: “Great value with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: kjbradshaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one evening before heading out to Whistler. Though we arrived after midnight, the staff on hand was excellent and very accomodating. The concierge was very helpful in making lunch recommendations, and we couldn't have asked for better service overall. The rooms were nicely appointed, though a little small. The bathrooms was definitely the highlight and very luxurious. The only real negative was the lack of a minibar, particularly since we got in late from a flight and there wasn't any room service available.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SuPaul
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Roomy lovely hotel with a sitting room, nice location, fantastic bathroom. Above all, the staff is courteous and warm. Vancouver is a nice enough city, but it was the hotel that made it so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: vacations4us2
Reviews.Content: Huge, spotless room with impressive bathroom. Great location, we walked everywhere we needed to go. We will be back next time we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: fettuchi
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect stay in Vancouver - my only wish is that it were a little longer. The room was very plush and comfortable. The bathroom was huge with a separate shower and tub and toilet in its own separate space. The room was unbelievably comfortable. It had a great fireplace and balcony. The alarm had an IPOD dock. The bed was one of my favorite parts because it was big and super comfy. The public space was very nice. The library was much appreciated and felt very plush. Even the hallways felt incredibly plush. On top of all this the location was perfect. We brought our car but never used it till our last day. We were able to walk around everywhere from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish base to visit Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Phileas_Fogg1
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at L'Hermitage we were upgraded to one bedroom premium queen - basically, a one bedroom apartment with lounge, full kitchen, sun room, bedroom with walk in wardrobe, marble bathroom with separate shower and bath and a utility closet with washer and tumble-dryer. Our package did not include breakfast, although a very pleasant residents lounge and dining room (for breakfast only) is available. A well appointed gym and outdoor swimming pool is also available, but these are shared with the residents of the apartments set above the hotel. When we were caught out by a wet and windy day in downtown we happily dried out our clothes and spent half a day being self sufficient in the room. Everything is within easy walking distance (Stanley park - 25 to 30 minutes up Robson Street) and a well stock supermarket can be found at the corner of the hotel. The service and the quality of the room made us feel very special at the beginning of our holiday. the only downside is that traffic noise from the streets below could be heard quite easily and, as it is in the heart of downtown, traffic was present throughout the night.

Reviews.Title: “L'Hermitage great choice but”
Reviews.Author: bellaherna
Reviews.Content: We recently visited Vancouver in September and stayed at the L'Hermitage Hotel. It was in a very good location. The decor was very modern and odd here and there but nice for most part. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Great price for what you get in the room. We had a Queen suite which came with a full kitchen, small stack washer/dryer. While the room was spacious the bedroom was not and the bathroom had NO counterspace and it was in the main area so it was a little odd, I felt there we as lot of wasted space that could have been better utilized for the bathroom Nevertheless, it was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Well Appointed, Kitchen and Washer/Dryer”
Reviews.Author: tugger77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days the first week of August on our first trip to Vancouver. We had a suite with king bed and pull-out sofa. This works well for us when we travel with our teenage son. The hotel had been totally renovated prior to opening 1 year ago. There are also some apartments in some other floors of the building as well. The bedroom and living (seating) area are not large, but were comfortable. We did not expect the kitchen area to be as large as it was. It had high end appliances and just the right amount of white dishes - very clean and European. We don't eat large breakfasts, so it was perfect for coffee, pastries and fruit in the mornings. We would put dishes in the dishwasher and housekeeping would wash them, which was also convenient. One thing we didn't expect which was great was a stack washer/dryer. Since we were at the beginning of our trip and did a lot of active things in and around Vancouver, we washed everything before we left, which was incredibly convenient. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug2080
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on location and visual appeal and it lived up to my expectations and more. The Concierge was SO knowledgeable in regards to selection of restaurants throughout the city. He was able to assist in booking and getting us a great table at Glowbal restaurant a very trendy upscale restaurant. While there Robert Pattenson happened to be dining and we were merely tables away, a nice little added bonus! ;) Nite clubs are not far away...many pubs in the area as well. Our room was always clean and re-stocked (need I mention Acca Kappa spa products) with all amenities. The decor is great, very new furniture. It was a bit cool while we were there, however there is an out door hot tub and an outdoor pool that you could swim laps. Morning news paper delivered right to the door...I wasn't able to enjoy it all that much but a nice touch. Complimentary coffee and tea, which we took advantage of one evening. State of the art onsite fitness studio...I never got a chance to check this out, but sounded great. Add to all that complimentary internet access, the perfect spot if you are on a business trip, as they have a library where you can get away to do work. The location was just perfect, walking distance to shopping on Robson and the Pan Pacific Conference center which we were able to walk to to attend our seminars. We actually walked from Kitsilano after having an amazing brunch at DB Bistro Modern..could hardly walk we were so full, but did not take long to get back to the hotel if you don't mind walking...I think about an hour. Overall would definitely recommend and would LOVE to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: angies-eye-patch
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in early September. The hotel is conveniently located in the centre of downtown Vancouver, just around the corner from Robson Street and about a 10 minute walk from Canada Place. Public transport is available nearby and there is a pub across the street and a supermarket at the end of the block. We had a studio room with a fire place and the room was large and bright. The bed was so comfortable and the room had a large flat screen TV, radio alarm with ipod dock, small refridgerator and an ample sized bathroom with seperate toilet, bath and shower. Every evening between 5 and 7 the hotel staff come and turn down the bed. On a couple of occasions we were left a complimentary lip balm and pillow spray. The reception desk is staffed 24 hours a day and the staff were extremely helpful. They called cabs for us, changed travellers cheques, sold stamps and found us a sewing kit when we were in need of a needle and thread! We had access to high speed internet which was faultless.This really is a great hotel and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location. Touch of class yet affordable.”
Reviews.Author: Sunseekinggirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here on our first trip to Vancouver. L'Hermitage was a perfect base for us - it was perfectly located downtown as we could walk pretty much everywhere. The staff there were incredibly helpful, polite and always remembered who we were as we walked through reception every day so nice personal touch. The room was incredibly spacious, small touches of luxury. All at a reasonable price. Only negatives were the view we had of the car park opposite the hotel and the breakfast which was very expensive for what it was. However we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Foodie410
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 2 nights, very clean ( partner has allergies), and the rooms were elegant. It was a pleasure to stay there. Concierge was very helpful with tour and restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at L'hermitage”
Reviews.Author: BerkTraveler
Reviews.Content: I, along with my husband and pre-teen daughter, stayed 3 nights at L'Hermitage in downtown Vancouver. -- our first trip to this beautiful city. We had a king suite - living room with pull-out sofa, bedroom with king size bed; large bath and separate shower, wet bar and mini-fridge. Everything was deluxe about this hotel except for a) the price ($159/night) and b) the absence of room service. Room was beautifully decorated and appointed. We loved the fitness center and pool; my husband especially loved the steam room. Service was attentive w/o being intrusive. Yes, they charge $25/night for parking. But in hindsight, we didn't need the car except for our last day when we drove to Grouse Mountain. Otherwise we walked or taxi'd everywhere (Stanley Park, Granville Island, Yale Town, etc.) Vancouver has TERRIFIC food, so we really didn't miss the room service. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best, an unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: C.Mood
Reviews.Content: I've been stayed in many hotels around the world, even some grand hotels in Las Vegas, I should say this is one of the best hotel I ever experienced. It's clean, fancy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very smart, very friendly, very good”
Reviews.Author: wheredoyouwant2go
Reviews.Content: From the moment the doorman opened the door to let us in to the lobby, we knew we'd chosen the right place. A very smart boutique feel, backed with up professional, helpful and friendly staff. We had a king studio, which was very spacious and luxurious. We were able to walk to some great restaurants in Yaletown as well as the shopping around the main Robson Street. The reception and concierge staff were really helpful recommending restaurants, checking us onto our flights, printing driving instructions, etc. We were made to feel very welcome and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay- lived up to review rating”
Reviews.Author: m0nad
Reviews.Content: after reading a host of reviews here and hotels.com, my wife and i booked a 3 night stay and came away very pleased. everything was exactly as described in these reviews, nice/clean upscale boutique hotel in good location with helpful staff. would happily stay there again and recommend to others. was our first time to vancouver so don't have much to compare it to in that price range C$150ish/night for king bed but seemed more than reasonable relative to other options.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for either business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: itsbeeroclock
Reviews.Content: I had a short break of 4 days in Vancouver. This is a great place to stay. Very convenient for all the shops and retsurants of downtown, You can walk to most of the interesting areas of town.
