There is a bicycle hire place around the corner so I could take a bike ride around town and Stanley Park (recommened - it is a great bike ride all round the sea wall taking about 3 hours - great views !) . There is a very good supermarket and deli, and wine/liquor store litterally just round the corner. This is great because the rooms have excellent modern equipped kitchens so you can cook if you don't want to go out.. Nice balcony. The bedroom and living area are modern and spaciious.It's just like having a modern appartment all to yourself downtown but with the advantages of top class hotel service when you need it. The staff are knowlegable, friendly and helpful. The whole place has a chic modern feel to it. The outdoor pool and deck is a bonus - as it the free wireless internet which many other hotels charge for. Very pleased with absolutely everything and good value considering the many benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Leavingonajetplane21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a road trip to Canada and the northwest US. The location is wonderful - within walking distance to everything. There is a great (small) pool, nice European breakfast and gym. The building is a mix of hotel and condos and the hotel rooms are pleasantly big. Service is mixed. Seanna was a delight in answering all of our questions, but some of the other staff weren't as helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It was like having our own apartment in the city”
Reviews.Author: BethS0103
Reviews.Content: Given that we paid less than $200 for a suite with a gourmet kitchen, I'd have to say that L'Hermitage was well worth the money. Not having to eat out every night really saved us some money and there was a grocery store less than a block from the hotel. The rooms were beautifully decorated, and while perfectly comfortable, the color palate felt a bit cold and uninviting at times. But that's really just nitpicking. The pool was an absolute oasis and was nice to relax there after a day of sightseeing. Another thing that made the room a value was the free high speed internet. Many hotels charge exorbitant fees for this luxury and L'Hermitage gives it free for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place, great service”
Reviews.Author: Lilylady50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this great hotel for 2 nights on our trip through Canada. We had booked trough internet with good rate for luxury 1 bedroom suite, and were given an update to even more luxurious suite, with 2 bathrooms, balcony, study and lovely kitchen. The hotel is right off Robson street, and within walking dinstance of all the Vancouver centre highlites. Great service (they even clean up your kitchen and put your stuff in the dishwasher). We were slightly worried about the parking issues that were raised on Tripadvisor, but they proved needless! There is great valetparking service (same price as self-parking) and your car is in a seperate section behind gates, so nothing to worry about! There is a lovely swimmingpool with hot-tub on a roof terrace and a marketplace just around the corner with fresh bread etc. If we ever return to the lovely city of vancouver we would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the positive reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Travel425
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay and loved every minute of it. We've stayed at many different hotels on weekend getaways from Seattle and we've finally found one that we would love to stay at again! The location is perfect - you can walk to Robson or Yaletown easily. More impressive though was the hotel itself. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had a problem with our first room (the air conditioning unit vibrated loudly) and the staff helped us find a new one quickly. The outdoor spaces were wonderful (ask for a room on the pool side) and because it is a small hotel, easily accessible. Can't comment on the food as we didn't eat breakfast at the hotel and will say that during our stay valet parking was unnecessary as we found parking on the street plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous,up-scale,boutique hotel in heart of Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: GypsyOntari0
Reviews.Content: From the time you are ushered into this lovely,luxurious hotel in Vancouver, 'til you leave,the friendly,courteous staff treat you as one of the family. The joy of being in a smaller hotel is the personalized service at every level. There are no "hordes" of people rushing to get an elevator or pushing you out of the way to get a luggage cart,etc. The lovely, decorated ,marble lobby,along with the helpful, friendly staff treats every guest as someone special. We explained that we were leaving in a couple of days on an Alaskan cruise. We were offered ideas ,brochures and suggestions for sight-seeing trips. In fact, we signed up and cancelled a trip twice and the young lady at the front desk who helped us,never lost her smile.We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as we felt it was too expensive. However, there was a restaurant and lovely patio bar across the street and a "boutique" IGA on the street level with a deli,coffee,tea and breakfast "sandwiches". There were tables and chairs on Robson street to sit and people-watch. The hotel has a lovely rooftop heated pool and spa outside a well-decorated lounge on the fifth floor. The rooftop also had a number of potted trees,statues,tables and chairs. Our room had patio doors opening out to a private,tree-surrounded patio. A great place to sip a glass of wine and re-live the day's adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Great Service - Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: islandcharly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 2 night stay here. We bused from Horseshoe Bay and got off literally a half block from the hotel (West Georgia & Seymore). The check-in was very smooth and quick and we were upgraded (no charge) to a deluxe studio because the studio we had booked was not quite clean yet. Nice touch! I would like to say that the elevators are probably the quickest ones we have EVER used! The room was immaculate and spacious. There was a fireplace, but too warm to give that a whirl this time. The front desk staff & conceirge were MOST accommodating. Raymond at the front helped us a few times by booking a Grouse Mountain Tour for us and finding out bus times/locations for our departure. The location of the hotel is perfect! A five minute walk to BC Place, a block to the Robson Street shopping & restaurants galore! It was a bit of a hike, but we walked from the hotel to the Seawalk down by Canada Place and then the whole way around the Seawalk through Stanley Park and back to the hotel. It was a beautiful day but by the end, we were pretty exhausted! The Kingston Grill directly across the street was very nice and also recommended by hotel staff. It was a 'perfect' location for our tired feet. It is a bit 'pub-ish' but exactly what we wanted. Had good service and great food. We sat outside upstairs, which was very nice. Overall, our experience at the L'Hermitage was an outstanding hotel that we will most definitely return to, as well as recommend it to our friends & family!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value For The Money EVER”
Reviews.Author: goodtripsarebest
Reviews.Content: This is the best value in a hotel room I've ever had anywhere. Not only was the room the best room I've ever had, even compared to other fine hotels I've stayed in, it is by far the best value. I broke my review into key points, so you can focus on whatever interests you. Booking the room: I did this on Expedia and it was so easy. The rate was really great ($120), especially compared to Whistler, BC, where I just spent a foretune and got nickeled and dimed for so many things, and it really felt like I was paying extra for every tiny thing. Getting there and the neighborhood: It is in a nice neighborhood with restaurants and just off of the intersection, easy to get to. The building seems to have condos and hotel rooms. The sign is kind of hidden, so keep your eyes open and look carefully for it. There is an IGA grocery right on the corner about a block down. It is an easy 10 minute walk to a Japadog stand and downtown. There are bus lines close by and just lots of people walking around in this area. Room: We had a suite with a king sized bed, bathroom with garden tub and shower and separate toilet, wet bar, separate living area, outdoor patio with a nice view of the street and two tvs. Although there was a kitchen-sized sink and a mini fridge in the wet bar, there really wasn't a kitchen set up at all, but we didn't request one. I'm not sure if other rooms have a kitchen. They had premium cable with two HBO channels and lots of movie channels. They also had a 99 cent pay per movie option. The room was spotlessly clean with plenty of towels, extra pillows and blankets and newish furniture. There were three closets in the room, the most I have ever seen in a hotel room. The view onto the street was great and made for nice people watching. There is also a dining room table with four chairs where we could eat or work on the computer and watch tv or look out the wall to wall windows onto the street below. The only thing I wish they had more of were electrical outlets, but my hotel in Whistler had the same scarcity of outlets, too. Pool, Hot Tub, Steam Room, Gym and Lounge: I just looked at these but ran out of time to go swimming. The pool and hot tub are outdoor, but they are heated. They looked very clean and there were plenty of towels stacked nearby. They said they have a steam room and locker room, but I didn't have time to check it out. The gym equipment seemed pretty new and up to date. They had everything, including elliptical, treadmill, weights, etc. The lounge is large and on the fifth floor behind a locked door, as was the pool and hot tub, so the security seems pretty solid there. It has wifi, a fireplace, ice water, apples and comfy chairs and tables where you can work. That is also were they do breakfast. Other Stuff: The wifi in the room was free, but a little slow sometimes. Free premium cable. Not sure if parking costs extra, but I imagine it does, because it seems like I saw signs for parking prices everywhere in the neighborhood. You might want to check on that if that's important to you. The breakfast came with the room, but I didn't try it. Service: The front desk has someone there 24/7 and although they don't make you use your card to get into the elevator, the security seems ok. The staff was wonderful. They helped us find Japadog and suggested so many fun things to do around town. They also helped us look up ticket prices for activities around town. When we decided to extend our stay a little longer, they let us book a half day extension over the phone while we were out on the town, which was very nice. I would have definitely stayed longer if given the chance and will definitely return here the next time I'm in Vancouver. This one is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever! Would defintely return!”
Reviews.Author: mrfitness
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have traveled all over the world to many cities in many countries, and both of us agree that none pale in comparison to L'Hermitage! We have nothing but praises about our stay. A 5 out of 5 rating no doubt! Why this hotel is rated #20 popularity (as of June 18/09) is beyond me...it should be in the top 3 for sure. Don't let the #20 fool you...I guess some people prefer to pay less for an average stay, or just prefer to stay at large hotel chains. We stayed for the long weekend in May 2009. Location: Right smack downtown in the middle of all that there is to do: shopping, eating, sight seeing...you can do many things within walking distance! Cleanliness: Cleaning staff did an amazing job keeping our room neat and tidy every day. Even the gym, pool, sauna and library was clean and tidy. Rooms: Very clean, modern, chic. Comfortable bed and couch. Lots of room for storing clothes, shoes, etc. Service: OUTSTANDING! Very friendly and knowledgeable. Not one single bad experience with any employee. They really helped make our stay an enjoyable one. Value: For what we paid and what we got, we have no complaints! To me, having a hotel stay that is free of worry, issues or problems, it is worth the money! Why save a few bucks and take a chance on a dirty room, unfriendly staff or lack of amenities? I guarantee you will not have any regrets booking and you will be confident that your stay will be an amazing one! We will defintely stay here again on our next visit, no question about it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff! Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: hSQU4RED
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say that I am really glad that we picked this hotel. The staff was wonderful. I called a night before we were supposed to arrive and requested champagne and a birthday cake for my husband. Craig, front desk staff, answered the phone and helped me pick a super tasty cake and a nice bottle of champagne. When we arrived, the champagne was chilling in the room next to a plate of chocolates. Later that evening, the staff delivered the cake. It was excellent. Thank you for making our trip fun and easy... oh... and romantic. The hotel is beautiful and our room was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Rural Lady
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff with knowledge of local attractions. Our room was very comfortable. As tea drinkers we would have preferred a hot water jug than the coffee perc. The air conditioning unit in the passage was rather noisy but didn't worry us once asleep. Wonderful comfortable bed. The breafast was pricey for what it was but the service was excellent. I liked the fact we could open the windows for fresh air. TV and Internet were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location but.WATCH YOUR CAR!”
Reviews.Author: shauby
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I found a last minute deal for L'Hermitage and based on the location, previous reviews and price decided to stay for a couple of nights. It's a great building with a very friendly staff (with the exception of the manager). The studio we stayed in was great; with a huge bathroom, balcony, WiFi etc. We had rented a car in Seattle and drove up so we paid $25 a day for valet parking below the hotel. The day we checked out we called down to have our car brought out. We checked out, waited outside for a 5 minutes and then went back in to see what was taking so long. Apparently there was a break in with our rental. The manager started rambling how they can't control the parking because a third party manages the garage, there are drug addicts who break into the lots of cars, when it's happened before people left expensive items in plain sight..basically he listed every possible excuse....all I wanted to do was to see my car. He takes me down to the garage which turns out to be very well lit and gated. Turns out my little Nissan Versa was absolutely fine but a Lexus and an SUV both had their driver side windows smashed in. They confused my economy rental with a luxury sedan because they were both white. The hotel was nice enough to refund our parking for the trouble and we were on our way. My concerns: 1. It may have been a while but this has clearly happened before, adding a surveillance camera or two could help deter this type of petty theft. They currently do 3 walk-throughs of the garage during the day/night but apparently it's not enough. 2. How dismissive the manager was of what happened. They had comp'd our stay and started listing off all theses excuses of how there was nothing they could do to prevent this before I had actually seen my car. 3. We didn't check out very early so had this actually been my car, when was someone going to tell us. We had already called down for the car, checked out, were waiting patiently outside and then had to go back in before anyone said anything. Thankfully it wasn't my car but that was a bad way to end off an otherwise great time in a beautiful city and in a great hotel. I do highly recommend the L'Hermitage for the rooms and amenities but please be careful with your cars if you do decide to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Fleetwood Mac overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: di2kids
Reviews.Content: Poor rating only for Noisy air conditioner compressor, Great hotel great location great staff, very noisy air conditioner in room 663, great hotel to stay at in the winter when its not needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms - good for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Littleminxy
Reviews.Content: What I enjoyed most about my stay was the bathtub - it was big enough to swim in almost! I stayed in a Studio King and it was quite roomy for one person. The windows opened, which was fantastic and the bed was very comfortable. I also appreciated the valet parking, although I never saw where the car was parked or who exactly was the valet attendant. What I found disappointing was the lady who was working the front desk in the evening. Compared to the two ladies who checked me in earlier in the afternoon, this employee I felt could use some help with customer service. First, I inquired about a good place to eat and she suggested a place about 7 blocks away. When I wondered about needing reservations she said she'd call over and find out what their wait time was and then ring my room. I never heard anything from her so I made arrangements to go somewhere else for dinner. (Griffins at the Fairmont Hotel was excellent!) Secondly, when I came back to the desk to advise them my schedule had changed and I wouldn't be staying for as long as I had anticipated, she ignored me for well over 5 minutes as she played with the dog who belonged to either residents or guests booked at the hotel. Working in tourism myself, a common courtesy would have been to acknowledge another guest and let them know you'll be with them in a moment. It doesn't take much. I was also disappointed that there was no doorman or bell hop, no assistance with luggage and the internet cable in the room was by the bed. Now maybe you could move the furniture and unplug the device and crawl under the desk to reinstall it, where it should have been, but after a long day of meetings, I shouldn't have to crawl around behind furniture to get an internet connection!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, good price, amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: cfiaschet
Reviews.Content: So my boyfriend and I were looking to stay in a nice hotel in Vancouver for a night. Something under $150 with a hot tub and pool, close to Gastown, Amsterdam cafe etc. and close to Robson so I could shop! L'Hermitage Hotel was perfect for this. I knew that no matter what us driving would add an extra $25 to the hotel tab because there is absolutely no parking in Vancouver. It was worth it though because we didn't need the car and the pool and hot tub made up for it. We also had breakfast at the hotel- which I like most Americans, assumed would be complimentary. I was wrong and it was an additional $30. This was OK too though. The food was great and we got to eat alone early in the morning. .Everyone was really nice and the hotel was really clean. The bathroom was big in our studio. They're still working out some kinks as it is a new hotel. (There was no On Demand or anything to buy movies off of the tv, which was fine). Honestly the whole trip was great. There is a really good bar/restaurant to check out across the street. I would do breakfast again, but maybe once if it was a longer trip, just to save money. We're already planning on next years trip!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: RainGirlNanaimo
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite and loved it. The sitting room was great, and we actually didn't mind the funny little electric fire. The bathroom fittings are luxurious. The location is perfect as we walked around Yaletown and Robson and then went into Gastown one evening. When we asked for a cab, we even got a ride to our restaurant courtesy of the hotel. One wonderful note, the manager, I think, Jean Paul has an adorable little french bulldog which we saw in the lobby. There's a nice continental brunch, but if you don't want to pay for that, there's a good IGA grocery store right around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing this place isnt more well known”
Reviews.Author: sgillett
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 2 nights while in Vancouver to sight see and watch a hockey game. Was in a perfect location downtown with secured and very private parking. Had a one bedroom corner unit that was absolutely beautiful. It was probably bigger then some peoples apartments. The bed was large and comfortable; the bathroom was huge and had a roomy standing shower as well as a bathtub. The only complaint I would have about the room was that the electric fireplace is a little tacky. The secured parking was great and since the location was so good we were able to walk everywhere. There is a pool that looked amazing that we didn’t get an opportunity to take advantage of that we Definetely will next time as we most certainly will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely L'Hermitage”
Reviews.Author: maxanddrew
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of making L’Hermitage our home base for our recent trip to Vancouver. On our first two nights in the city (before making the trek to Whistler), we had a deluxe king room and our last night in the city was spent in a standard studio king. The location of L’Hermitage was wonderful; nestled between Robson and Georgia streets. It is a $7 taxi ride from the Amtrak station. L’Hermitage has a courtesy car – a posh, luxe Mercedes Benz wagon – which was available to take us on two occasions to Granville Island and Stanley Park; eliminating the need for us to negotiate mass transit. The courtesy car was a great service that saved us time and potential hassles. We were able to walk everywhere else. Check-in was smooth and efficient. We had to check our luggage twice with the front desk; once because we arrived ahead of our room being ready and once after our final check-out before our late train back to Seattle. Both times our luggage was swiftly tagged and securely kept for us. The front desk personnel were helpful with our inquiries about dinner delivery options and directions to various stops on our itinerary. One staff member, Bobby, was particularly delightful with his warm welcome and his info on the city as he drove us to Granville Island. Both rooms we stayed in were a perfect blend of luxury and comfort. The king size bed was the most comfortable of all the hotels we booked, with soft linens and comfy duvet. The balcony, with its city side view, and the extra square footage in the deluxe room were nice touches, but we were perfectly happy with the standard king studio. We didn’t expect the king studio to have a fireplace like the king deluxe room. That was a nice surprise. The view from the standard king studio of the recently opened pool & terrace was lovely and tranquil. The bathrooms in both rooms appeared to be the same size, just laid out differently. The marble surfaces and beautiful fixtures were great touches. My only disappointment was with the towels and robes. The terry cloth was not as soft and plush as I was hoping. And the both towels were standard size; not true bath sheets like other hotels of this class. There is a small refrigerator in the credenza of each room. This held chilled glasses and a bottle opener/corkscrew. The attached condo complex also holds an IGA grocery store which was very handy for purchasing beverages and snacks. We found ourselves grabbing drinks from the IGA and ordering dinner in on two occasions after a long day out in the city because the rooms were so comfortable and relaxing. We didn’t want to leave! We stopped in at the continental breakfast on the 5th floor for coffee to go and were amazed at the variety and quality of the items available. I can imagine that enjoying breakfast in the dining room would be a beautiful (and economical) way to start your morning in the city. The workout room featured state-of-the-art equipment and the adjacent changing facilities were a nicely furnished. I agree with other reviewers that the hotel needs to either move the existing internet connection, add another line, or go wireless in each room. The complimentary wired connection was super fast but oddly located on the nightstand. We had no problems with this as we were surfing casually for info on the city while laying on the bed, but this set-up would not work for business travelers. I also agree that the air conditioning in each room is louder than it should be. The vent is located above the door in the hall and I’m sure the hard surfaces in that section help accentuate the noise. However, given the high temperatures during our stay, I’m very glad we were in a hotel with a/c. There was no issue with noise from nearby rooms or outside. It was a very quiet stay despite the hotel being nearly full. I highly recommend L’Hermitage for anyone looking for a comfortable, luxurious hotel without the pretense. If we are fortunate to find ourselves in Vancouver again, we would not hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Viajera1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed at L'Hermitage in Aug. 2008, just two months after it opened. It is a very sleek, modern hotel in a great location in downtown Vancouver. Because it was so new, the staff seemed to still be figuring things out. For example, we weren't able to check into our room the first night for over an hour after the guaranteed check-in time. To make up for this, the staff comped a round of drinks for us at their wonderful guest lounge on the 5th floor. The website did not do this place justice .... there's a beautiful rooftop pool and hot tub and the rooms are large and luxuorious. Very nice breakfast and afternoon h'or doeurve buffets are included in the price. The staff was very friendly and made sure that all of our needs were met. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be pampered in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of extra touches, gorgeous rooms”
Reviews.Author: Eire77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights in this fabulous hotel which is located on Richards St and Robson...really central for downtown and cycling distance to Stanly Park. The hotel opened 6 weeks ago but there is already running like clockwork. The staff are friendly and very helpful. Our room was spacious and luxurious...incredible bathroom, LCD TV. Continental breakfast was included which was a nice surprise. There were lots of additional touches such as complimentray Hors D'Ouvres every evening in the 5th floor bar, a turn-down service and suprise gift each evening and a complimentary shuttle to the bus station on departure. There is a lap pool and fitness centre. I would definitely stay here again, good value for Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful interior”
Reviews.Author: luckywilbury
Reviews.Content: Hotel was only recently opened when we stayed and were obviously still finding their feet, but excellent service, beautiful interior (rooms and general spaces eg lobby and restaurant), and good business services. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: intbc
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this lovely hotel. Our room was tastefully decorated, spotless, and quiet. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and more than expected. The dining area where the breakfast is offered is a lovely setting. The hotel is very conveniently located in a great area of Vancouver close to super shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not safe and management does not care”
Reviews.Author: MikeFromCanmore
Reviews.Content: We travel to Vancouver twice a year and we like to have more room and amenities than what hotel rooms can offer. So, we usually rent a private apartment from people who advertise on vacation rental web sites. On our last visit, we rented a one-bedroom suite at L’Hermitage, a new building that combines a boutique hotel, private residences and many shops. It is well located in the heart of downtown and offers a four level underground secured parking garage. The first two levels are for the hotel patrons and shoppers while the lower levels are reserved for the residents. The building is managed by Stratawest Management Ltd., a company that boasts providing the highest level of service to a select portfolio of quality developments. Upon our arrival on the Thursday afternoon, there was an “Important notice” posted near the elevators warning the residents about the recent car break-ins in the underground parkade and that, on a temporary basis, security had been appointed to patrol parking levels P1 to P4 on a 24 hour basis. This important notice was nowhere to be found the next day; management had requested its removal. On Saturday afternoon, we discovered that our car had been vandalized and that the driver’s car window was shattered. More than eighteen hours after this infraction, no one from security or the concierge services had bothered communicating with us. Based on the police report, three cars had been broken into during the previous evening and it was further established that the doors to the garage stairwells were kept unlocked allowing free access to anyone. Downtown Vancouver is reputed for its homeless citizens and underground garage break-ins. How could a manager be so negligent as to leaving the doors of the building wide open to any criminal opportunity? The concierge personnel, the only building representatives on site, were considerate to our demise but not forthcoming with help to clean the mess and organise speedy repairs. Later communication with Stratawest Management proved futile in obtaining resolution for our losses. Their best advice: Contact your insurance provider. So much for our deductible! For this, we rate L’Hermitage in downtown Vancouver a big fat 0 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ceegee59
Reviews.Content: L'Hermitage Hotel is one of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at. Our room was very clean and modern as was the whole hotel. The staff were fantastic helping us with any questions we had about Vancouver. They went above and beyond the call of duty to make our stay relaxing and enjoyable. From the moment we stepped into the L'Hermitage we were impressed. We would highly recommend it! Gregoraschuk Family

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ShrimpBucket
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Excellent staff. I'm right now at a one bedroom suite. It has a small but cozy bedroom with a marvelous bed and very fine linen. We have a living room with a quality sofabed for my young kids (2) a big desk with very fast wired connection and a sink with a fridge and a coffee maker with high quality coffee. The bathroom is BIG with independent shower, tub, sink and W.C. very confortable for a family because you can use simtaneously different bathroom facilities. The hotel is minimalistic with many details that show quality (the walls, the marble, the big closets, etc) Location has been quite confortable for us, we've been to all the tourist attractions (Victoria, Grouse Mountain, Stanley park, etc) We´re sourranded by restaurants, cafes and boutiques. At night you have your bed turn over with delicious chocolate and they leave a soft light with music. The breakfast is very simple: yogurth, pastries, bread some fruit, enough to start your day. If you don´t like it you have many options in a minute walk. Staff will really try to help and solve all your needs. Air conditioning is noisy but i solved it unscrewing the front pad. We loved this hotel.
